Reviews.Title: “High-tech design”
Reviews.Author: SKCTokyo
Reviews.Content: I ended my month in Italy with three nights at Suite Dreams. Ignoring the sophomoric pun, I enjoyed this hotel very much. It's bare bones. No public spaces to speak of, except the breakfast room. The rooms are on the 2nd and 3rd floors of an old building that houses another hotel, or more. But, the design is thoroughly modern and was a nice break from the other "standard" hotels in which I stayed in Italy. My room faced the small street, but with electric shutters, the room was both quiet and dark. As with another Rome hotel in the same area that I just reviewed, the location is nowhere land. Close to the train station, but quite far from all the major tourist attractions. This may well be an advantage to some travelers. Unexceptional breakfast (3/5). Enthusiastic, but relatively inexperienced front desk staff.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasent”
Reviews.Author: lottieCtheWorld
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights on a trip to rome. The best thing about this hotel was the location. Very easy to walk to most of the local attractions and yet be value for money. Rooms were cleans and always smelled nice, weird thing to say i know but it does make a difference. Reception was very helpful in getting around and directions.

Reviews.Title: “Just great”
Reviews.Author: L878765
Reviews.Content: Returned for a second visit. It was just what I wanted - a nice, simple, clean room that is quiet and peaceful and doesn't cost a fortune in a fairly central district. Bed nice and hard, air conditioning effective, and I slept really well. Reception friendly, but my main memory is of somewhere that is just peaceful, a real plus in such a hectic city.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: KiwiandCheese
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights here in early April and throughly enjoyed it. We almost walked right by the hotel as there isn't a sign for it other than a nameplate on a door buzzer, we were lucky to have stopped and checked the map at the right moment. Upon check in the lady at the desk was very helpful and attentive. She showed us to our room (which was right across from the reception desk, more on that in a minute), and immediately gave us a water boiler for our baby and a hair dryer. We notified the hotel that we would need a baby cot for our 11 month old daughter and it was set up and ready for use the minute we got there. The rooms are decorated in a minimalist fashion which worked for the ambiance of the hotel. Our room was good sized, comfortable and clean, as was the bathroom. The location of the hotel was perfect because we were able to get around quite easily. We walked to the Colosseum and the Spanish Steps, plus a metro station was very close. The hotel is on a quiet street close to a main drag but there wasn't too much street noise which was nice. The morning breakfast was great, I absolutely loved the croissants. The staff was friendly and everyone that we encountered spoke English which was helpful since this was our first stop on our vacation. A gentleman at the desk recommended a good restaurant that many locals go to within walking distance. It was quite delicious! My only complaint is that it was quite easy to hear everything that went on in the reception area in our room, H. I'm sure that was because of the hardwood floors, everything echoes off of them anyway. It wasn't too big of an issue but if you're a really light sleeper I recommend packing some ear plugs just in case. Overall we enjoyed this hotel and would definitely book again.

Reviews.Title: “They have thought of everything”
Reviews.Author: summairu
Reviews.Content: Especially liked 24 hours computer center with internet in the lobby, where you can print boarding passes etc. They have guide books for your reference during your stay. Wireless is free. Very clean, good sized rooms. Breakfast was decent. 10 minutes walk to roma termini. You can take the terravision bus from the airport to termini for 4 euros only (and then walk to the hotel). Closest metro station is republica. But it is walking distance to most rome sights or take bus 64 which goes to almost every tourist site.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and modern rooms.”
Reviews.Author: sun4h
Reviews.Content: We stayed in two adjacent and symmetrical rooms (blue and green). Rooms were very modern and very clean. The bathrooms were spacious and clean. The beds were quite comfortable. Each room had an electronically operated shutter that opens and completely shuts. The hotel was conveniently located within walking distance from the train station and just next to a metro station. The staff seemed a bit passive but very helpful when asked. We asked for a restaurant recommendation and they gave us a list. We tried three of them that were close by and they were all very good!

Reviews.Title: “What we needed, nothing more, nothing less”
Reviews.Author: Craig B
Reviews.Content: The reviews on TripAdvisor were quite good. This is a great, clean, rather spacious (based on other feedback on other hotels) room. The free wi-fi worked great, the front desk staff was always friendly and helpful, and the room was great. Also the location so close to Repubblica Metro station was a great bonus. It made getting around Rome quite easy. It was also reasonably quiet, and the AC in the room worked great. We didn't eat the breakfast because of the price (15 euros), and the face that a 1.50 euro cappucino and a 1 euro croissant at any of the local coffee shops was enough for us at breakfast. We saved the big meals for lunch and dinner.

Reviews.Title: “When in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Adam P
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a long weekend in Rome, We have been lucky enough to experience a fantastic time thanks to the suite dreams hotel and its staff. The hotel is situated in a fantastic location and the staff do everything in there power to ensure you enjoy your stay. On arrival they showed us the best routes to get to the tourist attractions and how to beat the queues. thanks to everyone at suitedreams

Reviews.Title: “Your second home in Rome”
Reviews.Author: HongKiwi
Reviews.Content: Excellent boutique hotel located within walking distance of Roma Termini at Republica. Warm, welcoming and very genuine owner who is very happy to share his knowledge with guests, and proactive making good & important suggestions such as - "Would you like a hair dryer? Would you like to watch a movie?" As an aside, the hair dryer is the best we've ever seen in a hotel and we'd actually like to take it home. Other great features - rooms nicely appointed, comfortable bed and pillows, free wifi and morning coffee & electric outer windows to shield street light (all very important), Breakfast the best light spread we've encountered so far. The Nespresso machine is tops. Even though it's first floor this hotel does have a small lift. Downsides - busy area so there is some night time street noise, not enough to wake us up after being out walking all day, but we did hear another guest complain about it. If we ever go back to Rome we won't bother looking anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and location”
Reviews.Author: Lilysm
Reviews.Content: Highly recommended. Only stayed for one night. Great location and right by the metro. Great service and delicious breakfast. Please book directly on their website for free breakfast. Excellent value for the location. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel & cool staff”
Reviews.Author: LatkeDePapa
Reviews.Content: It is a wonderful boutique hotel, located two blocks from Piazza della Repubblica. It is very clean and the rooms are very modern. Breakfast is very correct. The staff is extremely friendly. I had an stomach problem, so I needed to enter the room, three hours before the check-in time. Rome (one of the girls at the front desk) let me in early, so i could rest and she put the hotel at my disposal to whaterver i need. Actually, the humane treatment received it was was wonderful!!!!! The price-quality of the hotel, adding to the high quality of its staff, make it a real gem. Thanked Miss Roma and the rest of the staff (The other lady whose name escapes me and the other man). It´s a great hotel. i recomend it!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Rome.”
Reviews.Author: lneary
Reviews.Content: Staff are very friendly and helpful.Breakfast was so good, a great selection to choose from, meats, cheeses, breads, cakes, fruit, cereal. Great coffee also. Our room was spotless. Large shower,all toiletries and a hairdryer included in our bathroom.Lots of storage space. Safe also in every room.Extra pillows and duvets already in your room.Very close to metro station,we walked some days to the sites as they are so close to hotel. Nice restaurants in the area and some lovely shops for buying oils and spices for bringing home in the area.The hotel arranged a taxi to pick us up at airport and we were dropped to the hotel. Very reasonable price. Would recommend this hotel for a city break. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, modern, great location and good service”
Reviews.Author: ellesecho
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Rome for a long weekend, and chose this hotel after reviews on TripAdvisor. We were pleasantly surprised. The room was spacious with high ceilings, clean, modern and very comfortable - a refreshing place to rest after a day out and about. The hotel is located close to an underground station, and within walking distance to the Trevi Fountain and other sights - as well as a few good restaurants. Very convenient. We would recommend, and we would definitely return to stay on our next visit to Rome. A downside was the street noise - there was a dance party on the Sunday night we were there! Fortunately, we were too tired to be bothered about it and soon fell asleep.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Gary C
Reviews.Content: The hotel was recommended by conciergeinrome.com and they had heard of it through relations. Location was excellent, price was excellent, service was excellent. The entrance is more like the many condo/business/apartment buildings throughout Rome and their is no grand entrance or lobby. In fact, you have to go up one floor (elevator or stairs) to get to the check in. Strange beginning but once you're in, the experience was very good. The rooms, while not fancy, were large and plenty of storage space. Breakfast was included as I had booked through the hotel website online. Metro and train station were short walks and very convenient. I sent out laundry once, just the good stuff as it was expensive. I also found a self serve laundry a couple blocks away. We will defeinitely use this hotel on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Sweet dreams!”
Reviews.Author: Lauryn_Sydney
Reviews.Content: No complaints; spacious room, clean shower,excellent heating system ( snowing and super cold outside!), comfy beds. Breakfast was basic but sufficient, great Nespresso coffee machine. Reception always helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location, great rooms”
Reviews.Author: littlemissredsoles
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for a four night stay on the basis of the great Trip Advisor reviews, and was not disappointed. This is a great hotel in a great location and is fantastic value for money - I paid 110 euros per night, the room was big, modern, well-lit with plenty of storage space. The hotel is divided into two sections, one with the reception, breakfast room and some rooms, and then across the stairwell are the remainder of the hotel rooms. The hotel is on a quieter street, my room faced the street and I didn't have any problems with noise, or too much light, as there is a screen that can be brought down in addition to curtains. The hotel is a 10 to 15 minute walk to the Trevi Fountain and Spanish Steps, and a few minutes' walk away from the nearby Metro Station, where you can catch a train directly to the Vatican. It is also about a 20 minute walk away from the Colosseum. The breakfast is simple - continental breakfast only, but there are meats, boiled eggs, cheese, cereal, coffee, juice, croissants and enough to keep you going. Breakfast runs for 3 hours and it was never crowded when I went. The staff were very friendly and helpful, even a family member who called me at the hotel during my stay commented on how polite the staff are. A wonderful base for exploring a wonderful city.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect base in rome”
Reviews.Author: supermoom
Reviews.Content: I chose to stay here based on all the positive reviews and comments posted here. my expectations were high and i wasnt disappointed. the rooms are clean and modern, staff are more than helpful and the location is perfect for sightseeing. would stay here again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: Eagleton
Reviews.Content: I would have given 5 except only for the hot water not working one day we were there, which was a real pain......sorry. Otherwise, this place is top of the tree. It is not opulent or showy, but is a quaint modern variation to the usual roman accommodation options. The staff are its greatest asset. Incredibly helpful. We mentioned our plans on arrival and half an hour later when we left our room the concierge had researched and printed information for us that was relevant to our plans and helped us greatly. Now that is first class service. Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Great customer service”
Reviews.Author: Diana F
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend this hotel based on its customer service. To be clear, I did not stay in this hotel. I did book a night at this hotel but due to a medical emergency in Florence, could not make my reservation in Rome. No one wants to deal with a medical emergency when out of the country and on top of that, no one wants to have to deal with changing one’s itinerary with the potential of incurring extra fees. This hotel was very responsive to my inquiry and was extremely understanding about my changed circumstances. I did not end up staying in Rome but when I do, I will stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: ParqueTropical
Reviews.Content: Really lived up to the other good reviews. Just a few minutes walk from the Termini and metro station and only 10 mins walk to the Trevi Fountain. We only paid 80 euros per night and this made it excellent value for money for central Rome. If you find it on a map don't be suprised if you walk straight past it as it is one floor of a larger building and the only signage is a small plaque at the side of the door entrance buzzer. The receptionist was fantastic - couldn't have been more helpful providing all sorts of info, printing off train times and giving us notes on direction and stations etc. Buffet breakfast was included as we booked via their own website. Excellent mix of meats, croissants, cheese, jams, yoghurt, toast, fruit, cereal etc. etc. All very fresh and well presented. Room was nicely decorated, spotlessly clean and very contemporary with large ensuite shower. All in all an excellent hotel which we would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Modern”
Reviews.Author: Travis A
Reviews.Content: We stayed there three days and this hotel completely met our expectations. The staff of front desk were very friendly and helpful. Nice breakfast, convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Service Modern Clean Room Great Breakfast !”
Reviews.Author: Kinda L
Reviews.Content: Believe the reviews. The hotel staff is very nice and helpful. The room is clean modern looking and the wifi (free) is well received. The location is very central with close proximity to the Republica metro station and close to a major bus stop (a lot of lines get to that station). Book if available and enjoy !

Reviews.Title: “Cosy place to stay”
Reviews.Author: dabitrr
Reviews.Content: Small, cosy and stylish hotel; well located: 2 minutes from Republica metro station, 10 minutes from Termini and 15 from the Fontana di Trevi. The bathroom is great and the breakfast has good quality but lack of variety. The only disadvantage is the price, which is a bit expensive.

Reviews.Title: “I feel duped by the 14 ranking on TripAdvisor.”
Reviews.Author: GettingThereJoe
Reviews.Content: Say that you own a space on the 2nd floor (American 2nd floor, Italian 1st floor) in an anonymous building about five minutes from the Rome train station. How do you get people to come to your hotel? Do you put a ton of money into designing the it with high end furniture, Herman Miller, Eames, etc..., get the a first rate staff that are totally in tuned with your guest's needs, clean out the room so well that you don't question its cleanliness, provide local information (maybe a map) and use high end bath products? Or do you just go to IKEA, buy pseudo design hollow side tables, leave blond hairs on the sheets, keep the water pressure in the shower as low as possible and hire someone to write the crap out of the reviews in Trip Advisor? I think most honest people would the do the former. I cannot imagine SuiteDreams doing anything else but the latter. $242 US for one night in Rome and my bride was afraid of bed bugs. #14 should know that its guest do not want to hear a foreign Asian language (Vietnamese maybe) all night. I know its your hotel but if your guest's room is only 10 feet from the check in desk, please be considerate. (I'm Asian by the way) I don't know why they didn't ask us how our trip was or if we needed a map. Or why they do not put the extra comforters in the closet in a plastic zip around bag so it doesn't smell like a cheap wood closet. Why even have pillows if they are going to so thin that all night, you toss and turn, thinking about the inevitable crick in your neck the next morning. I don't know if I should blame this place for being fraudulent or Trip Advisor for allow the forum where a company clearly does not deserve a 14 ranking but somehow attains it. Its not a terrible place for $100 a night. Its not a terrible place for a 500 ranking. But it is a terrible place for what I paid and what its ranked. Shame on you both. Oh, even though its called Suite Dreams, not all the rooms are suites.

Reviews.Title: “A Fantastic Find”
Reviews.Author: QldTraveller62
Reviews.Content: Once you find where it is hidden - this hotel is a great base to see Rome from. The rooms are large, internet access is great, breakfast is very good - and the front desk staff couldn't help you better if they tried. Located justa round the corner from Termin Station - is a perfect spot too. Lots of great restauarants in walking distance . The best hotel on my Europe trip :)

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected”
Reviews.Author: Naomi75
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Rome for 2 nights after a 7hr drive incl a 2hr traffic jam, a detour due to a closed autostrade, and after getting lost for an hour. We were tired, stressed, cranky and hungry and it was 9.30pm at night. Piers could not have been more helpful. He very quickly gave us the rundown on the hotel (which is actually 2floors in a secured townhouse shared with 2 or 3 other hotels), a city map highlighting all the historical landmarks and the best routes as to how to get to them, and breakfast details. There is an antiquated lift which only fits 1 person and 2 suitcases, so Piers insisted on carrying my suitcase up the stairs, taking us to our room and showing us where everything was inside (we had the White room - the rooms on the first floor have letters rather than numbers, and on the second floor they are colours - the White room was fabulous!). Breakfast was cold foods, but plentiful and delicious, wifi free and with excellent coverage. The location is excellent - everything is within easy walking distance, but the hotel is far enough off the main streets to be quiet. There is no parking in the hotel, but it is next door to a parking garage which is locked up overnight and is reasonably priced (for Rome, anyway). All staff are very friendly and speak excellent English . No complaints here - really happy we booked this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: MitchellKW
Reviews.Content: My colleague and I had the pleasure of staying at the Suite Dreams Hotel during the week of December 19. From the moment we arrived, we were treated with the utmost care. The owner/manager spent an exceptional amount of time with us going over the map and familiarizing us with the city. We were immediately made to feel at home. The hotel was well equipped with numerous travel books, DVDs and equipment to make the stay more pleasant. Requests for hair dryers and kettles were immediately satisfied. The rooms were spotless and the cleaning staff did a wonderful job and were exceptionally friendly. The bed was extremely comfortable. The automatic window shutters blocked out all the light and much of the street noise. The internet connection was perfect and speedy. There were ample clean towels and a fridge for refrigerated items. The television had an adequate number of English channels from the US and UK. The hotel is located on the second floor and there are only 15 rooms. It truly felt like you had a home in Rome. There was only one small negative item which may well be beyond the control of the hotel. The temperature in the shower was not constant. It would get really hot and then suddenly cold until it finally regulated itself. That certainly did not spoil the stay. My colleague and I travel to many hotels in many parts of the world. Suite Dreams is at the top of the list.

Reviews.Title: “BEST Hotel experience ever”
Reviews.Author: holly b
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I were visiting Europe for the first time and Rome was our first stop. This was the best hotel we could have possibly picked. We were a little nervous about language barriers and finding our way around....We were seriously blown away by the staff's helpfulness! All of the staff spoke excellent english and went above and beyond helping us with directions and recommendations for restaurants and things to do in Rome. When we got there the front desk man got out a map and highlighted all the different areas he thought we might be interested in and talked us through the sub system there. (We went by the map he gave us the entire trip!) We weren't sure how we were going to get to Florence and they helped us look up train tickets and figure out which station we needed to come into in Florence. The rooms were very nice, more spacious than we expected. The cleaning lady did an excellent job every day. Nice bathrooms, super nice showers. They had a dvd collection that we could borrow movies from and also a little assortment of Italy travel books we could browse through. We asked for extra pillows and they happily obliged. Free water bottles every day... what else could I ask for right? We would stay here again... again... and again. They do not have that many rooms so it allows them to really cater to their guests.

Reviews.Title: “Good price and location mean excellent value”
Reviews.Author: ssebastiantravels
Reviews.Content: After a long flight to a big bustling city, it was great to have a quiet room in an accessible location at a reasonable price. The hotel is near Via Nazionale and near the train station and bus terminal. Once you figure out where you are, it's a short walk to the hotel which is on a small side street. Booking went smoothly via the internet and confirmation was quick. The hotel is small and on one floor of a fairly non-descript building. The good news is the property is very quite given the fact that you are in a busy urban area. The room was modern, minimalist with a comfortable bed and nice bathroom. My wife joined me a couple days later and we did quite a bit of shopping as Saldi was going on everywhere. The room was large enough to handle all of our swag and remain comfortable. Wifi worked well. Getting around was easy as several sites are within walking distance, buses and metro are also within one block. The breakfast was very simple and since I was in Italy I preferred to find more interesting food elsewhere. A fantastic restaurant for lunch and dinner called Target is right downstairs. We would stay here again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent option for staying in Rome”
Reviews.Author: dino c
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a centric hotel in Rome we highly recommend suite dreams. We stayed at suite dreams two nights, staff at the reception were very kind and helpful, even they borrowed us a roma guide. The location is very near from the main touristic attractions, so we went walking everywhere, and the neighbourhood was safe. The main thing that we loved about the hotel was the breakfast, it was delicious and generous. The room was clean and quiet, and something that we appreciated a lot was that they put bottles of water free of charge in your fridge everyday. Also there is one computer with internet connection available, and there is the option of leaving the luggage after the check out for some hours there . To sum up, suite dreams hotel is an excellent option to stay in. Thanks suite dreams for everything. Ciao.

Reviews.Title: “Alright”
Reviews.Author: MDS_JS
Reviews.Content: This hotel occupies just one floor of a weird-looking building, but in itself it is new, modern and clean. The room is quite bare, but also spacious and clean. Good location, near the central station. Girl in reception was polite, but didnt really know anything about Rome. Hotel is alright, room is alright and breakfast is alright. In summary, the place is alright - nice but forgetable.

Reviews.Title: “A Little Gem!”
Reviews.Author: rmc2412
Reviews.Content: This was one of the best value hotels we stayed in on a 5 week trip to Europe. It's a small boutique hotel within walking distance of Termini train station, the colosseum, other attractions shops and restaurants. The rooms were modern, clean and spacious. Free wi-fi and a simple breakfast of cereals, fruit and toast was included and served in a lovely light filled room. The service was fantastic! They assisted with every request as if it was no problem at all from organising taxis to printing and scanning reservation forms for other hotels we were booking. I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay for the weekend”
Reviews.Author: Davehoffs
Reviews.Content: Very friendly staff. Outstanding location. Great breakfast. All in all well worth it. Maybe a little noisy for light sleepers, but this is Rome and maybe my window shutting properly would have helped. Didn't notice until the last night. I would thoroughly recommend it. It won't disappoint.

Reviews.Title: “To be or not to be ... in a room by the street”
Reviews.Author: Beni80
Reviews.Content: This cozy hotel is located perfectly close (10 min walk) to the train station. Also, it is in close proximity to most attractions of Rome. The rooms are spacious and clean. If you're like to get a room that doesn't faces the street, this is the place to stay. We were not that lucky! We barely slept 2 of the 4 nights we were there. Maybe some better isolation or better windows can fix the issue. Other than that, no complains. The breakfast was awesome too.

Reviews.Title: “Good base for sight-seeing Rome. Efficient place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Fionarina
Reviews.Content: This is a place to hang your hat at the end of a long day sight seeing. It's conveniently located and has a great restaurant near by, called Target. The rooms are spacious, and the beds are harder than what most Americans are used to. Free wifi and breakfast included in the rate. Breakfast is basic but abundant and the coffee is on par with what you would find in a cafe. The staff in general are very helpful and take time to answer your questions. Good for business travel, family with children, and couples travelling. Not a honeymoon type of hotel though. Roma at the front desk is a great asset to the hotel. We stayed four nights.

Reviews.Title: “Can you love a hotel?”
Reviews.Author: Deb7111
Reviews.Content: I think I am in love with Suite Dreams. It is pretty perfect: super clean, great beds, delicious breakfast, convenient location, white sheets and duvet, roomy, modern bathroom, quiet, and lots of personality. My favorite part was the helpful, competent, friendly staff who were gracious, even when teaching us how to make our own cappuccinos at breakfast. You can pay a lot more in Rome, but I bet you can't find a better overall experience, especially at their great prices.

Reviews.Title: “Clean & Modern”
Reviews.Author: evillemom
Reviews.Content: The Suite Dreams Hotel is in an excellent location near most of Rome's major attractions. It is very clean and modern, with a spacious shower. The breakfast was much better than expected, with many choices including hot croissants.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very clean and contemporary”
Reviews.Author: emiow
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 3 nights at Suite Dreams and had to write a review to say how friendly and welcoming the staff are. They recommended a couple of excellent restaurants and showed us all the key sites on the map. It is easy to walk to most of the sites - we did it with 2 children aged 7 and 9. Our suite A was very quiet and spacious for a family of 4 with 2 basins, jacuzzi bath and separate shower. I'd highly recommend it and definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Worth every penny!”
Reviews.Author: u425868
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 5 nights. Breakfast was delicious and the room was comfortable and spacious. Very modern design, refreshing shower and very clean all around. Hotel is within walking distance of Roma Termini station and also the metro station. Lots of places to eat and shop in the area. Cab fare was about 50 euros to the airport. Hotel is kind of secluded and on the 2nd floor (1st floor European style) and the reception is staffed 24/7. All receptionists were extremely helpful and knowledgeable. Loved staying at SuiteDreams and would definitely stay here again in the future. I booked this room based on Trip Advisor reviews. Thanks Trip Advisor!

Reviews.Title: “Clean room, horrible street noise”
Reviews.Author: RVRC
Reviews.Content: The staff is great and the rooms are clean and spacious and you do have great WiFi access, for free . That is about where it ends. The windows are terrible. You hear EVERYTHING outside all night. You might as well sleep with the windows open. The only relief you have from the noise are the shutters that you can close at night. They block some of the noise. The location is great for the metro and train station, but you pay for that with constant traffic noise. While the rooms are nice you can easily hear the guests in the room next to you. Like crying babies. Hope you like a firm bed, because that's what you'll be sleeping on. We took the extra comforters out of the closet and placed them under the covers for extra padding. It helped. If you are a light sleeper, this is NOT the hotel for you. The breakfast they serve is extremely basic. I ate it one morning and not again. I find it funny that as I'm trying to post this review, their Internet went down. Ugh!

Reviews.Title: “Suite Dreams Rome”
Reviews.Author: Bet T
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay in this hotel. The staff was very friendly and very helpful. The location is great just near the Via Nazionale. So you can reach the center of Rome in a few minutes. Also the metro station is quite near. The hotel room was very clean, new bathroom and quite a large room. ¨The street in fron ot the room was a little bit noisy, which is normal in such a big city. The breakfast room is small, but enough for the size of the hotel. The breakfast buffet is okay, could have more changes. I could recommend the hotel to everyone who wants to stay for a city trip, near the center with a friendly service!

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased”
Reviews.Author: Jeff M
Reviews.Content: Large new clean room and bathroom. Firm bed. Reasonably close to major sites. The only negative is its on a small side street in a building that is marked by a sign by the entrance about one foot by one foot. You must ride old small elevator to 2nd floor reception area or walk wide staircase. Otherwise we were quite pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, location and service”
Reviews.Author: darkenstormy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at SuiteDreams for three nights in early October, 2011. The staff was very helpful. They provided luggage storage for us before check-in, helped us with directions and restaurant recommendations - they even made reservations for us. The room was spacious, quiet, and very clean, with a modern look. The electric shutters on the window kept out the city noise! The breakfast - which was included in our rate - was superb: meats, cheeses, fruit, cereal, hard-boiled eggs, pastries, cookies, coffee and juices... enough to please all but the pickiest eaters. The location - very close to the Metro station - was fantastic. On the Metro, one Euro gets you anywhere! SuiteDreams offers free Wi-Fi, too. We had room three - across the hall from Reception on the quieter side of the floor. There are only 15 rooms, so you feel more like a houseguest than a tourist. Reception is staffed 24-hours a day. You can't ask for more in a small hotel... especially not for the low rate we paid. I highly recommend SuiteDreams Roma!

Reviews.Title: “Clean & Efficient”
Reviews.Author: Beltayne
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well located and provides a simple service in clean well appointed rooms. The hotel does not provide amenities other than the rooms but this is reflected in the price. I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: vicki64Queensland
Reviews.Content: We would be happy to recommend this hotel for travelers who are after a lovely quiet hotel with friendly attentive staff. It's location close to the train station made it a perfect choice, although arriving at night made it difficult to find as it is on the first floor of a building. Overall this was a wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but noisy at night”
Reviews.Author: Koren001
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Suitedreams hotel because we took the recommendations from tripadvisor. The rooms are indeed spotlessly clean, tastefully furnished with a "boutique hotel" feel, well-equipped and with very comfortable beds. The staff are very friendly and helpful and even provided a car and driver to take us to the airport at the end of our stay. The breakfast is fine for the price and, all in all, this is a nice hotel to say in. The location is excellent as main sites are within walking distance e.g. Colosseum, Trevi Fountain, Pantheon etc. It is close to the Termini railway station and major shops etc. The only reservation we had was the noise at night, which was overwhelming on our second evening. The management kindly compensated us with free breakfast but even with blinds down, the noise can be irritating.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my stay!”
Reviews.Author: ofoo206
Reviews.Content: We visited SuiteDreams while on our honeymoon and it was perfect! Going into the stay, I hadn't done much research on the hotel, but had read it had a good location and was clean, so I booked it. The good location and cleanliness turned out to be very frue, but on top of it, the staff was very nice and helpful. The rooms were nice and spacious and had a very modern feel. One thing that was a bit of a surprise, was that it is in a building that is home to other hotels as well. SuiteDreams takes up one of the floors and I would consider it to be a boutique hotel. That being said, we enjoyed it thoroughly and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Just Right!”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravellots2
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated well, as it is close to Metro, bus stops, and Termini. We were also happy to get a good nights sleep (didn't last trip to Rome... different hotel) , as the hotel is on a small street. We took a triple room which was large enough for three adults. The larger rooms are in a separate area across the hall, where it is exceptionally quiet! The breakfast was quite good as well. We would stay here again if in Rome. If you are looking for a clean, functional, QUIET, facility... stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Beate_74
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the SuiteDreams for three nights at the end of June. Perfect location with busstops nearby, and wonderful rooms. We would definetly stay here again:-)

Reviews.Title: “SuiteDreams is definitely a sweet choice when in Rome”
Reviews.Author: GlobeTrotters247
Reviews.Content: We have visited Rome twice before on longer stays and have stayed at an upscale hotel with upscale prices. After reading reviews on SuiteDreams, we decided to give it a try on a recent stay. The only negative review we had read was from an individual who had been given a room opposite the registration desk. On check-in, we were given that room. When I expressed our concern, the manager showed me another room on the second floor. We opted to keep the original room as we had started to unpack. We had no noise issues and were truly impressed with the sincerity of the manager and the helpfulness of the staff during our stay. The location was convenient to the two locations of the Museo Nazionale planned to see and other spots of interest. We were given a reference for a nearby restaurant that ranks with the best we have experienced in Rome, and the hotel breakfast was a good and appreciated start to the days. Thumbs up to the internet connectivity as well!

Reviews.Title: “Confortable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: elizman
Reviews.Content: We choosed this Hotel by reading Trip Advisor guest comments. We spent there 4 nights recently. Rooms and Bathrooms are well equipped, modern, clean. Staff was really kind and helpful. Good Buffet Breakfast. Transfer to Fiumicino Airport took approx. 40min. Via Nazionale and Metro Station Republicca are quite near, We found some trattorias , pizzerias and also some restaurants nearby. It is a quiet, nice and boutique hotel. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Funky but chic”
Reviews.Author: Driftwood2558
Reviews.Content: great helpful staff, a quiet side street location and the boutique modern style made a welcome contrast to the ancient Roman and Renaissance stage show going on outside. A good Continental breakfast and free wifi allowed you to set out for the day on a full stomach and fully prepared for a hard day's streets and sites of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Just Right!!!”
Reviews.Author: SeniorTravelers8
Reviews.Content: Although the hotel is just a short walk from the main train station we were glad we arranged ahead of time for a transfer. The driver met us at Rome (FCO) and quickly (!) took us for our first view of that lovely city to the SuiteDreams Hotel, which is tucked away in a refurbished building on a small, fairly quiet street. We had asked for a room big enough for 3 and there was plenty of room for us and our grandson, especially since we planned to spend most of our time outside. It's a short walk to to Hop On Hop Off bus stop near the station. The hotel recommended Target, a restaurant around the corner, and we ended up having two evening meals there. The continental breakfast was just right for us, especially with the hard boiled eggs. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, minimalist, and comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: 7n1dwarf
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for a trip with my sisters based on TripAdvisor reviews and ratings. We were not disappointed at all. Since we were coming via train to Termini station, I mapped out thru Google how to get from Termini to the hotel. Very helpful since it was our first time in Rome and we didn't know what to expect in terms of street layouts and traffic. I also emailed the hotel to ask them how to get to their location from Termini and another option is to take the metro (line A) to Repubblica station, which is about 2-3 blocks away from the hotel. We opted to walk from Termini to the hotel, which wasn't an unpleasant experience at all. The hotel is in quiet street, with reception and most of its rooms on the 1st floor (2nd floor for us Americans) of an old building. The lift is small and very old so it can only accommodate a certain number of bags and people. We only used the lift twice - once when we checked in with our bags and the other when we checked out, bringing down our luggage. The hotel staff are very warm and welcoming. They immediately showed us a map to let us know where we were and our proximity to different must-see attractions. We were also asked if we needed wireless Internet connection and immediately gave us the network and password info. We were then taken to our rooms and shown how to work the a/c, etc. Very nice gesture. The rooms are quiet spacious for European standards. The bed was comfortable but we like firm beds so it might not be to your liking if you're into soft mattresses. We loved the modern, minimalist, and Zen-like feel of the room and its bathroom. I especially like the bathroom floor tiles that looked like hardwood but were in fact tiles. The rooms don't come with flat irons and ironing boards but it was easy enough to remedy. We just asked the staff and they came promptly with a flat iron and board for us to use. Breakfast came with our rate since we booked through the website. While continental, it was still filling enough. There was a choice of meats, cheeses, yogurt, cereals, toast, biscuits, and cakes. There were hard-boiled eggs too. The espresso machine was pretty nifty and easy to use. On our first night in Rome, the hotel staff recommended various places for dinner. We wanted really good pasta and they recommended a few places, to the extent of even calling the restaurants to make sure they were open from their summer holiday. The restaurant they recommended, Ristoranti Il GiardiRoma, had such good pasta!!! We had no problems at all with this hotel. The rooms and bathrooms were always cleaned thoroughly and the service was exceptional. Should we ever find ourselves in Rome again, we'll definitely come back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “One night stay”
Reviews.Author: EColigado
Reviews.Content: My family of 4 (wife/two teens) stayed here on our last night in Italy. Conveniently located to Termini, a Metro station, and a bus stop. Well decorated rooms. Ours was modernly decorated in an Asian motif with a large hot tub , quiet, and a fine breakfast was served. The staff was friendly and informative. A look at the other guests suggested that this was a couples' or honeymooners' type of place. The only disadvantage is that the more popular sites, Via Del Corso/Pz Navona/Pz Rotunda/ Campo Fiori are not really reachable on foot at night. One has to depend on Bus 64 or taxi after 10 PM. However you can't beat the price if compared to the hotels near the aformentioned sites.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: MarkM62
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because it was the highest rated in our price range. I'm so glad we did. The location was great, just around the corner from Republica Metro and a short walk from the main station, Termini. There was no shortage of bars and restaurants around the hotel and there was a Spar mini market down the main road. There were three members of staff working reception, all speaking perfect English and so helpful. Nothing to look at from outside but the room was more than adequate and breakfast was fine. Very happy with our choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: emsoll
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights prior to leaving for a cruise. I found this hotel and booked it on the web. The entrance is a little disconcerting being on a very small street with a very small entrance that you need to walk up a flight or take an ancient elevator to get to the second floor lobby. However, once you get there the staff is friendly and welcoming. The overall hotel and rooms have a distinctly modern feel to them. The room was very functional but at the same time well laid out (plenty of space by European standards) and very clean. The bathroom was modern and everything worked fine. The breakfast each morning was basic but excellent although they could use a few more tables. I can't say enough about how helpful the staff was. The hotel is close to plenty of restaurants and public transit which makes it adequate for visiting tourist sites. I would not hesitate to recommend this anyone staying in Rome for a few days for pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “modern and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: celoemar
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel near Termini Station, 15 minutes walk from Fontana di Trevi. The hotel is located in the first floor of an old building, which means that when you arrive in this building you have no idea how modern and clean is the hotel. Excellent staff (Valeria was very lovely and helpful), clean and modern rooms. Excellent breakfast. We left the hotel at 3 oclock in the morning and they offered us breakfast in our room, free of charge...can you believe it? They also have shuttle service to Ciampino Airport with good price. We totally recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend”
Reviews.Author: julie070
Reviews.Content: We stayed in 2 rooms with our 3 teenagers in mid August based on the reviews we had read on Trip Advisor which accurately described the hotel. Although not that centrally located (probably an extra 10-15 minute walk) , it was still convenient enough to walk everywhere and was near the metro station at Termini. We had booked on their website and therefore breakfast (which was more than enough) was included. The staff were very helpful and friendly particularly Valeria who answered endless questions including suggestions for restaurants. My kids loved the free use of the computer in the hallway!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, sure we will come again”
Reviews.Author: burakozdemir84
Reviews.Content: First of all thanks to all staff, for their welcoming, positive and helpful attitude. They tried to answer all of our questions, and helped us out. Rooms were well-designed and very clean. I loved the bathroom, it was very stylish. The location of the hotel was perfect. It was very close to the Repubblica metro station where we had access to all of the major sights such as Piazza di Spagna, Vatican, Colesseo...

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Jennyfer
Reviews.Content: We stayed in 2 rooms in this hotel with our teen children. It is modern and well appointed. The bathrooms are great! Very good value. We had a larger suite which was spacious and lovely for an excellent price for Rome. Many of the main attractions are within walking distance. Great breakfast and excellent service from the staff. We went out for two great meals on their recommendations and we weren't disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: sandwood1
Reviews.Content: Very pleased with this hotel. Location was pretty good, although it took us a while to find it! Took the shuttle bus from the airport and walked from the Termini, not far at all. Although we couldn't check in early, they let us leave our bags there and we were able to get changed and freshen up. Staff were extremely helpful and spoke excellent English. Rooms are clean and spacious. Breakfast was basic but nice. Make sure you book direct with the hotel to get breakfast included in your rate. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Liz W
Reviews.Content: This Hotel exceeded our expectations. A home away from home, a quiet location and within an easy walking distance to all of Rome's attractions. Modern, clean and airconditioned accommodation with that "just right bathroom". All the breakfast trimmings included and to top it off a couple of bottles of water (free of charge) to set us off ready for the day's adventure. Staff were exceptional which added to our European experience. A highly recommended Hotel! Thankyou from room 4, C and last time E

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Choice in Rome”
Reviews.Author: akingsm
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed this hotel. The rooms were very modern clean and comfortable. The staff was more than willing to help with restaurant recommendations, reservations, transfers etc. We felt it was a great value for the price. Although this hotel is a little more off the beaten path, it is still in a nice, safe location with most of the major attractions still within walking distance, although some may require a 30-40 minute walk. Also, the front desk can have a taxi waiting for you out front in 2 minutes at any moments notice. The hotel is located on the second floor and the elevator is extremely small. We had to haul all of our bags up the stairs which was fine, but just an FYI for those like us with a lot of luggage. We would definitely stay here in the future if we ever find ourselves in Rome again and I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Sweet Dreams at Suite Dreams”
Reviews.Author: manonski
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. The owner (and the staff) was very helpful and catered to all of our needs. The rooms are clean and breakfast was fine. This hotel is near the train station. Some touristic places are within a walking distance. If not, you can easily catch a bus to take you there. I would certainly return to this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Sleek Modern Hotel in a Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoTravelingNow
Reviews.Content: We stayed at SuiteDreams for a night when we were in transit through Rome. The hotel was conveniently located near Termini, and within walking distance of great sites and restaurants. The staff was incredibly helpful, and the room was spacious and well decorated. I will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Print out your booking email”
Reviews.Author: L878765
Reviews.Content: Started badly, as I hadn’t printed my booking confirmation (from venere, followed up by an email from SuiteDreams itself), and the guy at reception didn’t seem very convinced that I was to be a guest. He didn’t seem to check my name, just started flicking through a folder of printed out emails, and asked me at one point if I was someone with a completely different surname. My mind was now entertaining the idea of having to find another hotel if this one was full, which is never a nice type of thought to have when you are hot and tired and just want to check-in. I printed my name and asked him please to look at it, but he didn’t seem very interested and barely glanced so I wasn't sure he'd really read it – he just wouldn’t engage - it was as though if he made eye contact or acknowledged anything I said, it might create some kind of moral contract and he’d have to accept that I indeed just might have booked a room. Anyway, after a rather tense wait of several minutes, flicking through his folder, he found the relevant email. Breakfast, he explained, would be 15 Euros because I’d not booked through their website (I’d just clicked on “book” in tripadvisor and it had taken me to venere.com). After I explained that their email of six weeks earlier had said 10 Euros, he said they would honour that, but they had needed to raise their prices since then. At this point he became noticeably more helpful in his attitude, I think because he’d now accepted that I was indeed a guest and not just some stranger who’d wandered in off the street. He showed me the room (how many hotels do that?) and explained the main features, including showing me how to use the air conditioning, and even showed me how to use the tv remote control – very attentive and helpful. He encouraged me to just ask if I had any requests at all. The room, described as the “White Room” was sombre, I’d call it the “Grey Room” personally. There is no decoration at all, not even a small modern picture, which I suppose is nice if you like ultra-minimalism but I found it a bit lacking in personality and finish. I would encourage them to put a painting or print above the tv. Huge heavy net curtains provide privacy from the apartments and offices across the road, but also block daylight out, which meant the room felt permanently gloomy. But in all other respects it is a splendid room, extremely clean, well furnished, with a nice highly polished wood-block floor. Air conditioning was highly efficient, easy to use, with a useful quiet setting for night. The tv had clear menus and good reception, including BBC world service, which I like. Bed was very firm, just as I like it, and I had a very good nights sleep (which is ultimately what you want from a hotel!). Window seems to keep the noise out (it's on a quiet road anyway) and, unusually for a hotel with air conditioning, you can open the window, which is a nice feature. Breakfast was okay but a bit disappointing. I think that is one area where I hope some constructive criticism may help. Coffee is self-served by a nespresso machine, which to be honest I find a bit fiddly and annoying. I’d prefer my coffee to be made for me and served in a cup or jug, or a machine that just makes black filter coffee (or Americano, as Europeans call it). Also, there were no bread rolls, only some rather mean looking bits of sliced bread for the toaster (which, as is the way with those machines, doesn’t really toast, it barely browns it even after two “go’s” through the machine). So, as a vegetarian, I’d have quite liked some cheese, but would have wanted a bread roll to put it on. I saw meat eaters with piles of meat on their plates, and wondered if any of them might also have liked a bread roll to go with it? Yogurt wasn't very nice. Anyway, I think those are things they can work on. Overall I suppose the breakfast is fair value because there was plenty of food and a good range. No smoke detector that I could see in my room, so not sure what the fire detection systems are. The building is shared with other users, including another hotel, so hopefully there are always people around at night who can detect smoke. The reception is constantly staffed apparently. Two small bottles of free water a day (in the fridge, perfect for if you arrive on a hot day) and minibar prices are reasonable. Check-out was swift and easy, the guy had marked my breakfast as 10 instead of 15 Euros, which I appreciated, as I’d suspected I’d have to explain it all again – I agree with other reviewers that the staff, all English speaking, are all good, and go out of their way to look after you. As others have pointed out, the location is excellent, and there are shops nearby where you can buy more water and things. Despite the booking mix-up and rather tense first few minutes there (first impressions....) I still think this place deserved five rather than four starts, and I'd certainly consider staying again on my next trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Staff and beautiful rooms close to Roma Termini.”
Reviews.Author: joconnel
Reviews.Content: Our stay at SuiteDreams was wonderful. From the moment we got there PierFrancesco and his staff made us feel welcome and like we were staying with family. We were greeted promptly and whenever we had a question it was answered quickly. Dinner recommendations were spot on and were easy to find. The room was huge and the extra bed for our daughter was very comfy and large. The breakfast which was provided for free if you booked online was very tasty and offered fresh fruit, meats, cerals and pastries. It was a quick ride from the train station for 20 Euros which was interesting because we took several other cabs from all over the city and it was no more than 8 Euros. When we go back to Rome we will stay here again. This is a modern european hotel with perfect amenities which makes it a must stay in my mind.

Reviews.Title: “Suite Dreams”
Reviews.Author: nunzia24
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Suite Dreams for 3 nights and found it to be more than we had expected. The staff was more than helpful. Upon arrival Pierre-Francesco greeted us and advised us what may be interesting to us and how to get there. He gave us a map indicating routes to and from the hotel. He also gave us his card to call him in case we have problems on our way. This man is a reading encyclopedia with answers to all our questions. The rooms were clean and breakfast was good. The staff went out of its way to be helpful to us. It is centrally located and you can walk to the hotel from Termini Station, luggange and all. Some of the attractions are within walking distance, if not bus 64 for 1 euro takes you to many of the sites. I definitely would return to this hotel. Bravo to Pierre-Franceso and his staff for making our stay more than welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!!!”
Reviews.Author: Budiful
Reviews.Content: So clean so much room best service we received from all hotels!!! Free wifi, Train station 2 min walk but can walk to all attraction within 20 min, would recomend to honeymooners couples very nice and funky!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: RitaThrall
Reviews.Content: What a great place! We had made reservations somewhere a little out of town but decided to move closer in. So glad we did - the staff was fabulous (from their initial e-mail response to our request for a room to a follow-up to our thank you e-mail after the trip.) Pierfrancesco in particular was gracious, helpful, and kind. The 24 hour staffed desk is great, the rooms were clean and modern, internet access was easy, and the breakfast buffet each morning was full of good choices. The staff was responsive to all our questions and had lots of suggestions for dining and sights. Thank you, thank you. We will be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: KingstonTravellers
Reviews.Content: We found SuiteDreams on the internet, and booked directly with the hotel. E-mail correspondence with the hotel prior to arriving was excellent - prompt, and answering all our questions. We arrived at the hotel from a cruise (port of Civitavecchia) about mid-morning, and dropped off all our luggage for safe keeping before going on a guided tour of Rome. Rooms were ready when we got back, and we quickly checked in. Staff at the front desk were very helpful, and spoke excellent English. This hotel is quite different than most hotels we've stayed in. All of the rooms and the reception area are on the same level, and share a common hallway, so the receptionist can see the front door of most rooms. I was worried that we might hear people coming and going, but that never proved a problem (in fact, once we closed the door to our room, it was exceptionally quiet). Room was very nicely furnished and was kept very clean by staff. A/C worked well. Complimentary breakfast was excellent. We very much enjoyed the location. When we left, staff arranged a van to carry the four of us and all our luggage to the airport. All in all, an excellent hotel, with outstanding value. Highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great place but needs a some quality control”
Reviews.Author: islandler
Reviews.Content: Very nice place. I would like to deduct one quarter to one half star, but since they I can't do that I will deduct one star. I can't really find anything wrong with this very nice place. The only other thing is that the tax is not included in the price, which added another 6 euros a day to the price. I would stay here again. I might consider getting something closer to the Spanish Steps to Pantheon area if I could find something of this quality and price near there. I had 2 small concerns which may seem like minor points but they can be important. The air conditioning vents in the default setting in our room number 6 point directly on you when you are sleeping. My wife caught a cold from this. The default setting should be pointing toward the ceiling to avoid this problem or the AC units could be placed on the wall where your head is and have the air vents go out into the room over you. I am not sure if the AC units are attached to an air duct system. I don't think they are. The units are very quiet and have a remote control on them, but the placement and default vent position is bad at least for our room. The hotel owner should assume that people will come into the hotel and have jet lag or be very tired and won't have time or ability to adjust something that should be correctly adjusted to begin with. The other very minor concern is the hand held shower receptacle was loose and so when the hand held shower nozzle was place in it, IT would frequently end up spraying on you or going out of control somehow and getting the bathroom floor all wet.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, we have sweet dreams here.”
Reviews.Author: Sonia_Shen
Reviews.Content: It was our last night in Italy. We were glad we could spend the last moment in this hotel. This hotel is quite new and opened there years ago. Everything is new and full of modern style. But it kept an very very old lift that still works. So you can imagine how people made their livings here in the old days . Although it is not near the train station, there is a metro near it. However, if you like, you can go to the train station by walk. It won't take too long.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, convenient, stylish”
Reviews.Author: jazzers45
Reviews.Content: We arrived minus our luggage (lost en route by Alitalia) and frustrated by the dismal customer service from Alitalia at airport arrivals. But the receptionist at Suite Dreams was the exact opposite: sympathetic and helpful. She immediately took a copy of our Alitalia lost luggage paperwork, promising to chase them up by phone and showed us to our cool and stylish room. When our bag failed to turn up that evening, she provided me with toothbrush and toothpaste to supplement the usual toiletries. During our 5 nights at Suite Dreams we couldn't fault the service: the restaurants they recommended were all good, useful advice and directions on getting around, bus routes etc. All the staff we met spoke excellent English and nothing was too much trouble. Comfortable beds and a brilliant shower in the smart bathroom. The room wasn't large but there was plenty of handing/storage space. The breakfast was better than many much larger hotels with a selection of pastries, cheese, cold meats, fresh fruit. The location is extremely convenient, close to the Via Nazionale where it's easy to get a bus to the major attractions but in a little side street where it's relatively quiet. We tried out 4 of the restaurants on the hotel's list of recommendations, all within easy walking distance. My husband also liked the tearooms round the corner (yummy cakes!). So if you want to stay in a small hotel (no tour parties!) then try Suite Dreams, we enjoyed our stay here and would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT for what we wanted: Simple, clean, nice!”
Reviews.Author: PostingonTrips
Reviews.Content: We got more at this new, clean hotel than we got at the ancient historic Hotel Borocco not far away for 4x the price. Located not far from Termini Plaza (all the buses and rail transport), and not far from Barberini, and within walking distance of the Spanish Steps, we were very happy with our stay at SuiteDreams. WHAT WE LIKED: Clean and fairly spacious for a European hotel. Very clean rooms with nice new linens and simple, clean furnishings. Beautiful, clean, spacious, well-appointed bathroom with full shower, bidet and soaps/shampoos. Staff provided a real American style blowdryer. They loaned us umbrellas when it rained. Free Wifi, plus use of their computer if you need one. Great, free full breakfast. The a/c worked (which surely isn't always the case in Europe). Good location for us. The hop-on hop-off buses are right around the corner. We walked to our favorite place, the Spanish steps, three times (maybe 20 minute walk one-way). Safe area. We walked to the train station (maybe 15 minutes). Lovely and just what we hoped and probably even better than we expected. Good maps at front desk for you to take sightseeing. Generally very helpful staff. Free bottles of water. Small fridge in room. YOU SHOULD KNOW: No fancy lobby; no hotel restaurant. Small one-floor set of rooms. They call it ALLSUITES but it's not really a "suite" in the sense of some three room suite or anything. They are all nice, simple, clean fairly spacious rooms with a small fridge and a great bathroom. ABOVE AND BEYOND: When we had to leave very early our final morning, we were going to miss breakfast, but they delivered an assortment of breakfast items and tea to our rooms free on our schedule before we left! I left items there and they helped me get them back. STAFF: We liked the staff very much; some are a bit more helpful than others, but all are pretty nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Very Clean”
Reviews.Author: yddib
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 night and we booked a suite as there were no available rooms for that night. We were too early to check in but they allowed us to leave our bags and that they would move them to our room when it was ready. When we came back that evening we were brought up to the Black Suite. The room was very spacious with a large jacuzzi in the room. There was lots of room, a large couch and wide screen tv. The bed was very comfortable and the room and bathroom were very clean. We found the staff friendly. I would recommend this hotel to people travelling to Rome. It is close to Termini which was very good for us as we were travelling to Florence the next day.

Reviews.Title: “What a gem!”
Reviews.Author: Marisa_L99
Reviews.Content: I booked three rooms at this hotel after reading the reviews on trip advisor and was so happy I did! It is difficult to find an affordable room in Rome, especially one that is well located, clean, spacious, and has air conditioning. Throw in very helpful staff and free breakfast and you have the perfect hotel for your Rome vacation. If I return I would never stay anywhere else, and have already told many of my friends to book their rooms now for trips in the future. Truly a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Don't be fooled by the building exterior”
Reviews.Author: KevinJ22
Reviews.Content: I was a little worried when I arrived outside the building but pleasantly surprised once inside. The Hotel essentially takes up only the first floor of the building. The Hotel is modern and exceptionally clean and the rooms are spacious and comfortable. The bath was an enourmous jacuzzi which was awesome. Bathroom space is huge although there is no bathroom door and the toilet and bidet are behind a door. Staff are highly attentive and provide good advice in terms of where to visit. Breakfast was very good. I highly recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but ......”
Reviews.Author: riemia
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed this hotel from May 5th to 8th. The hotel was on the second floor of an office building that was located in the center of the city. They had free WiFi and nice breakfast and our room was spotless. We were going to give them "5" even it felt like a B&B till we checked out. We were heading to the port to catch our cruise that day. The reception guy with eye glasses booked a car service for us the night before. He told us that we had to check out by 11:00am but we could stay lounge area till 1:00pm for the car. After checking out, we went to walk, had lunch and back to the hotel at 12:30pm. We satdown by the reception for a while then I asked the reception guy for a bathroom. He replied "It is broken and no one repairs on Sundays unless we pay a million euro". He was loud, very cold and rejective. Then he turned his back to us. He knew that I would be in the car for one and half hours to the port. If their public bathroom were broken they had a lot of guest rooms and housekeepers were busy cleaning them at that moment. The room that we stayed was not even cleaned yet. Couldn't he accommodate a woman who need to use a bathroom? Wasn't there even one bathroom to offer the customer who had just paied $840 for a no star hotel in an office building? I had to run to the pizzeria that we had lunch and ask for their bathroom. When I run back to the hotel, our car was there and the guy was saying good by to us like nothing happened. I couldn't stop my tear in the car to the port. ...... My bitter memory of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Modern and clean”
Reviews.Author: KatesRoy
Reviews.Content: The room was very nice and modern, the staff were friendly and helpful, and the breakfast was very nice. The location was near the train station and very close to Via Nazionale, so it was easy to get places quickly. They gave us a free bottle of wine in our room when they heard we were celebrating a birthday. The price was very fair, and the room was quiet. It only could have been better if we had a view.

Reviews.Title: “SWEET DREAMS”
Reviews.Author: lovejune
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised, the bed is so comfortable and the showers are so nice and modern, the staff is ready to help with anything and everything and the location is perfect! Plus they have free internet!

Reviews.Title: “Good deal, fine location, nothing fancy”
Reviews.Author: ptbooth
Reviews.Content: Wanted something near the train station, and this was basically a 10-15 min walk (follow the main road up to the Repubblica Metro station and it's 2 blocks from there. It's not really what I would consider a hotel, more of a cross between a college dorm and a hotel. It occupies the 1st floor (I.e. Up one flight) of a typical Roman building) with a  24hr receptionist and all the rooms along the same hallway, with breakfast room down the hall (good with standard fruit, yogurt, cereal, and pastries). Room was fine with air con, TV, safe, and free Wifi. Bathroom snug but functional with shower (drain was a bit sluggish). A fine choice for a good price, as long as you don't need a hotel experience with restaurant, exercise room, or more than one hallway's worth of rooms, convenient to the train station.

Reviews.Title: “Great option in rome”
Reviews.Author: PatoyVicky
Reviews.Content: I selected this hotel by checking comments in trip advisor and it was great! Location is very good because it is 1 metro station from train station. Even if you arrive at airport youcan take the express train to the train station and then 1 metro stop. You will have to walk 2 blocks. Coliseum and major city turist locations are walking distance or using the metro. The hotel itself is great! The rooms are very big, modern, with internet. The receptionists were great. Only thing that some people could not like is the tinny very old elevator. You will have to use the stairs, 1 or 2 floors. I reccomend it 100%

Reviews.Title: “Nice and quite - with a private feel to it”
Reviews.Author: CPHDot
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased by our choice of Suite Dreams for our two night stay in Rome. I especially liked the private feel of the hotel ... no big lobby or masses of tourists coming and going. Staff was very friendly ... but on the staff note I do have one big complaint: the kitchen staff (two women) chattered away VERY loudly and CONSTANTLY to each other both mornings we had breakfast there. They seemed to forget that a door slightly ajar does not prevent their presumably private conversation from being heard by all the breakfast guests. As I don't speak Italian I don't know what the topic was, probably just as well. The breakfast was good though ... good choice: yoghurt, fresh fruit, croissants, toast, cake things. Would and will recommend the hotel to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: snelsontravel
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights in May 2011. This was a romantic trip to spend time together and see the sights. The hotel was in a great location, within walking distance from the main train station and only a 3 minute walk from the metro. We tended to walk to all of the sights as there is so much to see around every corner in Rome. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. The room was an adequate size and the bathroom was very big. Breakfast was very good and we were able to get some food early one morning before setting off for the Vatican (Tip - book into the Vatican for the first entry of the day and head straight for the Sistine Chapel - you miss all of the crowds). We had forgotten our plug adapter but the hotel had a selection (probably what other tourists had left!) that we could choose from to use. The hotel was near a street with plenty of shops, including a Spar, and there were several restaurants nearby. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific boutique hotel in prime location”
Reviews.Author: Deepbluc
Reviews.Content: I must give my thanks to my partner for booking this hotel. She, like myself, has 'roughed it' in the past and agrees a bit of luxury is nice to have as one gets a bit older! This hotel is 10 - 15 mins walk from Stazione Terminale and less than 5 mins walk from Repubblica Metro station. The hotel is on the first floor. Take the stairs as it's quicker unless you have heavy bags. The staff were very friendly and provided annotated local maps on request. Our room was spacious with an ensuite and A/C. The electric shutters completely blocked out the light at night. Breakfast was excellent, with a good variety of options. There was a small library of books and magazines to read. The numbered rooms are away from the reception desk seem quieter, than the lettered rooms. Also there is free wifi to use, which the reception provides, plus there is a computer that can be used in the hallway. The reception is open 24 hrs, so no problems with getting back late. In the local area, there is a very good and moderately priced restaurant called Target just below the hotel. Avoid Dagnino which is closeby- read my review for details. There is also a cheap and lovely Trattoria on Via Napoli. Ask the reception staff for local recommendations! All in all, a very good hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely location & very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Mane007
Reviews.Content: My mum and I staed there from 6 to 9 June. The hotel was very nice. Rooms were good size, very clean and very quiet! Staff was helpful. We could leave our suitcases after having checked-out. Location is great, you can walk everywhere from there. It is very central but not very busy. It is located in a nice and quiet area, round the corner from Metro Republicca and less than 10 minutes walk from Roma Termini. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Relaxing and Modern Spot!”
Reviews.Author: workanai
Reviews.Content: At the end of our 13 day trip throughout Paris, Venice, and Florence, my husband and I were ready for a place to relax! Although Rome is a city of amazing sights, it was great having this hotel to come back to rest our feet. First off, it is really close to the Republica Metro station, and also close to Termini station if you are planning on taking a train in or out of Rome. We easily walked from the Termini station to the hotel, with a map in hand. A lot of reviews said this place was hard to find, so we kept this in mind when we were wondering the street of Modena. But it was fairly easy to find. So location, in terms of using this as a connector to jump on the Metro was great. It was also not that far of a walk from the Colliseum. We actually walked everywhere (Trevi Fountation, Spanish Steps, Piazza Navona) except the Vatican and the area around the Pyramide stop. It probably took half an hour to the Piazza Navona, which was the farthest walk. The establishment itself is very modern and chic. I loved it. The black out blinds were key to a peaceful night's sleep. In addition, the breakfast was fully stocked with great foods ranging from pastries to fruit. The espresso machine was awesome- and we used it during the day as well. Also, they provide two free bottles of water/day. The staff were very friendly and set up our car ride to the airport. They also printed out any documents that we needed from our laptop as we did not have access to a printer. If you stay here, I would recommend eating the the Target Restaurant. We only found it on our last night. They had great service and good food. Overall, this place is great. We are definitely going back to Suitedreams when we go to Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Cute and clean”
Reviews.Author: ande2980
Reviews.Content: Good location, near metro station. A little difficult to find (sign by door is very small and you don't see it until you are literally in front of door) so I suggest printing map in advance. Rooms are spacious and clean! Bathroom was one of the best we had in Italy. Breakfast is a great deal (free with room) and delicious. Friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely a perfect place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: satravelers4
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to Rome with our two twenty-something children and all agreed ( which is saying something) that SuiteDreams is a "come back" hotel. The rooms are modern,pristine, roomy and quiet. The windows have these clever electric metal closures that block out 95% of the street noise and 100% of the light. The private baths are also large, pristine and better than some 5 star hotels we've stayed in. The daily housekeeping was amazing, and provided ample clean, soft linens daily. The reception, houskeeping and breakfast room staff was very friendly, (most English speaking) and couldn't do enough for us. As for location, it couldn't have been better for our sight-seeing purposes. All in all, we feel that this hotel is a perfect place to stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Another successful experience”
Reviews.Author: bernandgale
Reviews.Content: We stayed at SuiteDreams a few years ago. This time I booked 4 rooms for our extended family from US, Sweden and Singapore. The rooms are large, modern, comfortable and clean. The bathroom shower is high tech. The staff (minimal) continues to be friendly and helpful both as to suggestions, taxis, etc. The breakfast is simple but abundant and good with a wonderful Nespresso machine. This is more a B&B rather than a formal hotel. It emcompasses the entire 2nd floor of a old residential building two blocks from Plaza Republica. I would stay again. And you can't beat the value (180 euros) in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “excellent place to relax when travelling a long trip”
Reviews.Author: dona_roads
Reviews.Content: having a long trip to get to Italy, i needed a relaxing place to end the day, had all i needed during my travels. food was excellent, service was very attentive, some of the staff did not speak good English, so i had to explain a lot to get my requests done but all in all the hotel was perfect will choose it always when in Rome

Reviews.Title: “Suite Dreams Lovely Place”
Reviews.Author: beachtraveler1001
Reviews.Content: Just having returned from staying two nights at the SuiteDreams Rome I wanted to write what a positive experience we had. Our room was spotless, had a safe big enough for a laptop, a refrigerator with two free bottles of water per day, excellent free wi-fi and was furnished very modernly. The location was right near the metro and a few blocks from the Termini train station. There were many shops and restaurants in the area. We selected this area because this was our second trip to Rome and we would be using the Termini to transport to outside tour destinations.
