The attendants at the front desk were very helpful with recommendations and maps and even called a taxi for us when we needed one. It was there in three minutes. We had a problem with a tour we had scheduled and they were most helpful calling the tour company, straightening things out and getting our voucher emailed to them and printing it out for us. We were in room H which was right across from the front desk and I was afraid it would be noisy but it was fine. Breakfast was a very nice spread. This place is really like a little boutique hotel with only 15 rooms and we absolutely loved it. They staffed the front desk 24 hours.

Reviews.Title: “Sweet!”
Reviews.Author: suehax
Reviews.Content: In a multi-city trip of all good hotel experiences, Suite Dreams was our favorite. We loved the stylish boutique feel of the rooms and the very kind and helpful staff. We booked a family room (Room 6) and it was quite large with a very spacious and nicely appointed bath. The location is not in the heart of Rome's key attractions, but Suite Dreams is a block from both a Metro station and a bus stop and we had an easy time taking public transportation all day and night. It is also in walking distance to the Termini. Tip: You can only get breakfast included with your room if you book directly on the hotel's webstie. All good. Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, family run & very welcoming”
Reviews.Author: Craske
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely small hotel, very clean, modern and in a great location. It's within walking distance of the main train & bus station making it easily accessible from the airport and although it's just round the corner from via Nationale it's really quiet at night making for a good nights sleep so that you can be refreshed for a good days sightseeing. The rooms are spacious with plenty of wardrobe space and a lovely bathroom. The shower is huge with plenty of room to juggle all your shampoos, so nice not to have to squeeze into a tiny cubicle. Lovely soft towels and bedding. Just a short stroll from all the favorite attractions or hop on the underground at the end of the road.

Reviews.Title: “Sweet suites at SuiteDreams”
Reviews.Author: Egonson
Reviews.Content: We travelled six people in the ages of 20-50 to Rome and checked in at SuiteDreams near Via Nazionale after reading all the great reviews on Tripsadvisor. Letting Tripadvisor choose our hotel has not yet failed us, and our stay at SuiteDreams was definitely no exception. It is a modern and charming little hotel in a beautiful building run by two brothers who's family has owned the floor for ages and grew up in the building. Therefore, they treat all customers as family and will be delighted to help you with everything from fixing wine glasses and ice to recommend restaurants and guiding you the way to the best restaurant or Stadio Olympico. The rooms are very clean, bright and modernly decorated. The breakfast has everything that you desire and there is free WiFi for your computer (or you can use the hotels own computer). Good area with a lot of shopping and restaurants, even though the big nearby street Via Nazionale is among the most touristy streets in Rome. However, since Rome's city centre is so small, there is walking distance to almost all major sights in this beautiful and cultural city. There is a restaurant called "Target" that is just around the corner, in the same building as SuiteDreams, that we really would like to recommend. Despite its english name, it is a great Italian restaurant with quality food for decent prices. To sum up, we would definitely recommend this hotel to al of you TripAdvisor readers. In fact, we would never visit Rome again without staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “THE BEST !”
Reviews.Author: Fei-Low
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights before Easter in Suite A. It is very spacious and comfortable for 2 adults & 2 children. The kids sleeps on the sofabeds and all of us had a very good sleep. The bed is firmness of the bed is just right and comfortable. The wifi signal is strong and readily available in the room. The room has 2 unit of split air conditioner which can be either hot or cold. We like this very much as most hotels we stay in europe lacks this form of immediate cooling or heating options. The jacuzzi has been fully utilised during our stay and the finishes in the shower and WC is very good and classy. Breakfast isn't the best due to the limited choice but the coffee machines more than compensate for it. We do not feel this is an issue at all during our stay. The best part of our stay is the host. They make us feel really comfortable and unhindred. We feel that we can ask them any questions and its like asking a friend. It is a very difficult and delicate skills to make your quest feels at home, this is something that a large chain can't do. When we first check in, the briefing and explaination of how things moves & works in Rome was very useful even though we have been to Rome before. The location at first glance isnt that attractive as it is not in the tourist belt but for someone who has been to all the tourist spots, this location is very convenient as the tube station is only 5 minutes walk. We do not feel threatened or unsafe when we walk around the hotel, perhaps it is because it is away from the tourist spots. The rocket restaurant on the ground floor is fantastic. All the restaurant recomndations is good, we tried most of it and we are fussy when it comes to food. We would recommend anyone going to Rome to stay here, infact have just recomended a cousin who may be heading there now. It is better than any 5 stars hotel that has all the facilities which you dont use. This is the Best hotel we stay during our trip to Rome, Florence, Venice, Berlin and Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “All around great stay.”
Reviews.Author: AdriTheTraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights and it was an all around good place. Having wifi was great to get emails. The hotel itself was nice and the breakfast was good. The reception and people who worked there where very helpful and spoke great english which is always helpful in a foreign country. If we could do it over again, we might pick something closer to the Coliseum area. We found the area good, but would rather stay somewhere else. The termini area does get alittle wierd after dark but just aviod the area. The only thing we really did not like was the beds are super hard, so if you are into hard beds you will be fine.

Reviews.Title: “An ideal base in Rome, with great staff”
Reviews.Author: grumpy_sod
Reviews.Content: This is a chic hotel in a very convenient part of Rome. Although it is very near the metro, we walked pretty much everywhere from here and most of the major tourist destinations are within easy reach (the Vatican is easier on the metro). The rooms are comfy and nicely decorated, and many little details have been thought about. Even though our room faced onto the road it was quiet at night. Breakfast was copious and varied (we even got a bowl of Easter eggs on Easter Sunday). What really makes this hotel stand out, however, is the staff. The owner/manager who checked us in then gave us an incredibly useful potted introduction to Rome with suggestions about where to go, information on public transport and the like. He seemed genuinely friendly and eager to help and to please. We needed to have breakfast earlier than the usual times on one morning - no problem. We wanted to check out later than usual on our last day - no problem. In short, a warm welcome, backed up with high quality and attentive service in a great location in Rome. Can't recommend it highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Great base in the heart of the Eternal City”
Reviews.Author: PompeyRory
Reviews.Content: SuiteDreams was the final stop on our three city tour of Italy and we stayed for three nights with our two kids of 9 and 11. We had chosen suitedreams after reading the Trip Advisor reviews and we were not disappointed. The location is in the very heart of Rome, a 10 minute walk from the central station so quite a lively neighbourhood. The hotel itself was the perfect base and the rooms were large enough for the four of us to sleep in and our room even had a jacuzzi!! The staff were really helpful in recommending travel and eating locations and the reception was manned 24 hrs. The hotel has more of a apartment/hotel feel and the kids loved the breakfast and the DVD library for those tired feet afternoons... A great choice for those who want a high quality, comfortable base from which to explore this amazing city.

Reviews.Title: “Very good place in centre of city”
Reviews.Author: CorTheNetherlands
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Suite Dreams for three nights in March and enjoyed it very much. The room was large enough and very clean. Staff was very helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “home sweet home:)”
Reviews.Author: beyzae
Reviews.Content: perfect location & warm staff!! we would like to stay there again and again! we loved it! s&b x x x

Reviews.Title: “Great Value in Rome”
Reviews.Author: irivamon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the SuiteDreams this past March. Rome hotel rooms are very expensive and SuiteDreams provided the most "bang for the buck." The English-speaking staff were nice, extremely helpful and very attentive to our requests. The WiFi is awesome! The breakfast is well worth it, especially since they have a very nice Nespresso machine. The location is convenient to all major tourist sites in Rome and the subway (Republica) is just around the corner. There's a grocery store two blocks on the main street, so you can get reasonably priced drinks and snacks. If you want a nice Italian dinner, Target restaurant is just a few steps away. And the rooms were modern, clean and comfortable. There are a few things to note however about this hotel. If you're expecting 24 hour room service, this is not the place for you. If you are assigned a room with a letter designation, especially G and H, privacy is very limited because the reception desk is immediately outside your door. Ask for a room with a number designation instead if possible. Privacy is not really an issue at night, but if you need quiet in the afternoon or morning, you may be out of luck. Finally, there's a very small lift that takes you to the hotel which may be problematic if you have large luggage. Overall, I highly recommend this hotel for your next stay in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Sweet Dreams in SuiteDreams, lovely rooms, staff & breakfast”
Reviews.Author: ShirlJ
Reviews.Content: Excellent accommodation within walking distance of Rome's main attractions if you dont mind half an hour to hour long walk (best way to see and feel Rome is on foot) otherwise your only 1 minute walk from main road with regular buses and just round corner is the subway/metro/tube. The staff were friendly, helpful, spoke good English which helps when you know very little Italian, they gave us a map on arrival and told us best way to get around the City. The rooms were clean modern and spacious enough for our requirements, we stayed for 5 nights 6 days. Breakfasts were great start to the day :) Staff suggested we purchase a Roma Pass which we did and what a relief, we walked straight past the long queues of people waiting to enter the Coliseum and saved some money - definitely a good purchase. For a romantic nice meal we would recommend going to the Jewish Quarter, and then walking over the bridge to Trastevere for a drink. La Dolce Vita (the sweet life)

Reviews.Title: “Nice small hotel”
Reviews.Author: marimariSwitzerland
Reviews.Content: We stayed there during a short city break in december 2010. The hotel is small - the rooms nice - the breakfast o.k. - a bit limited choice though. I liked the Nespresso coffee very much. If you just look for a good small hotel then this is the one to consider. For a short break the perfect choice.

Reviews.Title: “We felt right at home!”
Reviews.Author: Cioff2011
Reviews.Content: We found hotel suite dreams on trip advisor and were very pleased. This hotel is clean, comfortable, and in a perfect location. We could walk to all the major sites in 20 minutes or less. The main bus station and subway station is right around the corner if your tired of walking. The service was amazing and the rooms were very clean and modern. The complimentary breakfast was good (different then an "american breakfast", but delicious) and the free bottles of water everyday were a nice touch. Also, the wifi worked perfect and was free. We felt right at home! :) We will recommend this hotel to all of our friends and family and hope to return soon!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and clean hotel with really friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: CetiHasu
Reviews.Content: This hotel is modern, clean (spotless!), small and about 3 years old. Great location, walking distance to almost all sightseeing sights and close (3-5min walk) to the station and underground. Only to the Vatican we needed to take bus number 64 (be aware this is the bus where you should keep your handbag tight). You had the buses just around the corner on Via Nationale. We had a suite for our family and that was great. We used the jacuzzi almost every evening after the long walking days. The service at this hotel was excellent, they always gave us good recommendations on local Trattorias and Restaurants and of course main sightseeing sites. The rooms, except for being clean, had free water bottles every day. You could also borrow for free DVDs and books from the hotel. They had a shelf in the lobby. Breakfast was basic and good and you also were free to take fruit from the breakfast room during the day if needed. The room was also very quiet (even if close to big streets and station you could not hear anything!) and had blind folders that made it dark. I must say this was a really good hotel and pricewise not too bad for being in the centre. I could recommend it ANY time!!

Reviews.Title: “Very modern, great night's sleep”
Reviews.Author: HippoPi
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Suite Dreams for three nights in February. The hotel is a 5/10 minute walk from the main station, where the buses and trains from the airport terminate, so very easy to get to. It's down a quiet street, but walking distance to all the main attractions. It was around 15 minutes walk to the Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain, Colusseum, Forum etc. The only place we didn't access on foot was the Vatican (we stopped there on an open top bus tour, but could have also got there easily by metro). When we checked in, the owner gave a us a great map and explanation of where to go and how to get everywhere. We stayed in the suite, which was big and very modern. Lovely bathroom and a great jacuzzi bath. The bed was very comfortable and the black-out blinds meant the room was very dark and quiet at night. The room was spotlessly clean. We didn't get breakfast because we booked through hotels.com (breakfast is included if you book directly with the hotel) but were told that if we fancied breakfast any morning, we could just pay at the time (I think they said it would be 10 Euros each). Water in the room was free and there was a computer I used for free to access the internet. Overall a great modern boutique hotel in a very good location, ideal for a weekend sightseeing in Rome! We also had an excellent Italian meal at the restaurant downstairs, which was very convenient and obviously popular as it was busy on a Monday night.

Reviews.Title: “No frills, excellent service, excellent value”
Reviews.Author: Bertybign
Reviews.Content: I usually stay in the big name hotels but decided to give Suitedreams a try after reading excellent TripAdvisor reviews. I was not dissapointed, this is a nice place to stay with comfortable rooms, lovely shower, satellite TV, free wireless Internet (that works!), mini bar and air con all for 100 euros including breakfast. I arrived late in the evening and the staff were waiting for me with a personal quick check in service. They arranged dinner at a nice restaurant nearby which served local regional food. I had a quiet good nights sleep ready for the next days business. Check out took 20 seconds with receipts etc waiting for me at 07:00. My only negative comment is the hotel location is not obvious from the road outside so it took me a couple of tries to realise that the hotel is actually on the first floor of a residential looking building. Once I had worked this out everything was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: GregKo
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel, great location (walking distance to colosseum, Trevi fountain and more), metro station 1 minute away, lots of restaurants around, very clean and spacious room (we stayed in the Suite that include a big jacuzzi) and friendly staff, free bottle of water in the minibar daily, and free bottle of red wine in the room for my girlfriend's birthday. Perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff, comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: makis_04
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect, near metro station and a few minutes walk from Trevi, Colosseo etc. The room was very clean and comfortable, especially the bathroom (big and modern). The staff was very polite and helpful and the breakfast was simple but ok.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, modern, looks like an ikea showroom.”
Reviews.Author: AranNathanson
Reviews.Content: The location on Via nazionale is very convenient. The hotel is quiet, very clean and neat, and the rooms are well appointed. WIFI works like a charm and the staff is quite friendly.

Reviews.Title: “better than the best”
Reviews.Author: itchyfeetover50
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel is superior, but a special mention for the staff who are the most caring, helpful and knowledgeable about their patch. We stayed at 15 different hotels in our 2 month visit to Europe and this was by far the best for all the right reasons. The rooms are of a great size for the location, and are very quite. The beds and pillows and the quite location ensure a fantastic nights sleep. Breakfast is substantial. The location was a plus but even if it were not so well located all the other reasons make it the only hotel to stay in when in the Eternal City!!

Reviews.Title: “This place is amazing”
Reviews.Author: VtDub
Reviews.Content: Spacious room, super helpful staff, very affordable price, awesome location, and good breakfast that was included in the price of my room. I switched to this hotel after a horrible night at the Forum Hotel. I'm all for the old architecture of the eternal city, but I'd rather have clean modern amenities for my hotel - which is surprisingly difficult to find in Rome. Most affordable hotels in the city have a very dated/antique style with claustrophobic rooms that remind me more of moth balls or haunted mansions. And a pet peeve of mine throughout most of the hotels in Italy is the shoddy wifi. Suitedreams solves all these problems. The room is huge compared to other hotels in Rome for the same price. I even have enough space to do yoga in my room! The decor is contemporary, but still comfortable. It's easy to control the air conditioning and heat, there is a minibar with a free bottle of water every day, a full length mirror, safe, flat screen TV, comfortable chair, and lots of working space for the desk. Best of all -- free, and fast wifi that you can use on all of your devices (most other hotels just give you a single username and password that can be used for only one connection, but at Suitedreams, I have my laptop, blackberry, and ipod all connected). The staff is super helpful. They accommodated all my needs: setting up transport in the morning to get to meetings, calling popular restaurants for dinner reservations, free printing of materials I needed for work, lending me an iron and ironing board, offering to prepare a special breakfast for me when I have to leave at 5am, and lending me utensils when I brought some groceries and wanted to eat in my room. One of the front desk staff, Francesco, is especially commendable - he is the personification of initiative. Without even asking, he seems to know the best solution or have a recommendation for whatever you need. And if all that wasn't enough, they even have freshly baked chocolate croissants for breakfast. My stay at Suitedreams is the best experience I had in Rome for this business trip.

Reviews.Title: “A really great hotel and wonderful staff.”
Reviews.Author: Sevare
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 4 night stay at suitedreams and of course the city of rome is amazing I would have to say that our trip was made all the more magical by the quality and service we found at this hotel. The staff really went the extra mile to be helpful and the rooms were clean, modern and a good size. Getting to this hotel is a short walk from Termini Station so its easy just to jump on the train at the airport. All the main attractions are easy to get to either by a nice walk or jump on the metro or one of the buses which are all just round the corner from the hotel. You wont regret staying here! And it was a good price to boot. If you want breakfast included make sure you book directly.

Reviews.Title: “Warm, friendly experience”
Reviews.Author: StuandKate
Reviews.Content: Our stay at SuiteDreams was a great experience. The staff were friendly, and very helpful - providing maps, transport guides, restaurant recommendations and other useful advice that made our stay easier. The rooms were fairly standard, but clean and spacious enough for our needs. Breakfast was nice, especially as it came free with our internet booking. The location was fantastic - an easy walk to key sights, restaurants and shopping. I'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best of the kind in the area”
Reviews.Author: Sapsopan
Reviews.Content: My fifth stay in the via Nazionale area, to me the most practical location for a mix of ancient Rome plus old city sightseeing, close to the train and metro that bringsnyou to the Vatican in ten minutes + a bit of shopping on the side (because you can since the hotel prices were no rip-off). There's a plenty of hotels in the area like the Suitederams, one floor of an apartment building refurbished. I think there're at least two-three others in the same building as Suitedreams in fact. What all have in common, at least based on my fife attempts there, is the fairly minimalistic design, basic but relevant breakfast and half-present staff. What Suitedreams has compared to the others is always friendly and competent staff and very pleasant design that makes you feel cosy in the rooms, almost like in a five star hotel. Rooms in other similar hotels I tried would almost make me depressed by limited space, simplicity, showers that could barely fit a half of me etc. You won't get this here. Sum up: Main Pros - my favourite location (walking distance to all key sights in fact) - excellent staff - nice, clean, pleasant rooms Main Cons - often loud nights which has nothing to do with the hotel but just with the proximity to via Nazionale. That's Rome though. Next time in Rome, Suitedreams will be definitely my first choice.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: hagolior
Reviews.Content: we stayed in suitedreams for 3 nights in December, it was great! pleasant and helpful service, nice room, very comfortable bed, location is very good as well. good breakfast. we had a stroller so the small elevator was the downside.

Reviews.Title: “excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: JeffGoldCoast
Reviews.Content: This hotel is clean, comfortable and breakfast is excellent. It is difficult to find because it is one floor of the building....the sign is a small plaque next to the buzzer. Once found you realise what a great position it is...walk to station- bus stops- restaurants .Staff are helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: GardenGirl97
Reviews.Content: I booked this boutique hotel for our two nights in Rome the end of October based on Trip Advisor reviews. We were not disappointed. Our driver from the airport knew the hotel's location, and we were prepared for the small elevator. We managed to get us and our bags into the elevator, but being on the first floor, we used the stairs most of the time. Pierfrancesco greeted us, and graciously showed us to our room and took care of our need for a dinner reservation. The room was good size, clean, quiet, and comfortable. The shower was great. If you use a wash cloth, bring your own, and I also brought a larger soap--our personal preferances. The electric outside shutters made the room dark for sleeping, and the AC was easy to use. As others have stated, the breakfast included with an on-line room booking was plentiful with lots of choices. The server was happy to show me how to use the expresso machine. We had a great dinner at Target a short walk from the hotel which was perfect on our tiring travel day . The next night a dinner reservation was made at Osteria Chiana which is owned by Frederico who also owns Suitedreams. This appears to be a favorite restaurant with the locals. We discovered that they do not take credit cards, and we did not have enough euros for both the dinner and the taxi. Frederico was there--no problem, he offered to add the dinner onto our hotel bill. We enjoyed our stay at Suitedreams where their customer-sensitive staff really makes a difference.

Reviews.Title: “The best place ever!”
Reviews.Author: TeodorovRomano
Reviews.Content: We were in our honeymoon and we choose this hotel through tripadvisor. Couldn't be luckier! Staff was really helpful, breakfast was nice and the location was perfect. The only place we couldn't walk to was the Vatican. But we went by metro that is two blocks from the hotel. The most impressive thing was the blinders on the windows. Those were the best nights after 23 days around Eastern Europe. We definitely recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Great place for our splurge in Rome”
Reviews.Author: KRSTWO
Reviews.Content: Suite dreams is a quaint modern, boutique hotel that I was happy to have stayed at. We splurged on a hot tob suite and we used it often after our 2 week journey from train station to station. The rooms are equipped with a duo of air conditioning units that keep things cool after you return from steamy Rome. The staff is courteous, friendly and occasionally helpful, though they couldn't recommend a modest meal for a pair of weary travellers not interested in 4 star 3-course meal (enter Tripadvisor). The hotel is equipped with wifi and a PC that they will allow you to use, though when compared to "Business Centers" it's not quite there - no printer, slow, etc. Breakfast was wonderful, truly the best we had despite the lack of variation in Italian breakfast offerings. Good coffee, better pastries and fresh meat, but still heads and tails above others. The location is quite nice for a traveller. It's around the corner from the Republic metro station and not far from Ancient Rome. Close to Borghessi and several other sites worth visiting as well.

Reviews.Title: “It's expanding”
Reviews.Author: tak3
Reviews.Content: I do not need to reiterate all the positive things being written about Suite Dreams. Thanks to people's contributions to tripadvisor, I often managed to stay in hotels of very high quality, and this is yet another one. Just some minor comments: the modern A/C unit, attached to the top of the wall , had a remote control that allows you to adjust the direction of air flow, thereby averting the common problems I faced in other hotels where the airflow is directed to the bed. Easy to use espresso machine in breakfast room, which can be used to get hot water for 24 hrs, since they take away the coffee after breakfast. For guests who like a cup of tea at night this works well. Valeria , as mentioned in another review, was fantastic..... see her picture attached. When I asked Valeria about public washroom in Rome, another guest standing close to me at the front counter advised me that by law all Rome bars and restaurants have to allow anyone to go and use their toilets, so I didn't have to worry. He reassured me by saying," I know, I own a restaurant " It was only the next day that Valeria told me he's Frederico ( ? spelling) owner of Suite Dreams! ( and I thought he's a fellow guest!) Pierfrancesco that was frequently mentioned here is the general manager. I was informed by Valeria that Suite Dreams will expand by buying up half the upper floor and making them into suites ( I think there will be 6 new suites) targeting opening April 2011. This is good news for those of us who love to return to Suite Dreams.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: gilmore35
Reviews.Content: Close to termini station this boutique hotel is a little hard to find at first (the small plaque on the wall states the hotel name). The rooms are huge according to Rome standards and the bathroom lovely. The staff were extremely accommodating and yes we did have dramas- suspected gas leak and then there was no hot water the next mornjng but they didn't charge us for the night and were extremely apologetic. Sound proof rooms were great and the free in room wifi was super fast and reliable. Was able to walk to trevi fountain, spanish steps and colosseum from this hotel. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Top Hotel with Fantastic staff”
Reviews.Author: tonyb64
Reviews.Content: We had 3 nights in the modern hotel and could not fault it. The overnight staff when we were checking out on the 21st Oct could not have been more helpful(even though he had just done a "double shift". Breakfast on the go supplied as we were checking out early. Very handy to the metro (Repubblica station)

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Roadrunner15
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at Suite Dreams Hotel for five nights in October and greatly enjoyed our stay. We walked from Termini train station (about 10 minutes) to the hotel. I had stayed in another hotel in the building before, so I knew the location and how to find the hotel. We liked the fact that this hotel is only one floor above ground level, meaning we did not have to use the elevator, but could simply walk up one flight of stairs. Of course, the elevator is there to use, if you prefer. I enjoy the quietness and attention a guest receives from a small hotel, and this hotel definitely provides both. The location is close to a metro station, bus lines, train station, unlimited number of restaurants, shopping and the sights of Rome. We felt very safe (of course, taking the usual Rome precautions against pickpocketers, such as not taking passports, credits cards or large sums of money in your purse or pockets.), walking everywhere, including back to the hotel from restaurants in the evening. The staff is outstanding. Each staff member that we dealt with was very top-notch and pleasant. They gladly made restaurant reservations for us (giving us excellent recommendations) and booked our efficient transportation back to the airport. They gave us suggestions, information on everything, maps, sightseeing tips, transportation tips, etc. I must mention Pierre Francesca and Valeria specifically for their professionalism, warmth, helpfulness. They make one want to return to this small excellent hotel again and again. The breakfast, provided free since we booked on their website, was wonderful. There were boiled eggs, meats, cheeses, great breads (including delicious croissants), cereals, yoghurt, juices, water, milk, coffee, and more. Their bowl of fresh cut-up strawberries, kiwi and melon was outstanding. A separate bowl of uncut fruit included FRESH bananas, apples, oranges, tangerines, peaches, kiwi, and plums, etc. - not the usual apple, orange and brownish banana. It was a great breakfast and enough to last till dinner time (with maybe a gelato in between). Our room was quiet, spacious, contemporary and lovely. The bed was very comfortable and provided an extra top sheet in addition to the sheet covering the duvet. The A/C was controlled by us in our room. It worked great. The flatscreen TV had CNN, BBC, etc. The room had electric automatic rolling shutters outside over the window which blocked the sound and light. We slept great. The bath fixtures were of high quality. The shower heads (rain-shower and handheld) were wonderful. There was a bidet and a toilet in a separate room (with a window that opened for fresh air, but had bars outside for security). There was a spacious vanity with double sinks and plenty of room for cosmetic cases. The hairdryer was a good one, so that I did not have to use the one I had brought. The bathroom is very well designed and decorated with upscale stone products - beautiful and functional. There is an computer with free internet for guest use in a niche of its own for privacy. We will be back again (soon, I hope) to once again relax in this welcoming, inviting, lovely, small hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel staff ever!”
Reviews.Author: margueriteOttawa
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at the Suitedreams - based on the excellent Trip Advisor ratings and we were not disappointed. The breakfast (which was included because we booked using their website was EXCELLENT) - The bathrooms were fantastic - the room was smallish and had only one chair. Without a doubt this hotel has the BEST FRONT DESK STAFF of any hotel I have ever stayed. They took a lot of time to explain locations of interest, book restaurants and help us with bags etc. This is a class act!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: davisonfamily
Reviews.Content: Very nice location - walking distance to Colloseum, Trevi-fountain, Spanish steps and shopping streets! Nice, safe neighbourhood, with largest policestation in Rome just nearby - so no problem walking home late at night. Really helpful staff. Very nice breakfast - best croissants I've tasted outside France. Nice rooms - spacious and clean. Good, reliable transferservice to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay while in Rome”
Reviews.Author: duchess7
Reviews.Content: I just wanted to say this hotel was everything that I read about on Trip Adviser. We enjoyed our 2 nights stay in this clean, modern and Comfortable room. I booked through their website which included breakfast and they were quick to respond with any questions about our stay. We organized transfers through the hotel and e-mails were sent back and forward so everything was clear on time of pick., location and payment to driver. Thanks to the staff at suite dreams. Yes if coming on your own its a bit tricky to find Suite dreams as it housed in a large building with other, I guess businesses so best to check the details where it is. Thanks to the review and photo of the door and door bell etc. on trip Adviser which let me know what I am looking for.....but we were glad we got a transfer to hotel as the driver was helpful with pointing out the place. Breakfast was Plentiful and the room which it was in was cheerful and bright. The hotel is close to the Piazza Della Repubblica and the metro stop is there where you can get a daily pass to get to the different places of interest. Saved my feet from walking lots but we did that as well and the weather was very warm and you could walk to places which were possible depending on fitness levels or the desire from the hotel. We loved the restaurants in Rome and found one which I have forgotten the name to but they made the best pear and rocket salad with truffle oil :) We would stay there again on our hopeful next visit to Rome and we hope that you enjoy it too.

Reviews.Title: “Just okay”
Reviews.Author: BayAreaHappytraveler
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Suite Dreams at the end of September for three nights. Our stay was just alright. I was glad that I looked at the pictures on Trip Advisor because the outside of this b&b is not like a typical hotel. The entrance looks like an apartment building and you ring the buzzer to be let in. The check-in process was quick and efficient and we were given a map of Rome which was nice. The room was okay. It was nothing fancy but for European standards was large. The bed was very hard and there was substantial street noise from the Via Nacionale which is less then a half block away. The shower was a bit moldy (there were some mold spots on the shower ceiling and a moldy hand held shower device). It wasn't enough to prevent me from taking a shower. The room included a hair dryer and we were also given 2 complimentary bottles of water each day. We had to ask for an iron and ironing board and I think it may have been the only one for the entire place because the maid removed it when she made up our room and we had to ask for it again. I enjoyed the breakfast. There was fresh fruit, meats and cheeses and breads with nutella. There was also a variety of juices, cererals and yogurts. The location was very close to the republica metro stop and there were many restaurants, bars and shops near by. I wouldn't say it was a charming part of Rome but the neighborhood was safe and provided us with what we needed. When I return to Rome I don't think that I will stay here again but if you are looking for a b&b near a metro stop without frills for a reasonable price that includes breakfast then the Suite Dreams is exactly that.

Reviews.Title: “Great Option in Rome”
Reviews.Author: blschwar
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the SuiteDreams for three nights following a cruise. We looked at reviews for other hotels and more high end properties but the price and values didn't seem worth it. We settled on SuiteDreams as a result of the reviews. The location of the hotel is decent . . . close to the main bus thoroughfare and close to the metro lines. The rooms are very clean, beds comfortable and the linens provided are very good. The room was surprisingly large as was the bathroom. I think the best thing about this hotel is the service. Peter Francesco is the owner of the hotel and gave us excellent dinner suggestions while in the city. I am used to concierge type service at the major hotel chains but I never feel like the recommendations are places they would go to. I feel that Peter took a vested interest in picking places that we would enjoy. He was very proud of his city and wanted us to leave with a great experience. Each restaurant he recommended was better than the next. He would either call the restaurant owner directly to inform them that we were coming over and to take care of us or simply write a note for us to give to the restaurant owner. We are big foodies and the restaurants he recommended were perfect! My only complaint about the hotel is very minor but I will bring up anyway . . . if you stay here, you should be sure to bring your own shampoo, soap and shower gel. They do provide these but they are in such lilliputian quantities! It was the smallest bar of soap I ever seen!

Reviews.Title: “Memorable”
Reviews.Author: Aissabc
Reviews.Content: I would like to commend the helpful and friendly staff, most especially Pierfrancesco and Valeria. My husband and I were made very welcome upon check-in and as I was spending my birthday in the city a few days after check-in, I liked that Piero remembered (he noticed my birthdate when he photocopied my passport) and the staff surprised me with a bottle of champagne on the day. It was a nice gesture which I highly appreciated. The hotel served the best fresh fruit selections compared to other hotels we stayed in during our entire tour of Italy. To my surprise, our room was quite spacious. I loved that they are located within walking distance to the Metro station. I would love to stay at the hotel again when I go back to Rome someday.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service!”
Reviews.Author: looking4hoteldeal
Reviews.Content: We had a great time. The rooms were clean and internet good. Everyone that worked at the front desk was very nice and helpful. Great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but not the best location”
Reviews.Author: Ahlohaa
Reviews.Content: Nice, spacious, clean and modern rooms. You don,t get the great hotel feel since the hotel is one floor up in an ordinary townhouse. Breakfast was ok. Nice touch with a small library and magazines to read in the reception area. The location is close to Termini Central Station, but a bit far from the most interresting tourist areas. The hotel staff was smiling and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Netster35
Reviews.Content: Great staff, friendly and helpful. Lovely rooms, high standard and very clean. The free water is a nice touch. The hotel is well located for sight-seeing and about 10mins walk from the Termini station, with some super restaurants located nearby. We really enjoyed our stay there and will hopefully be staying there on our next trip to Rome! Tip for airport transfer; the bus transfer service that can be booked from the booth at the airport train station is the same cost as the express train service and drops you right outside your hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place to Rest Your Head”
Reviews.Author: lanternlighter
Reviews.Content: I booked three nights in SuiteDreams following reviews from Tripadvisor and I wasn't disappointed. It was on a small side street behind Via Nationzle and is 5 minutes from the train station (Termini) and about a 10-15 min walk from the Trevi Fountain area. I wouldn't describe this as a hotel but a very clean modern guesthouse/ B&B. Its located on the first floor of a classical style Italian apartment building. The room was very spacious, clean and modern and the bathroom was roomy with a beautiful stone shower. The beds were so comfortable and with air conditioning, mini-bar, TV, plenty of wardrobe space it was a great haven. The 24 hour reception always had someone with great English willing to help with directions and advice as to where to go etc. A buffet breakfast was available in the morning with fruits, cereals, juices, breads and pastries available. There was also a Nespresso machine which produces a delicious espresso. I would return here again for my next visit, it is great value for what you get and it's the simplicity of the place that makes it so successful, it does exactly what it says on the tin. If you are going to be spending the majority of your time out and about in Rome and you need a cool, comfortable place to shower and sleep then this is the perfect place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay at Suite Dreams”
Reviews.Author: SandalGirl21
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to Rome but first visit to Suite Dreams, the hotel was really nice, very clean and we had a really big room too, plenty of room for all of our luggage. The bathroom was quite amazing, the shower was huge and could have fitted in 5 people!! We didn’t have breakfast in the hotel but could smell the aromas of pastries, coffee and toast down the hall as we left. While the hotel was really lovely, the location for me, while very close & convenient near the Central Train Station was very touristy and not as nice as other parts of Rome. All in all a pleasant stay though.

Reviews.Title: “Coming from Paris this was a dream so no complaint. Well, maybe one complaint”
Reviews.Author: dellap
Reviews.Content: It was initially very hard to fine this obscure street that barely appeared on maps. Once I found it and the train station it was near (Republica) then no problems. Complaint: This is large building with SuiteDreams on the second floor of the flat. When someone is talking loudly in the common areas/near the receptionist then it came be quite noisy. Oh, and the beds are kinda hard but clean. Free breakfast and free water bottle everyday (during the Summer months...free water is important....CAN ONE SAY H.O.T.!!!!) I loved the hotel and the people. They answered all my questions with a smile. I was given great advice. I have nothing really bad to say. Clean. Safe. Comfortable and Small. I have nothing to say because I had a pleasant stay. Oh, this hotel is off a main shopping street. So shop shop shop.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: 20MandJ
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel largely due to the reviews on Tripadvisor, and they were right. We like to stay within a 15 minute walk from the train station and there are many hotels, all in the same price range. This hotel is modern and tidy - no frills with great bathrooms - nice, big showers. There is a fridge in the room, which is handy too. Close to many sights and a reasonable walk to others. We've stayed at one of the other hotels in the same building (there are a few), but this one was nicer. The breakfast was great too - better than many other places we've stayed at. We'd stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Believe the reviews- it's brilliant”
Reviews.Author: timbo2
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Suite Dreams, Rome in August 2010. We had two rooms, one double and one twin. Total bill for both rooms for 3 nights was £672 or £112 per room per night which included breakfast. I think this is excellent value. The location is really good, about 5 minutes walk from the Republicca Tube station which opens up easy and cheap travel through Rome. A 1 day travelcard was 4 euros. The 'Wedding Cake' is within walking distance The decor is contemporary and immaculate and the breakfasts were really good. The staff went out of their way to assist us at all times. As other reviews have said, it's a little difficult to spot first time because it just occupies a portion of a building so the only giveaway was a plaque near the door, but I would definitely stay here again and I recommend it unreservedly. BTW: The restaurant just around the corner, I think it's called 'Target' or something like that - really Excellent, as was Restaurant Tema (I found it on TripAdvisor - check it out)

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: coolroe
Reviews.Content: This is a great place, I booked it after reading its reviews on Tripadvisor. Trickey to find in the dark at 9pm at night, but we had a great stay once we got there. Very big airy room with plenty of space. Minimal, clean, contemporary decor and a great bathroom. Very helpful staff, and a fab breakfast buffet. Very quiet at night and the AC was silent. Might not suite people who prefer a "traditional" hotel but it was perfect for us and i would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mim094
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in Aug 2010. Myself, husband and teenage daughter in a triple room. The rooms were clean, modern and very comfortable. The staff were exceptional, very professional and always willing to go the extra mile to make your trip perfect. The breakfast was amazing and if you timed it correctly and ate enough could easily keep you going until an early evening meal. It is in a perfect location to access everything, we enjoy walking so did all the sites on foot. Don't be put off when you first arrive by the exterior, there is a real treat waiting for you inside!! Amazing we would definately recommend.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic spot - thank you fellow tripadvisors!”
Reviews.Author: Jats10
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights - my husband and I and are 21 and 18 years old daughters in two rooms. We all thoroughly enjoyed our stay. As other travellers have commented, the hotel is very modern & clean, the rooms are a good size and it is in a great location (though a little hard to find at first!). We were in Rome during a very hot period so the air conditioning and two free bottles of water in each room was extra nice! The staff were all very helpful and friendly. One day, one of our daughters was feeling ill so opted to stay in her room for a few hours with the "do not disturb" sign out. The maids noticed this and told the manager. He phoned the room to make sure she was OK and offered to get her a cup of tea, something to eat, more water etc. How nice is that? I would definitely recommend this hotel for visitors to Rome and will defintely stay there again if (when!) I return to Rome. Thanks to all at SuiteDreams!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: TeachinCa
Reviews.Content: We have nothing but great things to say about Suite Dreams. Location was great - we walked or took the subway at Plaza Republica to get everywhere. Our room was perfect-good size, plenty of storage, good bathroom and great bed - we slept so well each night! The staff was wonderful...we got in early and we're able to easily clean up and store our luggage...they had great recommendations for dining and touring Rome...they were able to change our Vatican Museum reservation for us when we realized we were overbooked..they had a chilled bottle of champage waiting for us to celebrate my husbands's 50th birthday. And breakfast each day was delicious - we especially loved the capuccino machine! It was HOT when we were in Rome, and Suite Dreams was our oasis!! Grazie Suite Dreams for a wondeful time in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay, great service, fab location!”
Reviews.Author: avourlid
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights at this hotel and can't recommend it enough. The location is very convenient - walking distance to Termini train station, Republica for metro, and of course all the main sites - Colosseum, Spanish Steps, Villa Borghese, Trevi, etc. The staff spoke perfect English and were very keen to help with everything. The room was v clean and spacious, wifi was free (and very reliable), as were breakfast and a couple of bottles of water each day. The only slight complaint was that my room (f) was very close to reception desk and could hear some of the entrance's noise late at night - very room-specific complaint and wasn't serious enough to spoil the experience. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “A stylish and very clean place, great location”
Reviews.Author: Sathamoth
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Suite Dreams with my spouse for 2 nights. The location was great, 5 minute walk from the Termini station (close, but not too close) where you can catch pretty much all kind of public transportation. 2-3 minute walk to the Via Nazionale where there are lot of shops, bars and restaurants. The hotel itself is very clean and designed with style. The hotel may be a bit hard to find, since the main entrance is on a quiet, small street and there's only one little logo on the door downstairs. Service is very friendly and there's always someone answering your questions. We didn't have electric adapter with us, but lady at the desk got one for us in a matter of minutes. The breakfast costs 10e and is described as "continental". It's basically bread, cheese, yogurt, cornflakes and some coffee. Nothing special, and you can get a better deal by going outside, but it's not too bad. Hotel has a free WIFI which worked without any problems in our room. Average speed of WIFI was 600 - 900 KB/sec, which is a very good result for hotel WIFI.

Reviews.Title: “Modern clean hotel, perfect for our family of 4!”
Reviews.Author: Traveler 300
Reviews.Content: Our family loved this hotel. We stayed here a total of 2 nights with our children ages 11 and 14. Our room was equipped for 4 people, so our bathroom was larger. The room is very contemporary and the bathroom was so clean with double sinks. There is a separate huge tub and separate shower. Immaculately clean. The Closet area was the largest of any hotel we have stayed in and made it easy to put away our 4 suitcases. I do have to admit that if we were staying for 4 days, the room might be too small for 4 people. But for only 2 days it was perfect. If my husband and I were staying in Rome, we would absolutely stay here. ROOM: THE room was very modern and clean. Since they made out the sofa into a queen bed, I don’t really know what the room looked like with a sofa. Our two kids slept on the sofa bed. The room was very quiet so they must have good insulation. We were the last room at the end of the hall, farthest away from the breakfast and reception counter. It seemed larger than some of the rest since we had 4 people. BATHROOM: The shower is a treat as it’s one of those rain showers and very organic with the stone. The double sinks were so great for 4 people trying to get ready and tons of counter space. What can I say about the tub. It is huge. We didn’t have time to use it. They had a both a bide and toilet and I loved the flooring. LOCATION: Great location. The hotel lobby is on the 2nd floor so you need to take the elevator. But that wasn’t a problem at all. We stayed at this property also for the location. The subway stop is right around the corner and the subway takes you to most of the major sites. SERVICE: There was some type of mistake on our reservation. Our reservation was for the same room, but it hadn't been noted it was for 4, instead of two. They worked hard to remedy this and it wasn't a big deal. I have to say they were very helpful and happy.

Reviews.Title: “Superb service close to Termini.”
Reviews.Author: miviks
Reviews.Content: The hotel impresses with a truly helpful manager, clean and quite spacious rooms in good repair. The breakfast is ok and there is no need to breakfast off site. With a location close to Termini arrival is smooth, and central Rome is still within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel ever!”
Reviews.Author: darthgul
Reviews.Content: Everything was perfect; from the rooms to the location (only a few minutes away from the metro station that takes you to major tourist attractions). But above all, I loved the informal atmosphere which made me feel at home. The staff was very very friendly--and prefessional. They were always there when we needed help. I'll definitely stay there again if I ever visit Rome again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, modern, nice location, a great start to Rome”
Reviews.Author: Rb_BB
Reviews.Content: This was a great start to our Rome trip. The rooms were modern, spotless and very comfortable. Free wi-fi was included which was very handy. Staff are friendly and helpful. I accidentally booked 2 single beds instead of a single queen, but they fixed it up the next day without any fuss. It's in a central location, but slightly hard to find as it's on a smaller side street and there is no big signage out front. Tip: Book through their own website if you can so you get the free breakfast included.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend.....great stay!”
Reviews.Author: hewoallan
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a few nights to start our Italy vacation. Clean rooms and bathroom. Staff was very helpful. Breakfast was good. Free wifi, free 2 bottles of water everyday and free computer access all great features. Also in a great location, easy to get to train station and major tourist attractions. I would highly recommend Suitedreams!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Find”
Reviews.Author: arh3uk
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent little hotel in a very central location. Staff went out of their way to be helpful and accommodating. Rooms were very nice, clean. Breakfast was also very good. Free WIFI and free 2 bottles of water a day were a very nice touch and a nice change from the usual WIFI & minibar rip off. All in all, outstanding value for money and would highly recommend to anyone on a city break.

Reviews.Title: “highly recommended... wonderfully simple”
Reviews.Author: UkVWTraveller
Reviews.Content: What a great place to stay...we liked the feeling that you were arriving somewhere special...its not obvious the hotel is there, a discrete name badge on a brass plate next to an access button on the right hand side of the main entrance, which you only need to use if the buildings front doors are closed. Beyond the doors the building's large entrance hall. The hotel occupies the first floor of a traditional building, that you can get to it via stairs or a small lovely 'old fashioned' lift. We were not disappointed with our first impressions of the hotel - modern, clean, simple and fresh. We were warmly greeted and throughout our stay were made very welcome, nothing was too much trouble. Even before we arrived we were helped to get tickets for La Traviata. We arrived early, not a problem we left our luggage and went for lunch, when we came back we were shown our room. Perfect - check the gallery on http://www.suitedreams.it/eng/galleria.htm As other reviews have said the location is ideal with many sites close by - you only begin to appreciate it after a day or two. Its only minutes from the main station (Roma Termini) and the underground railway - which we used to get to the Vatican. Depending on the time you have if you're going to the Colosseum we'd recommend opting for the hand held audio tour - in our case the queue was shorter and you can linger longer to imagine the spectacle in its heyday...We spent a day exploring the Colosseum and the Forum. Again depending how long you've got don't forget to get off the beaten track, explore the back streets. There are some great museums, we really enjoyed the Capitolini. Some astonishing sculpture and artwork - amazed at how close you can get to these. We were there over the weekend - Sunday had a different feel - the road Via dei Fori Imperiali near the Colosseum was closed to traffic allowing you to wander freely and get different views of the area. If you're arriving at Fiumicino we'd suggest enquiring about a shuttle bus service into the city, it depends where your hotel is. It worked well for us and cost Euro 30 for two and delivered us to the hotel! The train is Euro 28 for two - We used the train to get back to the airport, wished we hadn't, v.busy, v. hot, but it avoided any potential travel issues with the roads. A beautiful city, great hotel, go to both...

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good service, high price”
Reviews.Author: ECL
Reviews.Content: The hotels location is very close to Termini station so if you're getting to Rome from the airport or by train, this is very convenient. Moreover, I feel its abit away from alot of the road noise and traffice so, while we could hear things at night, it did not bother us. The beds were extremely comfortable for us, and, as others said in other reviews, we found the service top notch. The were prompt, friendly, helpful, and always available when we needed them. I like the clean rooms, clean bathrooms, and nice amenities like a good room safe. Like some other people, I had trouble connecting my laptop with the wifi, but they do have a computer available to use and it worked fine. After a couple nights in one room, the air conditioning gave out but they immediately put us in a different available room with much better air conditioning, so we were fine. There do seem to be problems with the ventilation as the air conditioners would condense and drip water, even at rather warm temperature, so it wasn't us. The breakfasts were good; fresh fruit, some good self service espresso/coffee, juices, cereal, pastires and very warm hard boiled eggs. I liked it alot. This is an expensive place to stay but its great location and good service make it something you should consider if you want a hotel in Rome for a few days.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: NLBanker
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here for one night. I chose this place because of the good reviews and indeed, it's a great stay. The hotel is clean, beds are goods, there's a decent breakfast and the price is excellent. Location is great too!

Reviews.Title: “good option while in Rome”
Reviews.Author: jennicamp
Reviews.Content: I couldn't quite make myself give this hotel a 5 because I felt it was very expensive for what we got. However, I think that Rome is an extremely expensive city to visit so it is probably a good price for Rome. The room was nice - nothing spectacular, but definitely no complaints. The room was decorated in a minimalist style, the bed was comfortable, and the bathroom was very modern. What really makes this place stand out is the service. My fiancé had arranged for a bottle of wine to be put in our room for our arrival, and the staff was very helpful in arranging this. We arrived in Rome in the morning, so we went to the hotel to drop off what baggage we had (most had not arrived on our flight) and let us freshen up. The staff offered to call the airlines on our behalf to find out about our lost baggage, and when we returned later in the day, they reported to us that the airlines had no idea where our bags were! At least they tried. The staff also made lots of suggestions for us to help us plan our day. They let us store our bags the morning of the day we left so we could explore a little more of the city. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Rome - I am just glad rooms in the rest of Italy were not as expensive!

Reviews.Title: “Very Good but not sure our high expectations were met”
Reviews.Author: Bosker
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a long weekend staying at Suite Dreams with our young daughter. We had very high expectations from reading the Trip Advisor reviews. This property is in an ok position in the City, however, due to the very hot weather we found walking too far with our daughter not an enjoyable experience and took full advantage of the reasonable taxi service. Our room was modern with a double bed (2 singles together) and a separate bed for our daughter. The mattresses firm and ok but not madly comfortable. Ample wardrobe space and a spacious modern and clean bathroom. Bring your own travel kettle and supplies if you like tea/coffee in your room. I couldn't sleep at 4am due to the room being too hot, and try as I may I could not get the air conditioning unit to come on, so that was an uncomfortable night. Unlike most "hotels" there is no information booklet in the room. Personally we felt this would have been very helpful, certainly regarding the immediate area (restaurants, facilities, bus tours, metro etc). There is a recommended restaurant list at reception but it is under a glass top and not apparently available to take away. Unfortunately we were unable to connect our laptop to the WiFi, but there is free internet access for guests we used. We had a view of a side street and a fair amount of traffic noise from the nearby main road, especially during the week. Breakfast was a fairly basic continental affair. One morning there was a gorgeous fresh fruit salad, but that was the only day out of four we were there. Staff on the reception were helpful - some more than others, but no-one unpleasant. All spoke good English, apart from the gentleman on the evening we arrived. We were happy eating out at local restaurants, and if you take the time to wander away from the main thoroughfares you are rewarded with great Italian Cafe/Bars. We took a tour with the 110 bus service. 15 euros per adult for a 24 hour ticket. Takes two hours to do a full City Tour, which you can hop off and on at all the major stops, and you pick the bus up a few minutes walk from Suite Dreams. One general tip is regarding taking a taxi to/from the City from Rome Ciampino Airport. There is a flat 30 euro fare - do not be tempted by the rogue taxi drivers who offer a fare for more than this (one aggressive taxi driver on the night we arrived wanted 60 euros - and he got a couple of women to agree to it). There appeared to be some sort of security guard overseeing the taxi rank and the police nearby, but they completely ignored the rogue driver who caused an obstruction with his taxi, and was clearly flouting the 30 euro rule. Would we stay at Suite Dreams again? Probably not. Would likely choose a slightly more central location.

Reviews.Title: “Modern rooms, great service, centrally located, walk to attractions”
Reviews.Author: BeachedWood
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 4 nights at SuiteDreams in May 2010. We were looking for a centrally located hotel, in a quiet location, with modernized rooms where we could be comfortable and close to all attractions. SuiteDreams fit the bill exactly. It is a small hotel located in a side street away from heavy traffic noise and yet perfectly located. We walked to all attractions from the hotel but if you prefer to use the metro, the nearest station is a 2 minute walk. Roma Termini is about a 15 minute walk, or a 2 minute walk to the metro and then travel 1 stop to Termini. A light breakfast is provided in a small breakfast room each morning. The hotel staff is friendly and accommodating and can provide a wealth of information about the city. It is possible, through the hotel, to arrange for a limo to and from Fiumicino Airport...we did so this time but next time we will take the commuter train from the airport to the Termini and walk to the hotel....due to traffic conditions the limo ride is about an hour....the train takes 20 minutes. We will definitely stay at Suite Dreams on our next visit to Rome. (Thanks to Federico, Pierre-Francesco and all the staff at SuiteDreams).

Reviews.Title: “Good base for exploring Rome”
Reviews.Author: baby8684
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our trip to Italy and based ourselves out of SuiteDreams while we were in Rome. Overall, I think I would stay here again if we returned to Rome. The location is great, close to Termini and about a minute walk to the nearest Metro station. I left for a few days before returning and was able to leave my bags with them; it was a huge plus for me that this hotel is staffed 24-hours a day, unlike some other properties I was considering. Breakfast was the standard continental variety. The staff was helpful in making reservations for us, which is more important than I thought it would be in Rome. If you choose this hotel, I think you'd be happy with your choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms and plenty of "not too touristy" restaurants nearby.”
Reviews.Author: Fred1967
Reviews.Content: For those looking for a friendly welcome, a good-sized room and bathroom for an affordable price including a good breakfast buffet (for Italy!), SuiteDreams is the right ticket. It's near "Reppublica", so it's not directly at any of the main tourist areas which can be an advantage. However, the underground is close by (2 minutes walk) and there are plenty of buses. The Colosseum and Forum are very accessible as are the Trevi Fountains and Spanish steps. The Vatican is only 6 stops on the underground and it's 15-20 minutes walk from the Villa Borghese. Several good, affordable restaurants close by (Via Palermo has 3 or 4 good restaurants for example). Don't go to this hotel if you want a view from your window!

Reviews.Title: “Very happy with Suite Dreams”
Reviews.Author: hipiechk
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Suite Dreams in Rome thanks to the good reviews on TripAdvisor. I'm glad I paid attention. The hotel is centrally location, very close to the Republica Metro stop and easily accessible to all the major attractions in Rome (and there are plenty!). The rooms were clean and well-appointed, the bed was comfortable, breakfast was plentiful and espresso was available at all hours (a real perk!). The front desk staff was helpful with suggestions for dinner and use of the mass transit system. We had a very nice stay at Suite Dreams and I would highly recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “the real perfection”
Reviews.Author: EugenioGranada
Reviews.Content: a flawless hotel,excellent service and full of ammenities,no complains at all. the rooms spacious and well furnished,the front desk smiley and gentle,breakfast rich and tasty. they made my stay plesant .

Reviews.Title: “Good value for price”
Reviews.Author: cranch69
Reviews.Content: Rooms are very clean, but stark. Price and location were very good. Breakfast was adequate. Suggestions for restaurants were not the best. I did not enjoy the elevator in getting heavy bags to the room, especially when we were leaving and it was out of order. The staff was always available and on a day when we had to leave before breakfast was scheduled they made sure that we had something available.

Reviews.Title: “Home sweet home in busy Rome”
Reviews.Author: fam0f3
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our 6 year old daughter, first trip to Europe. Our stay couldn't have been better - a fold out bed was provided for her in our large room. There was enough room for our bags to be on the floor and not be at all cramped. The hotel provided us with a portable DVD player and some kids movies for free, which was a nice late afternoon respite before dinner, after days of sightseeing. We stayed 6 days in all and felt very relaxed. The breakfasts are lovely and very generous, with some fruit/small cakes that seems designed to be taken with you for snacks during the day. The restaurant downstairs, Target, was delicious, opened early (good for tired little ones) and the meals were the nicest we had. We tried somewhere else on the last night and was sorry! The location of Suite Dreams is good - near the Repubblica metro and a 5 minute walk to the Termini station, and around a 10 minute walk to the Trevi. The free wifi internet was brilliant - giving us access to emails, skype, podcasts etc. We downloaded some free Rick Steves tours for key sights in Rome that were great. We discovered these via the great range of guidebooks in the hotel's 'library' that were available to guests. We would definitely stay here again! Hopefully our coin in the Trevi will make it happen!

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Spags53
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a long weekend of sightseeing. The manager Pierfrancesco really made us welcome and took time to show us how to get around etc. He was excellent. The hotel is in a good location, close to shops, the metro, buses and the main station Termini. Although it is in a busy area, it is very quiet. The rooms are lovely - clean and well equipped and the bathrooms are very stylish. A bonus is the electronic window blinds that can be used to block out all the light. The breakfast is great with a large choice. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: skellybobbly
Reviews.Content: We booked for 4 nights at this small, modern hotel. We had a friendly welcome, the hotel owner showed us where all the sites were etc. We were shown to our lovely big room. As we are a family of 4, 2 adults and children (aged 8 and 11) The hotel had set up a double sofa bed and king size bed. We had enough room. The room was very clean, modern and had good storage space. Due to the Volcanic ash situation we found our flight delayed a couple of times. The hotel owner was fantastic, he was so accommodating. He charged us only half price for our extra 3 nights and even offered to pay for a taxi to get us to the airport! I really felt that nothing was too much trouble. The buffet breakfast was great, lots of choice. The staff were very helpful, recommending places to eat, even provided me with a plug adaptor and mobile phone charger that I had forgotten! I really would love to go back to this hotel and would recommend it to anyone who wants a comfortable, modern, friendly hotel, in the middle of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “we had a good time!”
Reviews.Author: davidnp98
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 3 months in April!comfortable and well-located!The staff was really generous and helpful!I had a very dood time and I definitely recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Well located and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: JeremyAustralia
Reviews.Content: We stayed at SuiteDreams for 3 nights after reading the great reviews on Trip Advisor. Suite Dreams is very comfortable and well located (a few blocks from Termini and close to many attractions). It has a modern style and is very spacious, but it lacks the charm of some of the older Rome hotels. The room was clean and had plenty of space, as did the bathroom. Breakfast was adequate, although not as good as some other hotel breakfasts in Italy. The staff were very helpful, although my wife was annoyed that they would only speak to her in English when she wanted to practice her Italian with them. When we left a bag in a taxi that the hotel had booked for us, the staff were wonderful in helping track the taxi down and get our bag back - thank you. I was very happy at Suite Dreams and would stay there again, but my wife wants a more charming style next time.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay in a wonderful townhouse”
Reviews.Author: MollyMaloners
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in April and would definitely recommend Suite Dreams. The staff are extremely helpful and informative and the rooms are very spacious, clean and comfortable. Breakfast is as generous as the staff are with their time!! You must stay here and see for yourself!

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Experience in Rome”
Reviews.Author: WaltEP
Reviews.Content: I stayed at SuiteDreams for two 5-day stints in March. It was my first visit to Rome, and I can say it was made much nicer because of my stay at SuiteDreams. Frankie, Roma, and Pierfrancesco all were wonderful in providing useful information and advice during my stays. The rooms were very comfortable, well-kept, and a great value given their size. It's location near Termini made it easy to get to and from the airport. I went to Florence in between my stays at SuiteDreams, and the 10 minute walk to and from the main train station made it economical to stay there - no cab fares! Because I stayed there for so many days they even made certain that I had my favorite treat at breakfast. How many hotels of any size are willing to do that?? Sure, it was a great value and in a good location, but the staff there really made it stand out. I will be staying there again the next time I visit Rome!

Reviews.Title: “superb service, superb staff - loved Rome”
Reviews.Author: woobert
Reviews.Content: just returned from a 3 night stay at the suite dreams and had the best time. The hotel itself is located just off the main road near republica metro stop (about 2 min walk) and bus stop were you can catch the frequent number 40 which gets you into the old town centre in a couple of mins or you can walk there in about 20 mins. Its on the 1st floor of a lovely old building but you need to keep your eyes open to find it as there is just a small sign on the door buzzers. The hotel is small, cool and modern - everything feels clean, looked after and fresh. The rooms have everything you want for a weekend break - clean comfy bed, air con that works, black out windows, free drinking water, nice bathroom with a great shower - suite dreams ticked all the boxes. The breakfast was great - modern expresso machine, nice juices, fruit, cereals, pastries, cheese and ham. What makes suite dreams even more special were the staff- they genuinely do care that you leave Rome with fond memories, nothing is too much - they helped us with bus timetables, restaurants choices, opening / closing times and organised ticket reservations for an art gallery. It was my birthday whilst in Rome and I came back from a meal out to find a lovely note and bottle of wine left in my room compliments of the hotel. We had such a good time in Rome and I'm in no doubt that this was partly down to the great service we received at suite dreams - in an age where good customer service is becoming a rare thing, suite dreams makes for a refreshing change - highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing too much trouble......”
Reviews.Author: SouthWalesHomer
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location. It is situated on a quiet backstreet two hundred metres from the nearest metro station and about five hundred metres from the main railway station and drop off point for airport shuttle buses. There are no flashing neon signs above the door so finding the entrance may not be that easy, but if you turn up late at night as we did, one press of the buzzer gets you in! The hotel is on the first floor of the building with the reception desk being through a door on the right hand side after climbing the first two flights of steps. (There is a lift.) The reception desk is manned 24 hours a day by some of the most friendly and helpful staff that we have ever come across. Nothing was too much trouble for them and they obviously took a pride in giving their guests the best impression of the city that they could. Their advice on what to see and how to get there was a great help when there is so much to see and so little time to see it in. The room (Room H) was clean, spacious, tastefully furnished and well equipped with a comfortable bathroom. A shutter on the window helped to black out the city lights and the street outside was fairly quiet, but noise from floors above did disturb us on both nights. Noise from people checking in and out at the reception desk which was almost directly outside the door of the room was also a problem and it might be better to ask for rooms that were at the far end of the corridor. There was a good choice of food at the breakfast buffet which was available until 10.30am each morning and the price was included in the internet price we had been quoted. As guests at this hotel we felt cared for and respected and this is a very rare feeling. If (when!) we go back to Rome (when our feet have stopped aching!!) we would be happy to return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great service!”
Reviews.Author: melibean
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here the night before we returned to the US from Rome. It's location near the Termini (approximately a 10 min walk) made it perfect to grab the Leonardo Express train to FCO airport in the monring. We were concerned that we wouldn't get to take advantage of the free breakfast buffet because we were leaving the hotel before breakfast was normally served. The desk clerk told us just to let her know what time we were leaving and they would put some food out for us. In the morning, we were greeted by pastries, yogurt, fruit, cold cereal, juice, and coffee - much more than I expected from the early service. It really made me feel like the hotel was going above and beyond to take care of its guests. The room was relatively plain in terms of amenities but it was clean and there was free wireless internet. Also, the minibar came with two complimentary bottles of water.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely Recommended”
Reviews.Author: superali99
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one out of our four nights in Rome for Valentine's weeked 2010. Our reservation resulted from the non-availability of our main hotel - the Rome Cavelieri and at first we were quite disappointed that we were not able to stay in the same place for our whole trip. However, we are now glad that we got the chance to stay for just one night at SuiteDreams because it really was a welcome surprise. We arrived bang on 2pm straight from the airport and the cleaners were still in full swing but our room was ready and the welcome was warm. The room was excellent (we were in room 'e' - they use letters rather than numbers - a large double bed, good bedding and ample space. It is situated about ten minutes brisk walk to the east of the trevi fountain so is perfectly central and just around the corner from an irish/english bar that serves a good pint of guinness. The main thing to mention about the hotel is the small details. Yes it's modern and minimalistic and small (only ten rooms) but they have free Rome guides, a free DVD collection, fabulous showers, excellent black out blinds, good soundproofing, fluffy towels, hundreds of tv channels, free wifi, complimentary water and comfortable beds.
