The owner even lent us an umbrella before we left as he knew that the weather forecast was for rain and yes, we definitely needed it. The breakfast is simple but more than adequate, fresh bread, ham, cheese, coffee (Nespresso), juices, cereal, yoghurts etc but also a nice chocolate cake, apricot tart and some amazing cold bruscetta/pizza and olive focaccia that made an interesting change. In the end, we were sorry that we weren't staying longer and would definitely recommend this place for a stay while you are in the city.

Reviews.Title: “spotlessly clean, well located after finding it”
Reviews.Author: robw17
Reviews.Content: Well located but a little difficult to find on arrival. On important tourist bus line and near train and metro stations. Spotlessly clean. Breakfast is more than adequate with many fresh tasty pastries, pizza, and fruit and an expresso machine. Helpful, friendly staff. Outstanding value.

Reviews.Title: “Welcome comfort after a long flight”
Reviews.Author: Maranville
Reviews.Content: For some reason we were having trouble finding an open room on the night of January 1st, so even though it was more than we wanted to spend, we decided to stay here until we could get into our desired hotel the next night. We rationalized the splurge by saying that this would be our first hotel stay after a long overnight flight and that we could use the luxury. And we couldn't have been more right; it was the perfect place to rest and rejuvenate that first dead-tired, jet-lagged night. Among the many pluses: friendly, helpful welcome by Roma at the front desk; spacious, modern, and clean room and bathroom with plenty of storage; comfortable bed and linens; quiet room; small but charming common area; lovely breakfast room(s); very generous (including a wide variety of amazing fresh fruit) breakfast. We enjoyed the hotel we wound up moving to the next night (which, actually, was in a better location), but, had our lodging budget been bigger, we would have seriously considered spending the rest of our time in Rome here. Good job, Suite Dreams!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Teresa70
Reviews.Content: The hotel is more like a B&B than a hotel as we imagine it. Everythnig has already been said. It is modern, clean, safe and has the right things to make you feel comfortable. Defenitely th Nespresso machine was a very nice surprise. The service is good althought their English was kind of "broken". Good ratio price/quality especially in Rome. I didn´t find the people especially nice as said before in some reviews but still they offered me a bottle of Champagne to celebrate my birthday. Nice touch though maybe it was also nice to have these compiments personaly.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect accomadation with a warm and sincere welcome”
Reviews.Author: KimmyN.Somerset
Reviews.Content: This was a suprise trip for my husband's birthday for a 4 days city break, i chose Rome because of the culture and historical interest and i was not disappointed. The location of the hotel was important because i was arranging the transport to and from the airport and itinery of the trip. Suitedreams is quite close to the termini station about 7 mins walk and a couple of minutes from the metro although i chosefor us to get the 'bus shuttle' from outside the airport direct to the termini station. We flew into Rome with easy jet who also sell tickets for this service. Our only advice on this is although easyjet charge the same price for the service wait until you are outside the terminal and see which bus has arrived as there are several different buses offering the same service and run every half hour or so eg terrivision is one of them. You can pay the driver or ticket person who greets the bus direct and its a pretty good system which costs between 4-4.50 euros each return. The journey is non stop and takes about 40mins. On arriving at the termini with our map we walked to suitedreams and found the hotel quite easy to find as other trip advisors had warned of its difficult location so with that in mind we looked very carefully for the suitedreams sign.(which is small) There is a small old fashioned lift to take you to the first floor of the hotel where we were warmly welcomed by the softly spoken owner who throughout the trip gave us much advice and recommendations. For dinner one evening the owner recommended a restaurant in the 'local Village' and wrote a note to the owner of this restaurant to look after 'his' guests and we were treated like royalty given champagne and extra dishes to try which we were not charged for. The hotel itself is not luxurious but it is modern, clean, warm and very comfortable and in my opinion faultless. In your fridge you have bottles of complimentary water, there is a flat screen tv which does have 1 english channel which i think was bbc but to be honest you don't go to rome to watch tv so think its a very british thing to moan about not having english tv channels!!!!! Breakfast is served as a buffet style which is very sufficient and plentiful, typically continental toast, cheeses, meats, cakes, cereals, yoghurts etc.... the breakfast room was never busy so you never felt rushed to finish as we have experienced in other european cities. Location wise we walked everywhere, approx 15 mins to the main sites spanish steps, trevi fountain, collisium, forum and old town. There are buses that run to most of the sites but to be honest they are very crowded and not particulaly enjoyable!!! If you do intend to use the buses you are supposed to buy your tickets in advance but we didnt bother as the buses were so overcrowded you couldn't get to the ticket machine to validate your ticket so ended up getting free rides!!!! Just to sum up really If you are going to stay at suitedreams you have made a good choice, we will definately stay there again, we didn't experience any noise problems and felt very comfortable and welcome there.

Reviews.Title: “faultless”
Reviews.Author: GloucestershireRich
Reviews.Content: Excellent accomodation location and value. Staff couldnt have been more helpful

Reviews.Title: “Best sleep of the trip”
Reviews.Author: Ilove2travel805
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed this hotel a lot. We definitely slept the best here than any other hotel on our trip. I like how clean and modern that it felt with comfortable beds. When you first arrive, be aware that there is no hotel sign, and that you have to get your bags up the elevator. Its a bit weird if you haven't been to a hotel like this before. The front desk was helpful with reservations and answering questions. Location was OK, a little far from the main walking areas but with all the good food we ate, it was not a problem to walk more.The toiletries could be a little upgraded. Breakfast was ok. Loved the Nespresso machine.(Some of my favorite expresso on the trip). Not a fancy or plush hotel and no real inviting lobby but still a great value and we would probably go back. Can't overestimate a great sleep!

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: synnove
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Suite Dreams Hotel for 3 nights in June 2009 with my Mother. All in all we had a lovely stay at the hotel and can (and have already) recommend it to our friends. Yes, it is not a five-star grand hotel but considering the rate, location, rooms, and service we did feel we were getting good value for the money spent. Location - The hotel is excellently located near the Repubblica metro station and also several busses pass by. Also it is not far from some of the sights so walking to many places is an option as well. But as the hotel is located on a small side street we never found noices from outside the problem. Spotting the hotel - The hotel is not that easy to spot from the street as it doesn't have its own grand entrance and entering a hotel feels more like entering a private residence in a block of flats. Service - the staff members were all very helpful at all times and friendly, and made us feel "at home" so to say. Rooms - the rooms were clean and spacious and modern. There was a lot of storage space. Especially the bathroom made a good impression. The rooms were not "soundproof" however and we did hear basically everything from the corridor and I am sure if someone would have bothered listening outside our door they would have heard our discussion as well. We did not consider this a problem, however, as we never found the noices too loud. Breakfast - Breakfast room was never too full and we always found space although it was on the small side. Breakfast selection was not too ample and focused a bit too much on the sweet items for our taste but still - it was a rather good basic breakfast and got us until lunch time so no complaints there. Restaurants and shops nearby - There seemed to be a quite many restaurants and shops in the nearby area. We did only try one restaurant in the neighbourhood also recommended by the hotel but did not quite get value for money there. A Spar grocery store was a couple blocks away and that we used often. How to get there from the airport / our experience. - We wanted to save some money so we took the train from the airport to Termini and then metro to the hotel. Yes, taking the train to Termini was a good idea but using the metro for one stop was not. All in all, we ended up walking a lot underground and dragging our luggage up and down the stairs. In hindsight, I would have taken the taxi from Termini to the hotel. Although walking might seem a good idea as the hotel is not that far away from Termini either, I would recommend considering it twice. There is a lot of traffic, the pedestrian streets there are narrow and the Termini surroundings did not feel the safest, so with heavy luggage taxi for us would have been a good option. Thus on our way back we took the taxi to Termini and it worked well. I think the fare was around EUR 9 in total for two people and two pieces of heavy luggage.

Reviews.Title: “NOISEY AND UNCOMFORTABLE BEDS!”
Reviews.Author: JetSetter69London
Reviews.Content: Negatives: The hotel is very difficult to find. Unlike most hotels, Suitedreams has a little door entrance on a side alley street. The hotel was noisey and there was constant banging throughout the night. We would wake up with aches and pains from the uncomfortable hard beds. The breakfast consisted of stale toast, coffee, biscuits, cheese and ham. There are no English TV channels. There are hundreds of places to stay in Rome closer to key points of interest that are probably cheaper and offer better value i.e better breakfast, balcony / garden, a bar on premises and a comfortable bed! Positives: The staff was very helpful. They reccomended some great places to visit for sightseeing, dining and shopping. You dont need more than 2 days to see Rome. The hotel location was great. You get free drinking water in the mini fridge. Tips: Do NOT buy the 'Roma Pass' if you dont plan on going to 5 museums or more. The Vatican is not included in the Roma Pass and it is primarily the only thing that is not free in Rome of key interest. It is better to get a Metro Pass for 7Euros for 3 days. Buses are confusing and too crowded. Beware of pickpockets. I would never reccoment this hotel to family / friends.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and value for money/ Most friendly and efficient service we had in a long time”
Reviews.Author: kk2807
Reviews.Content: We have just stayed here for Christmas and it was raining heavily in Rome. Having a good place to stay is even more important especially when travelling with elderlies. Surprisingly modern hotel in an old Rome building so you can have the best of both including free wifi. Perfectly clean. Dont agree with previous reviewer: towels etc are changed if and when you need it, breakfast is plenty and there are helathy food like fruits and yoghurt even cherries at christmas and the famous italian Panetone...2 mn from a metro stop and all buses for this price...Staff is really making all they can to help and are genuinely nice WE HAVE ONLY POSITIVE COMMENTS TO MAKE

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and pleasant”
Reviews.Author: pclplante
Reviews.Content: I've been here for 3 days now of my 5 day vacation. The hotel is situated in the middle of the city of Rome on Via Modena St. near the piazza della republica. A quaint and very quiet hotel with no smoking allowed anywhere inside. The hotel is located inside a building along with several other business, it occupys one floor of the hotel with an old fashioned elevator in the middle for quick access. The hotel lacks all kinds of amenities except it does have a TV, fridgerator and safe thats about it in your room. We got a triple room it has a queen bed and a twin bed in it for the little one. If you book your reservation on their web site you get free breakfast which I have now learned I can get coffee any time of day. Things here you don't have as in an american hotel. 1. A microwave in your room. 2. A pool in the hotel. 3. The elevator is old and the doors are small to get in and out of the hotel, bring small luggage. 4. One public computer for everyone in the hotel, there is free wireless throughout the hotel and I would defently recommend bringing your laptop to download all those pictures and videos you will take of the city. For the most part you can find other hotels in this area with more aminenties but for the price and the beautiful quiet at night to rest. The rooms are spotless down to every little corner! I feel very comfortable playing with my little one on the floor without getting dirty at all, bring a little toys for them. The rooms are small except for the bathrooms which are quite comfortable. It rains a lot this time of year so bring an umbrella or rain gear because your feet will get soaked walking around even just a little. I like the beds they are soft but firm foam on everyone so you don't disturb anyone getting up. The people running this place are very nice and all will go out of their way to help you with anything you would like. The electricity is controlled by your card key when you come in your room you put your card key into a little slot and the light is triggered by the card which turns on all the electricity in the room. If you remove the card key the timer turns off all the electricity automatically and there is no way to turn anything on unless the card key is in the slot. I think this is unpleasant when there is only one card key and if someone leaves the room to get coffee early in the morning the others sleeping in the room can't turn on anything if you take the card key. The hotel seems to be designed to make you get out and enjoy the city instead of providing creature comforts. So if you want frills go to another hotel but if you want to get out and see the city every day with a peace of mind come to Suite Dreams in Rome, Italy.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, good location”
Reviews.Author: greechka
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel on rave reviews from trip advisor but in my opinion it doesn't quite live up to the hype. I would agree with another reviewer on the following negative points: - shower temps fluctuation is ridiculous - breakfast is not that great even though it seems so from first glance. there are too many cakes and sweets and not enough healthy options. one type of crappy white sliced bread. - room was not well cleaned on our first day. sheets and towels are not changed (great for the environment I guess..), perhaps towels need to be placed on the floor, not sure about the sheets. - no sky channel, no movies, one english channel Location of the hotel is great, generally it is clean and the staff are pretty friendly. When you arrive it is hard to find and a bit confusing as it is located on the 1st floor of a large building and a small plaque indicates that there is actually a hotel upstairs. you need to ring the bell and take the lift to the first floor. Free wifi is great.

Reviews.Title: “Most accomodating & helpful hotel staff I've ever dealt with”
Reviews.Author: eekconway
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is perfect locate close to termini for easy transport around Rome. Unbeliavably helpful staff. Room was as big as most US rooms modern & clean. It served every possible need we had. There is nothing bad that can be said.

Reviews.Title: “The place to stay when in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Elisabm
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this lovely hotel for five nights in mid November. It was our first choice due to the good reviews posted in TA. Definetely, it is a very good hotel. All the previous reviews have pointed out the good aspects. Location is a plus; you are very, very close to a subway station, you can walk to Fontana di Trevi, Colosseum and other sites. Staff is really willing to help you at any time. Pierfrancesco and Federico gave us great hints on restaurants. The latter also spoke fluent portuguese and loved talking about Brazil. A private driver was arranged for our early departure at 5 a.m. Breakfast is also great and provides fresh bakery and fruit juices. If i am not mistaken, we stayed at room n. 06 which is very large and comfortable. Also all the hotel was extremely clean. Free wifi is also available and is definitely a plus, since in other hotels we researched the wifi was charged. No doubt if we ever go back to Rome this is the place we are staying.

Reviews.Title: “All the basics for a citytrip”
Reviews.Author: My-View-on-things
Reviews.Content: Suitedreams has got all the basics right. Positive attitute and a clean and well-designed no-frills property. Without summing up what most others have already said; this is a 'very good' hotel, therefore rated 4/5. Why not rate it 'excellent' (5/5) you might ask? - an excellent breakfast needs fresh bread and fresh juice, every day; - rooms are not sound proof: the doors to most rooms are literally two steps away from the check-inn desk and main entrance door (this actually woke us up a few times); - shower temperature fluctuates continuously (and a truly excellent bathroom also has a bath); - after a couple of days of sightseeing it can be nice to sit back watch some TV > there's only one English channel on and no moviechannels. In short, very good (if Tripadvisor used a 1-10 scale I'd say 9/10), but considering the roomrates I think it's fair to be critical and point out these minor shortcomings. We look forward to coming back, but will then try the suite so we can really chill-out in the jacuzzi after cityhiking.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: fifikiwi
Reviews.Content: I stayed at SuiteDreams between Nov 15 and 19 and really enjoyed my stay. While this hotel is not in the "luxury" catagory, it offers all things I need & want - internet, clean room, and breakfast. Staff is extremely friendly and helpful, not to mention its great location - 10-15 min walk from the central station Termini, 20 min walk from the Colosseum. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Glowing reviews are accurate”
Reviews.Author: solotraveler18938
Reviews.Content: I was a little skeptical of all the glowing reviews, maybe they were planted or whatever. But after 3 nights here, I have to say they're very accurate. I really enjoyed my stay at Suitedreams. The hotel is fairly small, only 15 rooms, really just a little more than a B&B. But the rooms are spacious and modern with free wifi, like a stylish hotel. The bed is very comfortable. The room had plenty of storage, parquet floors, and the bedroom and bath were immaculately clean. Breakfast was a nice simple buffet. Plenty of breads, fruit, cheese, ham and juice. Simple but more than adequate. There was a Nespresso machine in the breakfast area which was nice also. Location was good, 2 minutes from the Republica metro stop. Maybe 10 minutes stroll from Termini station. 15 minutes in the other direction, taking your time, and you're at the Trevi fountain. Lots of decent restaurants in the area. I ate a Target around the corner (which may be owned by the people who run Suitedreams, they recommended it, but it was a good recommendation). While the hotel was in a busy neighborhood, the street was area was generally quiet at night, and I had no trouble sleeping. Minor quibbles, my room had a mini bar refrigerator with some soda, free water, beer, etc., and left space for you to put in other things if you want, but it barely worked. My entry into my room was delayed a little bit when I arrived, while they worked on the AC. It was never really cool in the room, but for November, no problem. On the plus side, aside from the very nice rooms and breakfast, the staff was great. Extremely friendly, welcoming and very helpful. I mentioned casually (to Francesco, I think, I'm terrible with names) that if the weather held up one day, I may go to Hadrian's villa. When I came back later that evening, he had printed out information and mapped out how to get there. He and others were genuinely nice people, very helpful and friendly. The hotel is a good value for Rome, where hotels always seem expensive. I paid ~ 110 Euro which is very good for the room, breakfast and location. There are a lot of hotels in Rome and all in all, ranking Suitedreams as #2 out of 1300+ seems a little high, but not outrageously. Its not a super luxury hotel, but rooms are very good; location is good, but not spectacular, and it doesn't have the amenities some people my expect in a hotel (gym, restaurant or room service for example). But it is a good value, the staff is great and it doesn't really miss anywhere. All in all, I do recommend this hotel. I hope to return to Rome again and will plan on staying at Suitedreams.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: li0987en
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had the pleasure of staying at Suite Dreams this past July, and could not have been happier with the choice! As the other reviews state, the hospitality is fantastic. We arrived several hours prior to check-in and then left our bags at the hotel after we checked out in order to get in some more sightseeing, and the staff could not have been more accommodating either time. We found the location pretty good overall; it was not a bad walk from the train station or to the subway, and many sights are walkable if you are up for a longer walk. Tucked away on a side street, we actually felt like we saw more business people than tourists in close proximity to the hotel, which was a nice change from a couple of the other cities we visited on the same trip I will also recommend a visit to an local pub/bar/restaurant "George Byron"at the corner of Via Napoli and Via Nazionale, some 100 m from the Hotel. They have very good food from 8 in the morning until evening. Kitchen opens in the afternoon first at 18.00. We highly recommend SuiteDreams when you go to Rome

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful introduction to Rome”
Reviews.Author: decartstraveler
Reviews.Content: We have been to other countries in Europe (France, Hungary, Germany, Estonia) and have stayed in higher-priced hotels. Suite Dreams compares very favorably and isn some cases is even better in terms of comfort and service. The rooms are modern, comfortable. and immaculate (I did a few yoga poses on the floor and it was very clean!) The bathrooms are large and we especially appreciated the roomy, walk-in shower. The price includes a very good breakfast and a bottle of water (1 per person) in the room fridge. The staff was wonderful, special thanks to Pierfrancesco who recommended a fabulous restaurant and gave us very clear instructions on how to get there, and to Roma whose gracious manner and attention to detail made us feel at home right away. The location is very convenient - walking distance to the Republika metro station and the Termini train station. We have already recommended this hotel to friends and definitely plan to stay there the next time we are in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Started off on the wrong foot. Is manager Jekyll & Hyde?”
Reviews.Author: mrsmaryallen
Reviews.Content: My husband, daughter and I arrived at SuiteDreams the night on Nov 18. I booked this hotel based on the recommendations from TripAdvisor. I was really excited to get there and had even email Pier prior to our stay. Being a small boutique hotel, they did not have vacancy for all of the nights we would be in Rome. Given that this would require us to pack/unpack an additional time, I asked if it was possible for them to offer some kind of small discount to incentify us to stay. It is important to note that I was completely ok with them saying no and told them that. Heck, it was our decision and we could have stayed somewhere else if it was that big of deal. I really just thought I would ask - thinking it wouldnt hurt to ask. Pier did offer a discount, which I thought was excellent service. Above and beyond even. Fastforward to Nov 18. After a long day of travel with our 1.5 year old daughter, we get to the Suite Dreams. At first, we didnt know if we were even there but saw the small sign. We were travelling in Europe for a few weeks and had a lot of bags. So I ran up stairs to check in. Pier said "ah, we were waiting for you". Then he said he needed my husband and I to both be present with our passports to check in. I went back downstairs and helped by husband put our bags into a very small lift. I carried my daughter upstairs and waited for my husband to return. It was then when I got the look of death. Pier spent the next 30 minutes lambasting us for bringing our daughter. He accused us of purposely not telling him in order to get a cheaper room. He said "you managed to ask for a discount, but failed to mention that you had a 3rd person". Now, I had booked 5 hotels in Europe for Novemeber and NONE of them told me to indicate an additional person with a 1.5 year old. In fact, I was advised not to. With kids this young, their presence does not have an incremental cost anyway so it is generally a non-issue. I tried to explain this and he said he didnt care how other hotels operated. He was being so incredible rude. In my mind, I was thinking - holy crap, is he going to kick us to the curb? Where in the world will we stay on this short of notice. It looked like it took everything he had to let us stay and he started showing us around. He was still shaking with anger. My opinion is that if was going to permit us to stay, he could have saved the half hour reaming upon arrival. I sat in my hotel room completely unravelled. The next day I asked the receptionist to remove the discount. I felt so uncomfortable. **The breakfast was nice, the rooms were nice but I felt like an unwelcome guest. And this is very much a feeling of a bed and breakfast- so if you dont like those, you will not like this hotel. The reception area is a small desk in the 1 hallway of the hotel. Rooms are along the hallway. You must walk by the reception area to get to the breakfast area. Everything is on 1 floor.** We ran into Pier one other time and it was upon checkout. He had acted like nothing was wrong and asked us to stay again. He helped us get a different cab since the one we got was too small for all of our bags. It was a complete Jekyll & Hyde scenerio. It was hard to rate this hotel. Given the horrible way my husband and I felt upon arrival and service that is unprecendently low - I have to give this a 2 rating. Had it not been for the seriously foul attitude of Pier upon arrival, I would have rated it a 3.5. In closing, I really hope that I dont get a smarmy response from the SuiteDreams. It would really just make matters worse in my mind and lower my opinion of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Service that really can't be topped”
Reviews.Author: socon1217
Reviews.Content: Just spent two nights at Suite Dreams bookending a Mediterranean cruise and can't say enough good things about the hotel. Pierfrancesco and his staff at the front desk gave us beyond exemplary service while we were there. My friend had her bag lost at FCO and the hotel staff vigilantly called every hour and tried every means to get the bag back. Most hotels wouldn't have bothered. The hotel itself is very clean; the rooms are large by European standards (and the bathrooms are downright massive by European standards). The hotel is well-situated and on a very quiet side street. Wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone who asked.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, accomodating, great location to explore Rome”
Reviews.Author: alang2nevada
Reviews.Content: Read all the great reviews on Trip Advisor and decided to try it. SuiteDreams definitely lived up to the high ratings. My wife and I stayed for six nights. The hotel is very close to the Termini Station, making it easy to get here from the airport. Also close to the Repubblica Metro and buses on Via Nazionale. It is very well located for visiting the major sites in central Rome. Our room faced Via Modena and was surprisingly quiet. The staff consistently went out of their way to be helpful. All of them had a "can do" attitude. The owner also has a restaurant, Osteria Chiana, which we went to for dinner one evening. Great food and value - definitely recommend trying. Can't think of any downside to staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Nice Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: 2kiddo
Reviews.Content: Selected this hotel after reading reviews from Trip Advisor. The previous positive comments are very true. Stayed here for 4 nights with 2 nights split. The location is perfect, most of the attractions are walking distance. It is also very close to the Repubblica Station where it can give you access to both A & B trains through Termini station. We took the Leonardo Express to and from the Airport, walked all the way to the Termini station within 15 mins with 2 big luggage and 2 kids in towe. The staff are very friendly and accomodating, they provided good suggestions for food and ways/best means to go around. The rooms are modern and big enough for 2 queen size beds. The breakfast serve is ok, we enjoyed the coffee and the ham.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: shunky
Reviews.Content: Hotel We stayed in Suite Dreams Hotel from 11th to the 15th of September. We booked it based on the recommendations on Tripadvisor. The hotel was very good and we were pleased with our stay in the hotel. The staff were friendly but not overbearing. On arrival we were given a very detailed and useful map of Rome and a page of restaurants worth trying. It was my wife’s 40th birthday on the 13th September and I had already informed the hotel that this was our reason for staying. When we came back to our Rome on the afternoon of the 13th they had made up a card and left us a bottle of wine. It was a very nice touch and very appreciated. The owner was very welcoming and helpful. Make sure you book your hotel direct with the hotel and you will get all your breakfasts free. (normally ten euro each) If you have already booked with another agency, email the hotel and you can cancel your booking and book with them direct and get the same room and your breakfasts free. Excellent communication by email from the hotel. Found the bed the first night uncomfortable and asked for second pillows. Promptly provided and this made a big difference. There is a lot of city noise but you have to expect that as Rome is a very busy city day and night. Everything in the room worked fine and we had no problems. There is a safe in the room which was excellent and no deposit required. We thought breakfast was a bit basic but after seeing what was on offer in local cafe's and restaurants and their prices we realised it was a good breakfast and will keep you going to late afternoon If you pay by cash you get 5% discount which would have saved us £41. We paid by card and when we came home we found that the by using the card we had got a better exchange rate than changing money at post office at home and paying by cash but that it only saved us £10 as opposed to £41. So might be worth bringing cash to pay your bill which you can do even though you used your card to book hotel. Transport From airport Taxi = 75 Euro Hotel Transfer = 55 Euro Airport Transfer 39 Euros Train each = 11 Euro Train leaves from airport, express to Stazione Termini. This leaves you about half a mile from hotel. We used the train and it was great. Felt a bit weary coming through the streets at 12mn with our cases and money on us. The City We weren’t very impressed with Rome. It is very overrated and very over priced. (for example 3.50 Euro for a small can of coke from a roadside stall). One guy at the Spanish Steps tried to charge us 200 Euro for a trip around the city centre on a horse and cart, when we said no the price was reduced to 150 Euro and when we said no again and walked away they came after us and offered it then for 80 Euro. But by then we then didn’t trust them at all. Be prepared to pay a lot of money for tourist quality meals when eating out. We ended up eating McDonalds, burger King, a take away Chinese and even cheese and ham rolls. We got sick of eating pizza that didn’t taste as good as our local at home. Even the lasagnes and spaghettis weren’t as good as you would make yourself at home from a jar. Only nice place we ate was an Irish bar just down the main street two blocks from the hotel on the left “Flan O’Brien” Pity we didn’t find it until the last day! T-bone Station recommended by the hotel was good too. Target restaurant is expensive and overrated. They say the Roman Army marched on its stomach....must have been looking something descent to eat! The Vatican and other churches in Rome are groaning with wealth while people in the world starve. We saw one Nun walk around a street beggar who had only wished her good evening. We found all this quite upsetting and contradictory to religious teachings of the church. No point in bringing your Sat Nav. You won’t get much use out of it as the streets are narrow and the buildings so tall. The map the hotel gives you is all you will need. There is a green tourist information booth half way down the main street (Via Nationale)

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: Wyomingirl
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic place to stay. Room very clean and met all of our needs. WiFi free with our stay. Quiet area yet close to transportation, shopping and sites. Front desk staff extremely helpful and pleasant. Enjoyed the breakfast with a host of pasteries, cereal and drinks. Left luggage after checking out to do the sightseeing and collected in the afternoon to go on cruise. Pier, the owner, was most generous helping us when we came to retrieve our luggage offering assistance, food and water. Would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for what we wanted - comfortable, clean, friendly and convenient”
Reviews.Author: WestCountrySeagull
Reviews.Content: After so many rave reviews on Trip Advisor, I tried not to have unreasonable expectations but this place really is as good as others have said. I went with my wife, my 8 year old son and my mum (in her 70s) for three nights and we all thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Suite Dreams is ideal for a city break in Rome where you don't spend much time in the hotel but need it to be convenient for sightseeing and comfortable to return to. The hotel comprises just 15 rooms, a reception area and a breakfast room, all on the first floor of an old, elegant building. If you want lots of facilities, look elsewhere but we thought it was perfect for what we wanted. The rooms are spacious and well-equipped, the bathrooms are modern and everything is spotlessly clean. The friendliness and helpfulness of the staff is exceptional and there are some nice touches like free bottled water in the minibar and free internet. My son liked the free sweets, too! Criticisms? Can't really think of any. It really is as good as the reviews lead you to believe.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: EagleBeagle
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent two wonderful nights in Rome. We stayed at the Suite Dreams and found the place to be exceptional. Nothing was difficult for the lovely staff. They let us leave our bags at the hotel and also let us use a room to change. They also provided us with some great recommendations to dine in. They also recommended a great coffee shop that is near to them which converts to a bar in the evenings. The stand up coffee is just 1 EUR. The bathroom is a bit small but the bed makes up for this shortcomings. Also the elevator is quite small.

Reviews.Title: “Finally - the best hotel in Europe!”
Reviews.Author: MelindafLasVegas
Reviews.Content: My husband I read reviews about this hotel and boy we were glad we made that decision. If you have never been to Europe you will should know that most rooms are small and the bathrooms are even smaller. We arrived at our hotel and the staff even took the time to show us our room and even showed us how to use all the lights and A/C-heater unit. It is in a great location right next to the train station and behind one of the busiest streets. Dont worry we didnt have any problems with the noise at all. The owner was so nice he even helped call one of our tours cause they were late. He recommended nice resturants, bars, lounges and anything we wanted to visit. The rooms are super clean and spacious and felt like we were back at home. This hotel is a winner in my book and when we go back to Rome we will stay again. Well worth it!

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel, good breakfast and fantastic service, thumbs up from us”
Reviews.Author: Danaduke
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have yearned to visit Rome for some time. We chose this Hotel based on the Trip Advisor reviews and we were not disappointed. Ideally placed 10 minutes walk from the station (Roma Termini) this cosy and well apointed hotel room offers clean and crisp decor. The breakfast is typically Rome and is fresh, plentiful and delicious. The staff are friendly and extremely helpful. Above all, we asked for restaurant recommendations and were not disappointed with the results. I would thoroughly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting this fantastic city

Reviews.Title: “Great Base for your stay!”
Reviews.Author: MTreacy
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here for 7 days in mid October and we couldn't have been happier with the service and location of this hotel. The staff were all so helpful and accomodating and Pierfrancesco was very friendly in all his correspondance and really tried hard to make us comfortable and welcome. The room was modern and cosy if a bit small and the grilles on the windows really blocked out all the light and noise from the street. The fully opening window was great for cooling down the room and we both loved the gorgeous firm bed and the relaxing slate shower. The breakfast was perfect in the morning and the hotel was located within easy walking distance of all the sights and a few minutes walk from the central train station. We felt perfectly safe there at night (especially when we realised the department of defense was just up the road!) and the restaraunts on either end of the road were both very good. The free computer and internet access was also very handy. It was well worth the money and we will definately return there for our next visit to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: IU1971
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Rome and would highly recommend SuiteDreams. It is very conveniently located, close to the train station. The rooms are roomy, well appointed and clean and the staff are very attentive. We were warmly received and give maps and a great overview of Rome. The breakfast was excellent, we were impressed with the espresso maker and the amazing croissants. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, Modern, Clean, Brilliantly located Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Juice81
Reviews.Content: As this was our first trip to Rome its difficult to compare this hotel with others in the area, although I have found out from friends that you could pay the same amount as SuiteDreams or even more and get a really disappointing hotel. We travelled to Rome for a friends wedding with one day spare to go sightseeing, other friends stayed in the Trastevere area and complained that it was much more of a walk to get to the sights than we had at SD. The location of the hotel is fab, almost all the sights are walking distance (definitely take your flat shoes if you go to Rome) we spent an entire day from 8am to 10pm walking around taking in the sights whilst we were there and the location of the hotel meant that we were never too far away, the only limitation we had was time! The hotel was very easy to find, our taxi driver dropped us off right outside after coming from Ciamparo airport, but please be warned that the fare really shouldn't be much more than 30 euros, there is (in theory) a flat rate to and from Rome city centre of 30 euros but we got stung by a con-artist taxi driver who told us that 'due to protests in the city centre he couldn't honour that amount'.........we ended up having THE most dangerous taxi journey there AND THEN he charged us 50 euros for the pleasure. I know the hotel can arrange taxi pickups so i really would advise this so as to not get caught out like we did. Hotel is very small and on the first floor but there is a lift although I much prefer to take the stairs (cases and all) and we arrived at least 3 hours early and our room was ready for us already which was brilliant. Everything about the hotel is very modern, clean cut, fresh and minimalistic. I would suggest that if you are looking for a slice of old world Rome this is not the hotel for you, although you will find more than enough history right on your doorstep. The bottle of water for each guest in the room each day is brilliant to take out when you go sightseeing as Rome can get mighty hot (even in mid october) and the air con was used every day when we got back. Bed is very comfy and we slept incredibly well, the black out blind is also a good noise reducer, as being relatively central i'm sure we should have heard more noise from outside than we actually did. Bathroom is great size and the slate shower and enclosure is fantastic. Breakfast selection (which we only got one day to try out) was really good, its a great selection of 'Continental' items, pastries, cakes, cereals, fruit and the tassimo machine is great fun if you can work out how to use it!! Being such a small hotel this breakfast set up is perfect, I guess if you want a bigger cooked breakfast you'd be able to walk less than 5 minutes and find somewhere but we filled up nicely on the lovely fruits and breads etc and were set for the day. The staff at the hotel were great, were really great helping us arrange transport to the wedding we were attending and sorted out items such as ironing boards, irons, hairdryers, DVD's without hesitation, the maps on the front desk are invaluable to carry around and the hotel staff will point out all the attractions and ways to get around. They also have a handy guide to the restaurants they recommend, we went to the one opposite the opera house which was very nice (but please do remember to order sides with any main courses, i ended up with a dinner of two very lonely lamb cutlets on a plate!!) and the location was less than 5 mins away, also walked past the restaurant (target?) below the hotel which looked really great too, just didn't get a chance to eat there. Overall I'd definitely recommend this hotel and would definitely stay there again, without us even realising it the place made our brief city break a whole lot more enjoyable. Upon speaking to our friends at the wedding we all attending over in Rome, who had all stayed in Trastevere, we were astonished to find how much our opinions of Rome, Roman Italians and the area varied. Where as our friends were disgusted at the amount of litter, graffiti and dog mess in 'Rome', we had completely the opposite opinion and were saying how clean and litter/graffiti free the city was in comparison to London. Without having heard other people's opinions I guess we wouldn't have realised how lucky we were to stay in such a nice area, nice location and such a well kept part of the city. Before my trip I was slightly concerned about the cost of staying at SuiteDreams but I can assure you it is worth every penny. My only other recommendation is whilst you're in Rome do visit Piazza Navona, its only through a recommendation that we visited there and it really was beautiful, took our breath away and had a fantastic meal on the edge of the square as artists bustled around and music played in the background...........my absolute favourite memory of Rome :) I hope you enjoy Rome as much as we did.

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: Coco26Ottawa
Reviews.Content: I absolutely loved this hotel and especially the staff. They were all so kind and helpful. Being a solo traveler they really made my stay in Rome so smooth as they took care of arranging everything for me, tours, taxis. They gave me a map upon my arrival and went over all of the main attractions and the best way to get there with me. I can't say enough about how helpful and gracious they were. The room was a great size room, very clean. They have free wireless internet and even provide a computer for guests use if you don't have one. The location was in walking distance to most attractions or if you're not up for walking too far they're close to the main bus routes. I loved this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent staff...very clean and spacious rooms”
Reviews.Author: flade
Reviews.Content: We arrived at SuiteDreams after a very stressful travel day (flat tire on autostrata...need to change rental cars....arriving much later due to car issues). We were warmly greeted by the staff, and shown to our room. When we unpacked, we visited the front desk and asked for recommendations for dinner. The gentleman at the desk, gave us a map, highlighted areas to walk through and gave us recommendations to eat. This man was right on with all of his dinner recommendations! We told him how impressed we were with the places he told us to eat. He explained that the hotel owner routinely visits restaurants and creates a list of places that he would want to eat. The owner is not affiliated with any restaurants and does not receive commissions. He only recommends places that he thoroughly enjoys. If you stay at this hotel, be sure to get the restaurant recommendations. The first night out, my husband commented that he was nervous about where we were staying because there weren't many people around. Come to find out, we were within a block of the President's house in Italy. Needless to say, there were all sorts of polizia, local and national, always visible around the area we stayed. There was no reason whatsoever to feel unsafe. Once we got the lay of the land, we were much more confident in our choice. The hotel is ideally located for walking around Rome. We were able to get to most places within a 20 minute walk. Many places were closer than this. The hotel staff also explained how to use the bus system, which was very easy once they helped introduce us to the stops, etc. We chose to walk most of the time to walk off all the food we were eating. The breakfast was a continental buffet. It was adequate, nothing fancy. We had plenty to choose from each morning. The hotel staff also arranged for our ride to the airport, and it was cheaper than taking a cab. The bed was very comfortable, and the room was air conditioned. The rooms were all very chic in design as compared with traditional decor in other hotels. I loved the hotel, the price, and the location. The hotel was incredibly quiet, which is nice from the fast paced noisy city of Rome. The staff, as I mentioned, was extremely helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: mickb1979
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Suite Dreams in September on honeymoon and had a great time. We had one of the junior suites which at 250 Euros a night wasn't cheap but we felt was just about value for money. The suite itself was very nice, lovely king size bed, a big corner sofa and a 2 person jacuzzi. All fixtures and fittings were new and the window had an electronic shutter to block out any street noise and the morning light if you wanted a lie in. The manger/owner Pier Francesco greeted us on our arrival and explained that he was there to help us with anything we needed. Having been to Rome previously we explained that we really wanted to go to some good restaurants and had struggled to fine anything above average last time. Pier Francesco recommended and booked us a table for a restaurant every night we stayed there (5 in total) and all were either very good or brilliant. Even the restaurant below the hotel called Target which we booked 30 minutes after arrival was good. The only thing this hotel could improve on is the selection of breakfast. Croissants and toast and great coffee was nice every day but a real repetition. Overall the staff are super friendly and very helpful (only question is recommending Carrani Tours - who are completely rubbish and not worth using!). the hotels location is great too, great public transport links and in walking distance of most attractions barring the vatican. Would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “great escape”
Reviews.Author: Alexisoia
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this last month and it was great! Our room was comfortable,super clean and ultra modern.Front desk staff were really helpful.Good buffet breakfast with cereals, fruits, croissants, ham and cheece, juice,and coffee . The location of the hotel was great , close to the center and walking distance from all Rome attractions ( Colosseum,Trevi fountain etc).I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “great value and wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: BryanBerry
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our last night in Rome. Once you know where it is located, it is not that hard to find, but tricky at first. The staff are incredibly helpful and nice. We were able to check in early which was wonderful since it was our last day in Rome. The staff have great restaurant recommendations and the rooms are a very nice size with a good, clean functioning bathroom. It is a little weird we had to have our keycard in a slot by the wall to have the lights on but I guess that's energy efficient and once we got the hang of it, we didn't mind. I would definitely recommend to someone who appreciates value but also a nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Clean / Modern / Comfortable / Quiet”
Reviews.Author: TimTabTravel
Reviews.Content: As we arrived in Rome they allowed us to drop off our bags and go explore the city for several hours prior to checking us in early around 1:00pm. The rooms are very nice and modern with large for Europe bathrooms. Very clean and quiet. The staff was friendly and helpful. The breakfast was very good. The hotel is located near the Termini and is only steps from the Repubblica metro stop so getting around Rome and back to the hotel was easy. Great small boutique hotel.

Reviews.Title: “What more can I say!”
Reviews.Author: westlife07
Reviews.Content: Booked the hotel for our trip to Rome through it's rating here on Trip Advisor. The hotel is wonderful and we will definately be back. We booked a pickup by taxi from the airport with the hotel. It was well worth it. We were in room 3 which was above The Target restaurant below, there was a little noise from the diners sitting outside, but that soon stopped once the restaurant closed. We were made very welcome on our arrival, given a map which was put to good use throughout our stay. Breakfast was good and there was plenty of it. The room was a good size, bathroom was lovely, especially the walk in shower, slate wall & floor. It was my b'day whilst we were there, a lovely surprise to return to our room in the evening to find a bottle of wine and birthday wishes from the owner. Trip advisors award is well deserved. If using the metro & buses would recommend buying either a day or 3 day ticket, saves having to find a euro each time you use the transport.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel & Staff”
Reviews.Author: sha30
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights here 24-28th Sept with Family & Friends I booked the trip as a surprise trip for my dads 60th Birthday and he loved every minute of it. The hotel is amazing everything is clean and new the bathrooms are really nice all Catalano fixing. The staff could not have been more helpful they provided maps and plenty of information but they don't intrude and get over familiar that goes for all the staff. The room had air con which was needed and the location is brilliant we walked everywhere from the hotel we only took a taxi once. I can not recommend this hotel highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Left my heart in Rome....”
Reviews.Author: raquelmom
Reviews.Content: This was my second time in SuiteDreams and I cannot recommend enough. This is not just a hotel... it is like home. I promise you will love it. Raquel - USA

Reviews.Title: “believe the hype: great location & excellent customer service: a real gem”
Reviews.Author: sweetchicken
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our way to Umbria for 2 nights and we could not have been happier with the hotel & it's staff. It was very clean, modern and fresh, the room was quite large and VERY quiet & the hotel was in a really great location - we were able to walk practically everywhere at night for meals etc without getting taxis - although for serious sightseers I would recommend the hop-on hop-off red line bus - at only 15 euros for a 24 hour ticket it does enable you to see a lot of the city in short space of time (the buses go from Plaza de la Republica). Big thanks for Frederico on reception who tried to sort out a problem with our car (don't trust Avis) - anyway, he tried his best but as it was bank holiday the next day he was not getting anywhere with Avis - the upshot was we had to pick up the car and drive it a car park and if you thinking of driving in Rome - don't - you can get seriously caught out by the central congestion zone and even the romans who gave us directions (there were several) could not tell us how to avoid going into it - as a tourist you cannot buy a pass you havew to be a resident to drive in the centre. Anyway, best guide book was Time Out - try Macherroni if you can - reception will book you a nice table - also we arrived at lunchtime and had a meal at Target Pizzeria on the corner of the hotel building - it was very nice. We did not find Rome particularly pricey but then we are used to London and yes if you do sit on the really obvious touristy places you will get ripped off but that is the same the world over! I agree with another reviewer about the Vatican city - we went into the Museum (only to see the sistine chapel) and the sheer amount of gold and precious objects on display was obscene and very vulgar - how hypocritical! I am not expecting them to rip the frescoes off the walls but really - what about the starving poor in any catholic countries in the world?? at 15 euros a ticket that was the only time I felt like I was being ripped off in Italy - if you go to the basilica of St francis at Assisi it is the complete antithesis of St Peters.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT VALUE/COMFORTABLE RESPITE”
Reviews.Author: sloh
Reviews.Content: We were in two different rooms for 5+1 nights in AUG/SEP 2009 with a Mediterranean cruise in between. SuiteDreams is a boutique style hotel without the attitude! The Clean, modern, efficient décor was essentially the same in both rooms but the layouts were slightly different. Both rooms were large by European standards with nice wood floor throughout and gray slate in the bathrooms. (We had rooms with shower stalls only, no tub). Unlike a previous review, the rooms are much better than IKEA with quality furnishing, fixtures, fit & finish. (For example, the shower fixture is by Hangsrohe – and if I’m not mistaken, it’s part of the AXOR line designed by Philippe Starck.) WHAT I LIKED ABOUT SUITEDREAMS: - Great overall value - FREE in-room WIFI internet access (computer also available for use) - Continental Breakfast included (if you book from their website) - Walking distance to main Termini train station (10-15 mins) - Around the corner from METRO station (Rupubblica) - Quiet residential street/Good soundproofing - Cool and quiet AC - Spacious shower stall - Comfortable/large firm bed - Clean bed linens/towels - Staff were discreet but easily accessible, efficient and very helpful - Central location but NOT smack in the middle of a touristy area IDEAL FOR: Smart travelers who are self-sufficient and know how to get around on their own. If you are expecting a bellman/porter, room service, spa facility, concierge service, see-and-be-seen lobby bar/cafe… this is NOT for you! ONLY SNAFU (mostly my fault, perhaps due to jetlag?): The discreet entrance was difficult to find the first time, even with my Google map. FYI, it’s between the corner “Target” restaurant and Mel Bookstore. There’s a small sign next to the intercom on the front door. The reception desk is one flight of stairs up on the first floor.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location. Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoBoy10
Reviews.Content: Like many, when I first found SuiteDreams in Rome, I was not blown away by anything. It is a little tricky to find, but not too hard at all. I did the street view on Google maps before going, so once I recognized the surroundings of the hotel, I knew I was close. The check-in staff was very helpful, spoke great English...a nice welcome. The room was decently sized (big bed), had a great A/C unit and the bathroom was very modern. There is one free internet computer for everyone's use which is great. The room had the best room-darkening shades so you sleep like a rock. The breakfast was good, not great...but, I would not let this ruin the overall great view I had of this hotel. The KEY was the location...about 6-7 minute walk from Termini station for all the transportation to other cities. The metro (subway) to the Vatican/Spanish Steps/Trevi Fountain is two minutes away and the other metro (to the Colisseum) is at Termini. There is a bus stop about 30 seconds away to the Pantheon. You can walk to everything, as we did at least one of the ways to all of the sites (except the Vatican). That is the most spectacular part of SuiteDreams...it is clean, modern, BUT central to everything and very cheap compared to other hotels!! Only downside is we had 3 channels on the TV with poor reception but if you are going to Rome to watch tv, you gotta change your priorities!

Reviews.Title: “If You Love Ikea You will Love this Place”
Reviews.Author: Wine_Merchant
Reviews.Content: Roma the front desk staff is a gem. She makes an ordinary hotel extraordinary. The place is minimalist and totally Ikea. Nothing fancy but things do work. If you like sumptuous hotels this is not your place. It is really barebones but it felt comfortable and reasonably roomy. Certainly not the best hotel in Rome but thanks to Roma who really cared about a screw up with our restaurant booking we will always have fond memories of the place. The elevator is a bit scary but the walk will do you good! Breakfast is basic.

Reviews.Title: “A haven of peace”
Reviews.Author: goldenoldie027
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 night stay in this wonderful modern boutique hotel in the centre of Rome within 20 mins walk of Trevi fountain or Colisseum.Cannot praise it enough The rooms are large and extremely comfortable and free internet avail The staff cannot do enough for you and the continental breakfast is superior to any I have experienced Surrounded by bars and restaurants at reasonable prices At 180euros per room per night it is the bargain of the century

Reviews.Title: “Highly enjoyable.”
Reviews.Author: Palmsea
Reviews.Content: Belive what you read-- Suite Dreams lived up to and exceeded every expectation I had. The hotel is impeccably clean and neat, and the staff is helpful and friendly. The bathrooms and bedrooms are large, with ample storage space for suitcases and clothes. The free Wi-Fi was an added bonus. The included daily breakfast was delicious and filling. The hotel is about a 25 minute walk away from the Colluseum... a half hour to the Spanish Steps. It's not extremely close (walking distance wise) to any of the major tourist attractions, but if you take the metro there is a metro stop a couple of blocks away. The hotel is not really in a touristy area, and is on a quiet street, both which add to the charm and greatness of the hotel. However, If you have a lot of bags, be aware that the elevator up to the hotel is quite small.

Reviews.Title: “A great end to my Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: Darkdancer
Reviews.Content: I've traveled all across Europe and Asia on several different occasions and typically stay in the 3 stars with occasional 4 stars and this hotel tops them all with regards to value for money. Great modern rooms, soft linens, new fluffy towels, Awesome bathrooms/showers, Digital TV with a wide selection of entertainment, free WIFI internet (almost unheard of in Italy) a 5-10 min walk to the train station and a 20 min express train ride to and from the airport. No need to deal with cabs or private car hires. Breakfast had real Kellogg products (premium brands) and not the homegrown stuff. Toaster was broken, but I can give them a pass because they had everything else. Nespresso Machine for coffee (I have one at home and this was a nice touch) The staff was fantastic and answered all my questions and went out of their way to getting train schedules, Restaurant bookings and sightseeing tips. One thing, they did not have in room hairdryers, which was strange, but I did not ask if they had any at the front desk. Lots of different restaurants in the area for different budgets, the restaurant downstairs was great but a bit steep in price.

Reviews.Title: “Number One”
Reviews.Author: Pippi2
Reviews.Content: When we tried to book a room for 2 nights, they orginially did not have the room we requested for the first night (twin room). We were really eager to stay in SuiteDreams due to all the excellent reviews and the tripadvisor award. To cut the story short, they gave us a triple room with a double bed and a single bed for the same price. The staff at SuiteDreams is excellent, great service, very friendly and always with a smile (they seem to enjoy working there). The rooms and the bathrooms are decorated in a very nice boutique style, with stylish details, large mirrors, good lightning and with enough space to move around. The WiFi is free and there is also a guest PC available. The location is perfect as the distance to Termini station is walkable even with a bit of luggage. Repubblica metro station is very close. Breakfast is also good. Travel to Rome and stay at SuiteDreams!

Reviews.Title: “I can see why it won the award”
Reviews.Author: ChancellorElmer
Reviews.Content: Suitedreams was excellent. We stayed for 6 nights and absolutely loved it. The hotel is in a perfect location, close to sites and transportation. The staff is friendly and helpful. They helped us get soccer tickets for the opening game of the Serie A season, reservations to restaurants, and directed us to several good restaurants and sites. Check their website, because if you book through there you get breakfast included with your reservation. They also give each person in the room a free bottle of water per day, a nice perk.

Reviews.Title: “Sweet hotel, good location, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: norgabius
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at the Hotel and had a very nice time there. The rooms are clean and good size. The service is excellent. Our reservation didn't have breakfast included, so we only ate one morning at the hotel. The breakfast is typical Italian, some Croissant or toast with cheese and ham. An own Espresso machine! Everything good tasting. The location is also good. 150 m from Piazza Republica Metro station, and in the center of Rome. The only thing we were not satisfied with was our rooms location, just opposite to the reception. Our room, G, were adjacent to the reception desk, so if you are a light sleeper, you might wake up by talking in the reception. I will also recommend a visit to an local pub/bar/restaurant "George Byron"at the corner of Via Napoli and Via Nazionale, some 100 m from the Hotel. They have very good food from 8 in the morning until evening. Kitchen opens in the afternoon first at 18.00. We highly recommend SuiteDreams when you go to Rome

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: chcgotrvlr
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had the pleasure of staying at Suite Dreams this past July, and could not have been happier with the choice! As the other reviews state, the hospitality is fantastic. We arrived several hours prior to check-in and then left our bags at the hotel after we checked out in order to get in some more sightseeing, and the staff could not have been more accommodating either time. We found the location pretty good overall; it was not a bad walk from the train station or to the subway, and many sights are walkable if you are up for a longer walk. Tucked away on a side street, we actually felt like we saw more business people than tourists in close proximity to the hotel, which was a nice change from a couple of the other cities we visited on the same trip. Additionally, the amenities are great, and our room was like a little oasis during our whirlwind tour -- something that is often difficult to find in cities and for a good price. I would recommend this hotel with no hesitations!

Reviews.Title: “Different, stylish and design-service could improve though”
Reviews.Author: efal
Reviews.Content: We stayed in SuiteDreams during a romantic getaway, seeking a place to relax and enjoy ourselves after our walks in the beautiful Roman city. All-in-all, this place offers a different style of accommodation, located in a floor of a large building near the centre of Rome (15'-20' walk to Spanish Steps) with renovated, large rooms and medium sized windows. Bed and bath is really large and spacious.Views are ugly. Room service should be offered as well as more amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Can't get any better!”
Reviews.Author: newyork62
Reviews.Content: We stayed at SuiteDreams for 4 nights in June and we loved every moment of it. Everything in this hotel is great! Rooms are very stylish and spotlessly clean, yet cozy and quiet, beds are very comfortable, bathrooms are high end. Breakfast is self served in a very nice spacious room and offers a large variety of choices, Nespresso coffee machine makes great esspresso and cappuccino. But what really makes this place is the fantastic front desk staff and the outstanding service. Roma and Pierfrancesco are amazing, always there to help with anything you need - directions, recommendations for places to go or restaurants, etc. SuiteDreams provided a quiet heaven to return to after a lond day of sightseeing in Rome. Can't wait to go back! Highly recommended! Dining tip: Try "Target" at the corner of the hotel building - tasty pasta and seafood dishes, nice ambiance, good service.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, modern hotel & great stay.”
Reviews.Author: capkel
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Suite Dreams for two nights while in Rome in June. Overall, a wonderful place. The rooms were extremely clean & modern, the service was outstanding, the breakfast was really generous & good. The staff was always available to answer questions and give directions without any hesitations. We would recommend this to any couple looking for a quiet, modern hotel in a fairly central location.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and great rooms”
Reviews.Author: LT-UK
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our first visit to Rome and the first location of 4 in Italy. On arrival (earlier than check in) we were able to leave our luggage in reception and offered a map with local restaurants for lunch highlighted. The service throughout our stay was fantastic. When we returned our luggage was already in our room. The room was clean, spacious and modern. The air-con was effective and quiet (not something we could say about all our hotels on our trip around Italy). Good size, clean bathroom. The breakfast had a very good selection (probably the best during our tour). The location of the hotel is good, I felt safe walking around in the evening and it was only a short walk to Republica metro, and all the main sights were within walking distance. We walked to both the Colosseum (20mins) and the Vatican (35 mins).

Reviews.Title: “Great place!”
Reviews.Author: matwags
Reviews.Content: We (2 adults and 2 teenagers) stayed at SuiteDreams for one night. We had a great stay. The Hotel is located 2 blocks from the Republicca Metro stop and Santa Maria Degli Angeli. It is situated on a quiet street. There is an elevator on the ground floor. The front desk staff were awesome and let us leave our luggage near the desk for a few hours before our check in time. When we came back, the luggage was in our room. The hotel is very modern and beautiful. They also gave me packing material for a bottle of wine. The room was spacious, clean and very cool. We had a queen bed and a queen sleeper sofa and both were very comfortable( I know, I know, a sleeper sofa comfortable? But it was like a memory foam mattress.) There was a jacuzzi tub which my youngest loved. There was a separate walk in shower. There was free wi fi. The AC worked great. Breakfast was good and there was a great variety. The capuccino was strong! We took the metro to Termini and then the Leonardo express to the airport. While this was fine, for about the same price, with considerably less hassle we could have taken a taxi. I would strongly recommend the taxi! We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Pricey, but worth it!”
Reviews.Author: chewiegranolabar
Reviews.Content: We loved the design of suitedreams! The room and bathroom was very modern and clean. It was abt 10 min from the Republicca train station, but with the stairs and road condition in Rome, it was a hard walk with luggage. Reception (Roma) was very helpful and fluent in English. She provided very clear directions on getting from place to place (via train or bus). Breakfast was a huge spread! There was ham and croissants, toast, juices, coffee. Although pricey, Suitedreams was a good experience! It was hard getting a room and they are full quickly, so good luck!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable - good for families and transport links”
Reviews.Author: stoatsbrother
Reviews.Content: Nothing much really to add - except to reinforce that the family room ( "A") has great facillities - including jacuzzi and shower, ipod dock, although the kids beds are in the same room as the main bed. Breakfast was good. The hotel is very well sited close to the Repubblica Metro station, the main rail terminus and several useful bus routes. Recommended

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel Deserves its TripAdvisor Rating!”
Reviews.Author: Patar
Reviews.Content: My husband, 18 year old daughter and I spent 4 nights here. I booked based on TripAdvisor reviews. Thank you again TripAdvisor! This hotel is on the 2nd floor (that's floor 3 in USA) of a building. Hard to find unless you look carefully for the sign posted next to the street level door. This door is locked and opens with room key (or by having the desk buzz you in.) Desk staff were fantastic! All of them spoke perfect English, and I didn't feel uncomfortable asking them to do so rather than struggling to speak Italian to them. The first night at check in we asked for a restaurant recommendation. The clerk went out of his way to mark up a map showing where to go and gave us several options. He even wrote a note to take to the restaurant, explaining in Italian that some of us are vegetarians! Room was spacious for the three of us. Much larger than most we've had in Europe! Well planned use of space, with our daughter's single bed being in a wide hallway across from the bathroom. This felt more private for everyone. Our room, and all areas of the hotel, were very clean. Beds were comfortable. There was a combination safe in the closet. Breakfast was pretty good. Lots of pastries/breads. Whole fresh fruit (but supply dwindled while we were there.) Yogurt, cheese, slice meats. Great Espresso/Cappuccino machine! Very convenient location in a safe area. Short walk to the train station and metro stops. About 10-20 minute walk to most tourist spots.

Reviews.Title: “A chic and minimalist haven in fabulous Rome”
Reviews.Author: RubyShoes5
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for the final leg of our mini tour of Italy in July 2009. We arrived in Rome by train and chose the hotel because of its proximity to the central train station, and of course, its excellent tripadvisor reputation. We were not disappointed. To say that Rome is hot in July is a major understatement. It is hard to describe how hot it actually is, but while we were there it felt like you could have baked a pizza on the pavement. Needless to say we made frequent and grateful use of the free drinking water fountains on many street corners and were very glad to come back to SuiteDreams each evening, not least because our room was so well air-conditioned. The hotel is situated just off the Via Nationale which is very central (or as central as you can be in a city where all the sights are spread so far from one another). The hotel is in an apartment block and is only marked at street level by a discreet plaque. This gave us a thrill as it felt like we were being admitted to an actual private Roman residence, and not merely a 'touristy' hang-out. The fact that we looked like perspiring lobsters for most of the trip somewhat ruined this illusion though! Our room was very sleek and comfortable, with a modern and elegant bathroom. Others have mentioned the free mineral water provided each day. We too thought this was a nice touch. Breakfast was served in a suitably chic breakfast room and consisted of an excellent selection of fruit juices, breads, croissants, toast and cereals, with a lovely self service coffee machine which I had great fun with each morning. The staff were very professional and courteous and kindly agreed to look after our cases on the final day after we had checked out but before we were ready to leave the city. If you are looking for a grand and majestic hotel, this is not it. SuiteDreams is less of a hotel and more of a sophisticated and quiet apartment. But then who goes to Rome to sit in their hotel? I am neither trendy, nor a minimalist, so I felt an incredible urge to liven up the decor slightly with a few flowery cushions or a nice big squashy armchair, and perhaps it does take itself a little too seriously, but apart from that, we loved it and wouldn't think of staying anywhere else on what will inevitably be future return trips to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Funky, Friendly and Fantastic!!”
Reviews.Author: Jaxxy09
Reviews.Content: After spending three nights with my 21 year old daughter at Suitedreams I can see why Rome's hidden gem was voted No 1 on Trip Advisor. This was the last stop on our European vacation and by far the most impressive. Ten minutes walk from Roma Centrale station and one block from the metro station Republicca in a quiet street off the main road - this boutique hotel has it all. Superb location, spacious funky rooms, modern large bathroom and superb breakfasts (included in price). I can still smell the croissants baking in the mornings. The staff were so friendly and accomodating (yet not overkill). Their recommendations on restaurants, cafes, shops and sights to see were top notch. In fact they made our stay in Roma an unforgettable experience. The hotel's name is an apt metaphor to describe our memories of Rome and our stay at Suitedreams.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant staff, service and location”
Reviews.Author: alfaspider073
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights in May and enjoyed our stay. Location: About a 10 minute walk from the main train station with metro stops only one or two minutes away in Piazza Repubblica. The sites were within easy walking distance (10 minutes to Piazza di Spagna etc) Staff: Courteous, informative and helpful. They provided information about dry cleaning, restaurants etc and organised these things for us. Breakfast: Was included as we'd booked online. It was basic but we had plenty to choose from. Also, two free water bottles were provided daily in room. Facilities: The room was very clean, roomy (I think we had room C) and quiet even though we faced the street. The hotel has free internet access via a laptop that sits in reception (printing available)

Reviews.Title: “Funky and spotless!”
Reviews.Author: Sophie24
Reviews.Content: We have just got back from a 3 night stay in Rome and were very impressed with Suitedreams. It is in a great location on a quiet street just around the corner from Piazza della Republica - where there is a Metro station. The hotel was perfect - very clean, modern and comfortable. There was plenty of choice for breakfast and all of the staff were so helpful, recommending restaurants and the best ways to get about. We would recommend the hotel to anyone - it is great value for money and fully deserves its number one spot on Tripadvisor!

Reviews.Title: “Overall Great Hotel, Great Service with Clean Stylish Rooms”
Reviews.Author: lancelarue
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 7 nights and were very impressed with the service at the hotel. The rooms were spacious and very clean and the location was terrific, only one block from a metro stop (Republicca) and an easy walk to the train station and the collisseum. The only negative was that the beds were hard and personally I found them very uncomfortable. I suggest the hotel invest in better beds but overall we found this a great hotel and worthy of its high tripadvisor ranking.

Reviews.Title: “SuiteDreams was Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: corkypine
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our vacation and spent two nights in Rome at the Suite Dreams hotel. It was FANTASTIC!! This was our first trip to Europe and the people at Suite Dreams were so helpful and accommodating (Roma was the best!!) Great location, close to the Metro, room was good size, huge bathroom and shower, very clean, free wi-fi, wonderful breakfast....it was the perfect hotel. We see now why this hotel was rated #1. What a wonderful find...thanks Trip Advisor!

Reviews.Title: “totally modern, chic and cool, this is the place to stay”
Reviews.Author: mode19
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for two nights. The place is totally modern, chic and cool. It's a great find, although I guess the word is out and it's winning all sort of awards now. It's a small boutique hotel, i think 15 rooms. It's got free wifi throughout the hotel, the rooms are quite spacious, and the look and feel is really nice. Hardwood floors, flatscreen tv's, some kind of stone walls in the shower, i want something like this for home, ha ha. It's also close to the train station and to the Piazza della Repubblica metro so it's convenient to go to the various sights, etc. It's a bit expensive but for how nice it is, I think it's good value, prolly a steal considering what we paid for hotels in other cities in Italy.

Reviews.Title: “A home away from home!”
Reviews.Author: Luv2travelHK
