Reviews.Content: We picked the hotel because of all the reviews we read from TripsAdvisor, and we were not disappointed! The staff were incredibly friendly, and helpful. We had lost our luggage in transit and Pierrefrancesco and his team really went out their way to help us settle in. The room was also v nice, quiet and clean (we had specifically asked to be placed in the quiet wing). The hotel is located on a quiet street near Republicca metro (3 mins walk) so getting to all major sites is not a problem at all. The warm and friendly service definately made our stay feel like home away from home! PS: If you book through the hotel's website, then breakfast is included.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, lovely hotel, really helpful staff!”
Reviews.Author: branfingelton
Reviews.Content: This hotel really is a hidden gem. Myself and my husband stayed here for three nights in June 2009 and loved every minute of it. The hotel is really well located and within walking distance of many of the main attractions of ancient rome. The metro stop is also about a 3 minute walk away. It felt like a very safe area, which is always really important for me when travelling. The hotel room was really clean,modern and a very good size. The breakfast each morning was really good with lots of cereal, juices and lots of italian biscuits!! It was really the exceptionally friendly staff that made our stay so memorable. They were always ready to recommend restaurants and good bars. I am a coeliac and have to follow a gluten free diet. When we arrived I asked at the reception how to say 'gluten free' in italian, Not only did the lady at the reception translate for me, but she looked up a list of restaurants serving gluten free food in the area! and booked us a table at one of the best! I was very impressed by that... the following morning at breafast, she had bought in some gluten free breakfast cereal and crackers.... this was really going far and beyond the call of duty. I would definitely return to suitedreams hotel when in Rome the next time!! Enjoy :-)

Reviews.Title: “Awesome rooms and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: ZoomerB
Reviews.Content: We stayed at SuiteDreams on our honeymoon, and it lived up to its top-notch TripAdvisor rating. The room was spacious, with nice contemporary furniture -- and best of all, it had a jacuzzi! The desk staff was very helpful. They also have an internet-connected computer that you can use for free, which helped us make some last-minute reservations. We highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, modern, and comfort with great service”
Reviews.Author: Brentlin
Reviews.Content: We stayed at SuiteDreams for three nights and will defintely come back again. Pierefrancisco (owner,manager) was very passionate about making you comfortable. He helped us with dinner reservations, tour information, booking transfers and anyting else we needed. The hotel was just what we expected and exactly like the pictures. Clean rooms, amazing spacious bathrooms, and for Europe the rooms were bigger than we expected. (towels were very comfy) The location was within walking distance of all the great sites in Rome and close to the Metro station if you don't feel like walking. The buffet continental breakfast came with our rate and was more than satisfactory. We loved the Nespresso machine and fresh pastries and cold cuts. Value for your money.

Reviews.Title: “#1 Rating well deserved”
Reviews.Author: dergondarkhelm
Reviews.Content: I don't think I've given a 5 star hotel review here on TA......but this is it. Pierre was a wonderful owner acting as concierge, local "in the know", and friendly greeter. We were with three couples and all six of us thought this place was great. It is a small boutiqui hotel, but the rooms are large for europe with new fixtures in the bath, clean white linens and free wifi in each room (or a free computer station if you didn't bring your laptop). Morning breakfast was basic but with a nice espresso maker. Location is walking distance from the central station and only a cople hundred feet from the Republica metro stop. 15 min walk to Forum/Colosseum. Abssolutely will use SuiteDreams for my next Rome trip!

Reviews.Title: “Suite Dreams Hotel/B+B, Rome, Italy”
Reviews.Author: ceoguy
Reviews.Content: Suite Dreams Hotel/B+B absolutely deserves its #1 rating. Stayed for 3 nites as a single in April. Rooms quite comfortable tho not opulent. Breakast quite good. Location fantastic as it's a block away from the Repubblica metro stop on the Orange line and an easy 4 or 5 block walk from the main train/bus station. Pricing is fair. But its principal plus was the staff -- always willing to "take care" of things for you, such as restaurant recommendations and reservations, transit advice, etc. Extremely professional people whose English skills probably exceeded mine. Would stay again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “It is a great B&B !”
Reviews.Author: AdolfoB
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a hotel, with restaurant, swimming pool, sauna, business center, etc.. forget it - this is a perfect B&B ! Service is very good and helpful, and will give you nice indications about everything in Rome. Rooms are clean and brand new - what is a big difference comparing to other hotels in Europe in general. Big rooms but no view. The hotel is located in a hidden street close to Piazza Republica, and in the building are other B&B's. We took a cab organized by the hotel and everything was great (and you pay exactly the same fees as any other cab). Breakfast is good and serves more than usual in Italy. Location is also good, in a safe area, close to Termini station (10 minutes walk, with luggage), 2 blocks from Republica metro station and easy walking to most of attractions in Centro Storico area. I would recommend this hotel to all, and it will be for sure my next choice for staying in Rome !

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best service in Rome!!!”
Reviews.Author: PassportBlues
Reviews.Content: Having frequently traveled the globe for business and pleasure, neither my wife nor I have experienced the high level of service that we found at Suite Dreams. Unfortunately we only spent one night at the hotel - other nights in Rome at Marriott Grand Flora and Westin Excelsior - but in hindsight wish we would have booked our entire stay in Rome at Suite Dreams. The level of personalized, yet unobtrusive service at this hotel rivals what we've experienced at five star properties around the globe - think Four Seasons. As others have commented, the rooms are comfortable with a modernistic flair and very clean. While the unassuming entrance to the property may give pause to some travelers, please know one of Rome's true hidden gems in nestled comfortably inside. We will definitely book our next stay in Rome at Suite Dreams. Safe travels.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, spacious rooms in small hotel”
Reviews.Author: Holly16
Reviews.Content: We stayed a few nights in February. Our room was new, large and well thought out. The bathroom was fantastic. The fittings are quality. A lot of attention has gone into the details (things like blockout shutters on the window). It is an easy (5 to 10 minute) walk from the main Rome railway station and only a minute or two from the subway. Also easy walking distance to the old centre of town. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: ralphlaurine
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderul stay at SuiteDreams. Pierfrancesco was amazing help and full of great information on getting around the city, places to eat and more. Breakfast was wonderful and if you book online breakfast is included in your stay. The rooms were very nice and the A/C was a great addition.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location”
Reviews.Author: lime439
Reviews.Content: Stay here four 4 nights rooms well kept, staff extremely polite and helpful location is excellent just steps away from Repubblica subway stop easy walking distance to coliseum and termini train station and there is a grocery store about 700 meters on Via Nazionale sodas only .60 each there. Only critical thing I have to say about my stay a lot of noise comes thru the door from the hallway/lobby area

Reviews.Title: “A lovely boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: dutch123
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights. A really nice, modern hotel situated near the station. Beds were really comfortable and bathroom was good and well epuiped. Varied breakfast to set you up for the day. Special mention to Valerio on reception who was a great help, trying to book tickets and full of information. Would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you could want in a hotel...”
Reviews.Author: bjndoh
Reviews.Content: This hotel deserves it's TripAdvisor award. The hotel is close to the main train station and most main attractions. It is in a great, very "Italian" building, occupied by other businesses and the hotel takes up one floor of the building. The rooms are clean, modern and extremely comfortable. All of the staff went out of their way to ensure we had everything we needed. Breakfast was also very enjoyable - fresh breads, fruit and a coffee machine. Definitely good value for money - especially in Rome and compared to other hotels I have stayed in there.

Reviews.Title: “A Fabulous Gem”
Reviews.Author: ncyankee61
Reviews.Content: My husband found Suite Dreams on TripAdvisor -- I'm so glad he booked it. What a wonderful boutique hotel. Great location, super clean, wonderful breakfast, and the best staff. The rooms are modern and comfortable; and so very clean. I love the wood floors and all the tile. We stayed in "a" suite. Quiet and so very comfortable; our room also had a jacuzzi tub. The breakfast is quite a treat. Coffee, juice, tea; different pastries and fresh baked croissants. Fruit, cereal, yogurt. The staff is available 24/7 -- and they were very helpful with everything. I can't say enough positive things about Suite Dreams -- I would definitely stay here again if I'm ever back in Roma. Also the wifi is free - you don't find that too often these days.

Reviews.Title: “La Dolce Vita in noisy Rome”
Reviews.Author: IT-GIRLKYM
Reviews.Content: La Dolce Vita is the best way to describe the hotel in 3 words. The service, the location, the rooms, the breakfest, everything was excellent. It is a hidden gem in the middle of noisy Rome. At this boutique hotel you feel like you're at home immediately. The welcome was very warm and friendly after a relaxing ride from the airport to the hotel with the driver (50 euro). We got a card with very good tips from the hotelowner. We got on the hop on/hop off tour from 110, which was very good. The service was excellent: very good breakfest, the service at the reception was great, always there to help you. There is also FREE Wifi internet in the room, but when you don't have your laptop with you, you can use the laptop in the lobby. The room: modern but warm. It felt like home to me. A really really good bed!! Very clean, cosy and roomy. I loved the bathroom and douche. It's also very quite in the room! I loved it! The hotel has a very good and central location, near Piazza Republica (metrostop) and near Termini (5 minute walk). I absolutely fell in love with the hotel, the service and we will come back and next time we will make the reservation for the suite with jacuzzi.

Reviews.Title: “Roman hospitality at its best”
Reviews.Author: AndySee
Reviews.Content: We couldn't have chosen a better hotel for our 20th wedding anniversary and wholeheartedly agree with all of the positive posts. Special mentions must go to; Pierfrancesco for helping make it extra special by arranging red roses and fizz for our arrival, providing daily advice and recommending the lovely La Matriciana - a stylish delicious restaurant, very popular with the locals. And Frankie for the cups of tea and especially for recommending a romantic restaurant for our final dinner: Casina Valadier - an unbelievable villa set in the grounds of Villa Borghese with panoramic views of the City (highlighted by firework displays for Natale a Roma 2009!) Hotel location was great, with plenty on the doorstep and lots of the main attractions within easy walking distance - although we took advantage of the HOHO buses as feet can only take so much! (we preferred the RomeOpen to the 110). Altogether, a fantastic experience with wonderful people - thanks to everyone. Andy and Alli, Newcastle, UK

Reviews.Title: “Suite Dreams 2009”
Reviews.Author: mdvpc
Reviews.Content: My wife and I are staying here this week. Booking through the internet was easy. Price is reasonable for a big city like Rome. Very helpful staff. The staff at the front desk speak excellent English and are nice. Room is very clean, modern decor for Rome. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel that ticks all the boxes for a city break.”
Reviews.Author: Umney
Reviews.Content: Pierfrancesco is so genuine & helpful & he really wants to ensure that your experience of Rome is a great one. Our teenage son was emailing Pierfrancesco before we went regarding purchasing football tickets & he did everything he could to secure these for us. Upon arriving at SuiteDreams he greeted our son by his 1st name as though they were old friends which was really welcoming. The reception is manned 24/7 & Pierfrancesco & all his staff are friendly & approachable if you need any help e.g. we needed a dry cleaners & as it was Easter weekend & they were going to close for 3 days he 'phoned them & arranged for our cleaning to be done immediately & returned within 3 hours - great service! The rooms are very clean & comfortable although we did find the bed quite hard. The bathroom was very trendy with a square sink & slate tiles. The hot water was endless. The free wifi & daily bottled water are a bonus. Book on-line to receive free continental breakfast (07:30-10:30) with great coffee to start your day. Try the MonteCarlo restaurant for a real Rome eating experience, one of many recommended by Pierfrancesco that didn't disappoint. All in all, a home away from home that we'd recommend to anyone visiting Rome.

Reviews.Title: “No hesitation in recommending this hotel”
Reviews.Author: melba
Reviews.Content: A great hotel with very good staff who actually CARE what you think or want, extremely obliging. I've added a photo of what we received from Pierfrancesco when I asked if we could use the kitchen to make a night cup of tea, he insisted he would do it and came back to the room with a tray of tea and bickies! I wish the world's hotel staff had to do their apprenticeship with Suitedreams.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel , Genuine Friendly Staff, Just Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Nigel_Hyde
Reviews.Content: We arrived in the afternoon to Suite Dreams using a pre booked car via Suite Dreams. Our room was fantastic very modern the free wifi in the hotel was a welcome change to many hotels we have stayed at in the past. You also recieve free bottled water each day which is a nice touch. The owner is nothing but a geniune man, who really has a love for Suite Dreams and making sure everyone has a great stay. If you are going to Rome then stay here, its nice after a long day of Sight Seeing to come back to hotel that is so welcoming.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and restful, great location!”
Reviews.Author: SeattleSue79
Reviews.Content: First trip to Rome for me, my husband and two teenage daughters...we booked a room and a suite for the four of us, and it was exactly as other reviewers have noted: quiet, convenient to the train/subway station, immaculately clean and modern, free breakfast, free internet, and quite possibly the best staff in the world. The suite even had a DVD player and the front desk keeps a small selection of discs, which entertained us when we were too tired to go out in the evenings. We live in Tokyo, where hotel service is famously excellent, but the Suitedreams manager has them beat! The warm and welcoming atmosphere was a special relief after long days of sightseeing, where we unfortunately found that many people in Rome were sometimes rude and unkind. We stayed for almost a week, and didn't actually get bored with the breakfast offering since there was toast, cereal, coffee cake, ham, cheese, bread, croissants, cookies (?), yogurt, and fresh fruit along with juices, drip coffee and a cappuccino machine. As others have mentioned, there are a million places to eat nearby, in all price ranges. We will definitely stay here again when we return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic experience !!!”
Reviews.Author: golfc
Reviews.Content: Thank you trip advisor you brougt me to SuiteDreams ! Wise choice. Good location. Modern. Extra clean. Good breakfast. Close to subway station. Most of all = staff so helpful, pleasant. You feel at home. Free internet. Will recommend to all my friends and collegues.

Reviews.Title: “Lives up to and deserves its top ratings”
Reviews.Author: Argond
Reviews.Content: Looking for a hotel in Rome was harder than we thought - everywhere seemed expensive for what you got. Then we saw Suite Dreams and it's top ratings on TripAdvisor - so glad we did! Couldn't quite believe it could be so good for the price but everything you read here is true. Great little hotel, our room was very stylish, clean, comfortable, free wifi so we could Skype home, fantastic designer bathroom with granite shower area. Great oasis to come back to and chill out after day out and about in the city. Very helpful staff who speak good English. They arranged a taxi to and from the airport for us and helped with restaurant suggestions etc. Breakfast was free as we had booked online (so make sure you do!) and while it was absolutely fine, you might want a bit more variety if you're there for a few days. Area quiet, away from noise and cars, easy to walk to Rome's sights. Go to the cafe on the corner opposite the hotel entrance for good coffee too. Pay in cash and you get 5% off the bill.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute Gem!”
Reviews.Author: mrbmufc
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights in February 2009. Proposed to my girlfriend and the hotel sorted champagne in the room for afterwards and recommended a great restaurant over looking Rome for that evening. Staff very helpful and the cleanliness was immaculate. Very modern and great location. Hidden away in the side street a bit difficult to find if you don't know what to look for. Very quiet and peaceful. Free internet in reception if you want it as well. Would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Tripadvisor reveiws are true!”
Reviews.Author: SHELLEYB1981
Reviews.Content: A very brief review: We stayed at SuiteDreams for 2 nights. We had a triple room which was very spacious and had everything we needed. It was quite a strange set-up (not like a normal hotel layout wise) but nonetheless it was perfect for our trip. Staff were really helpful, rooms very clean, breakfast was good and the location perfect. We would all stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: flo_london
Reviews.Content: My friend and I booked this solely on the reviews here on Tripadvisor and we were not disappointed. We arrived early from the airport before our room was ready, to a lovely warm welcome and were invited to use the bathroom before setting forth with a complimentary map. Many many hours later we returned to find our bags already set out in our room, and the facilities explained i.e. where and when breakfast was, how the lights, tv worked, to ask if we wanted a hairdryer, dvd player, corkscrew, use of laptop, basically just to ask if we needed anything! Breakfast was included to those who booked online and was served between 0730 and 1030 which is a really nice time span. Couldn't fault the continental breakfast. Have to say our room was lovely, simply but stylishly decorated, good size with a decent bathroom. Nice touch with the complimentary water in the fridge. Overall, we loved this place, and all the staff were so incredibly helpful and friendly, so would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: miamummy
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a long weekend and loved this hotel its really new and modern rooms and the location was perfect. You were within walking distance of everywhere and the metro which is 2 minutes away was easy to use and took you to all the major sights in minutes for 1 euro! The front of house staff are beyond helpful and the breakfast was just what you needed to start the day. I would definately return but I think I would book the room with the Jacuzzi as I got a peak at it and it looks ace! The restaurant at the corner of the building (Target I think its called) is well worth a visit Would definately stay here on a return visit

Reviews.Title: “Clean, modern haven for footsore tourists”
Reviews.Author: UKBells
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, close to one of the main streets and only steps to nearest metro, yet nothing to disturb our sleep. Room was bright and modern with a stylish shower room and fluffy towels. Free water each day was a nice touch and all the staff we met were very helpful and friendly. Self service breakfast was more than adequate and for Rome this stay was excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “What a great find!”
Reviews.Author: rodetripper
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a hidden gem in Rome. It is located in a residential building in an excellent location. The design is very sleek and modern, providing an interesting and restful contrast to the ornate grandeur of the city around it. The room were large and comfortable and the bathroom was gorgeous. There is a wonderful breakfast served in a very charming room. Coffee is available from the most fantastic espresso machine I have ever seen. I am in love with this machine! I was a hotel nightmare on both my arrival and departure. Due to total stupidity on my part, I arrived at the hotel with both a 52 euro taxi bill (you do not want to know the details, but trust me, you are smarter than I am), and no money to pay it. I went up to check in and asked if they could pay the taxi and add it to my bill. This is not a way to make a good first impression, but with scarcely any hesitation, the proprietor said yes of course, and didn't blink when we hauled in enough luggage to embarrass a movie star. We also had to catch a 7 am flight at the end of our stay, and they graciously arranged for a car and driver to take us to the airport for the same cost as a taxi. He arrived promptly at 4 am, as scheduled, and hauled the ridiculous amount of luggage for us. This was our first trip to Rome and the hotel was so attractive and so well located that everything was made simple. Thank you, SuiteDreams!

Reviews.Title: “B&B??? Its a perfect cosy design hotel”
Reviews.Author: CPH_2100
Reviews.Content: Since the opening exactly 1 year ago today I have been fortunate to stay at Suite Dreams 4 times. It has been a great pleasure each time with high standard of service. In May and July I brought my 2 kids as well. We received a special family room and a jacuzzi experience for the kids... This time for a tour around the city visiting restaurants and galleries. Great assistance from the staff on making reservartions, giving direction, booking transportation etc. . . Highly recommended hotel... Not a B&B... ..most diffinately a HOTEL ..

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for Rome”
Reviews.Author: Mary014
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel simply on reviews on trip advisor. The hotel was fairly easy to find from Termini, direct from Fuimicino airport. The hotel lift was not that easy to get into with luggage, but once we were there, we had a warm welcome from the owner and got shown to our room across the corridor which meant it was quiet. The amenities and standard of the hotel was good, very clean. Free bottled water in the room and we had breakfast included, which yes if you stay more than 3 days which we did it was very much the same, but a good saving on what you might spend in the cafes - especially as there is a Nespresso coffee machine to get your capuccinos! The water the first couple of evenings was luke warmish, but ok. The bathrooms were really lovely, the shower just could have done being a bit more powerful. The location was very convenient as the Republica stop takes you direct to Piazza di Spagna, Vatican and it was 15 mins walk to Colesseum. Food there are so many choices, some really lovely ones, but many very touristy trying to lure you in. You should try 'Target' though next to hotel - good quality. Would recommend hotel esp if budgets an issue.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for our weedend stay”
Reviews.Author: Julesdm
Reviews.Content: Tripadvisor does it again!! The reviews are true to the venue. It is a short walk from the train station, centrally located for all tourist destinations. The metro is adjacent to the hotel and the open top buses leave from out side the train station. We had booked a weekend based on the previous reviews and were happy to confirm their content when we arrived. It is a first floor private building conversion, done very tastefully. We had the room opposite the front desk. Worried we would be kept up all night by the coming and goings of people and i sleep lightly, i did not hear a thing and with the hard matress had one of the best nights sleep i've had for a while. The breakfast was simple but worth the money. the coffee was good as was the crossants. Rome is expensive now with the Euro in the wrong direction for us Brits so i can recommend you take the breakfast. The staff are very helpful and made it a great stay. We did venture to the owners restaurant which i had read on this web site. It was AWSOME we had a great meal and as it is out of central rome $10 taxi ride the bill was not heavy on the pocket. I highly recommend you visit it. I would concur with the other review where by if you were staying longer than a weekend, you may want a hotel bar/restaurant or fomal lobby to hang out in. Suite Dreams unfortunately does not have this, but they do offer a free laptop with internet access and DVD's for those who want. All in all i would recommend for any age group. Would i go back....yes....but i like variety....

Reviews.Title: “loved every minute of it”
Reviews.Author: schlumpf25
Reviews.Content: me and my partner stayed there for a romantic getaway and couldn't be more complimentary towards the whole experience!!!! the staff couldn't be more than accomodating and the rooms are immaculate!!! soo convenient to everything and just provides the best services for the price......plus the showers are amazing!!!!!! the only drawback, and it's a minor one, is the breakfast room which is very blah and small...very small and uncomfortable because it felt you were sitting on top of each other...

Reviews.Title: “Better than my own home!”
Reviews.Author: MP1130
Reviews.Content: My friend and I spent 5 nights at Suite Dreams and absolutely loved our stay. The owner, Pierre Francesco, made us feel at home immediately. The beautiful hotel is the apartment that he grew up in and he is the ultimate host. When we arrived he said he hoped we would feel like we were staying with friends. Friends who just so happen to have an amazing home in Rome. My friend had trouble with her ATM card and Pierre Francesco immediately jumped to help her out and find out what he could do. His staff has been with him for many years and you can tell that they have a good relationship, like family, and they keep the hotel immaculate. They are also very knowledgeable about where to go, eat, etc. and offered to help us get tickets, too. Our room was very clean and super tastefully decorated with wood flooring, fluffy white beds, sleek modern decor and a brand new bathroom. It was roomy, even by American standards and had a flat screen TV and every amenity, including a fancy hairdryer, a nice closet and wireless LAN with a very speedy connection in every room and a laptop in the lobby. It is located on Via Modena, which is close to Repubblica and an easy walk from Termini, the train station that you will take to get into town from either airport. We walked absolutely everywhere in Rome and really enjoyed the neighborhood the hotel is located in. Breakfast was included since we booked on the hotel's website and it included Nespresso, tea, juice, bread, baked goods, cheese, meat, jam, Nutella and fresh fruit. It was very tasty and plentiful. We got free water bottles each day in our mini bar, another nice touch. All in all, you can't ask for a nicer place to stay or a nicer host.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location, lovely, clean, trendy hotel, be wary of Manager!”
Reviews.Author: DublinDotty
Reviews.Content: I agree with everyone's comments about this hotel, location fab, rooms fab, modern, clean and spacious. Excellent gadgets and design. Breakfast was lovely (Just so people know what to expect there is no bar or restaurant in the hotel, in fact it is on the second floor of a beautiful old building but just to warn people in case their preference is a hotel with bar, restaurant etc.) I have to say, I was surprised before I went to Rome when I read Shellyburger's review, particularly when everyone else's reviews were so positive towards Pierfranceso, but I think that if you get on the wrong side of him you will know! There is a strict non-smoking policy in the hotel which I have no problem with, however my boyfriend had one cigarette out the large window in our room on our first morning and then left the window open to air out the room. When we returned to the hotel that afternoon after sightseeing, I received a phonecall from Pier explaining that there was to be no smoking, which I didnt argue with and respected (in fact, I was very embarassed that he knew & I completely respected the fact that we did break the rule) he then went on to tell me that if rules and regulations were not adhered to he has to get the police involved, he was rather threatening in his tone which i did not like and after the phonecall again as Shellyburger had mentioned we felt very uncomfortable around him. There was only luke warm water one afternoon which I was very upset about about as was so sore after walking around Rome all day, Pier did offer if we wanted to have a shower in another room were the water was hot, but I felt that was unacceptable as I wanted a hot shower in my own room but I was too afraid of him to argue! He can be quite intimidating. So overall, lovely hotel, probably would recommened to a friend but if you get on the wrong side of Pier you will find out pretty soon!

Reviews.Title: “A perfect little gem in Rome.”
Reviews.Author: BGMaryland
Reviews.Content: SuiteDreams is a lovely little gem of a hotel in a wonderful location. The hotel is simply but beautifully furnished with wonderful modern en suite bathrooms, very comfortable bedding, and generous closet/storage space for a week's stay. The breakfast each morning is a feast both the eyes and the palate and is served in a lovely little breakfast room. During our stay we enjoyed the wonderful Italian yogurt, the delicious coronetti, croissants, fresh fruit, ham and cheese and execellent coffee. The hotel is situated on the first floor and has a lift which will accommodate two guests with luggage. The hotel's common areas and rooms are impeccably clean and very quiet. The staff at SuiteDreams is friendly, helpful, and courteous. They take great pride in making your stay in Rome as wonderful as possible by providing restaurant recommendations, reservations and even a DVD player with videos after an especially tiring day. The location near Piazza Repubblica is a few short blocks to a Metro station and a taxi stand and many sites are nearby. Most tourist sites are a mile or less from the hotel and walking is very pleasant. We can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel - totally recommend”
Reviews.Author: StuBailey
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Suite Dreams for 2 nights whilst in Rome for a weekend and I can say how great this hotel is. The location is ideal only a 10-15 minute walk to the historical centre of Rome and 2 mins from the Metro which takes you over to the Vatican. The hotel was just what we wanted - quiet, relaxed, clean, well appointed etc, Lovely breakfast which was included in the price if you book direct. The owner of the hotel is a really nice, helpful gentleman. He couldn't do enough for us - making reservations in restaurants, transportation, fress use of wi-fi etc. Nothing was too much trouble. For the price this is definitely a 5*

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay at Suite Dreams”
Reviews.Author: Kirkolam
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Suite Dreams for 4 nights over new year, and it was perfect for what we needed. It is very central, a stone's throw from Republica metro, just off Via Nazionale, a 10 minute walk to the main train/bus station, Terminale. The room was lovely and modern and the owners were so lovely, they genuinely made us feel so welcome and couldn't do enough to help. As we booked direct on the website, we got the free continental breakfast which was also lovely. The only thing to bear in mind when booking is that it is definitely more of a bed and breakfast rather than a hotel, so if you're looking for somewhere with room service/hotel bars etc, it's not for you. However, with all the brilliant restaurants so near the hotel, and the owners so willing to offer advice and make bookings on your behalf, it's not a big issue. I would highly recommend it as a great place to explore Rome, without breaking the bank.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay in rome!”
Reviews.Author: America410
Reviews.Content: Suite Dreams is a great place to stay in Rome. The hotel is VERY clean and the staff is wonderful. The rooms are very nice and the hotel is centrally located near the Termini and the Republica Metro Stations. The breakfast is nice and included if you book through the website. I would recommend this hotel while in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Suitedreams suites us”
Reviews.Author: jo0853
Reviews.Content: We dealt mostly with Pierfrancesco and he is a thoroughly professional businessman. We felt like nothing was too much to ask of him or his staff. All the positive attributes in the blogs are totally correct and it is a pleasure to meet someone who provides a service for his business. He was polite, helpful and eager. Reception even made calls to ‘lost property’ at Qatar Airways on my behalf because I don’t speak Italian. I read one review that said only 2 sachets of shower gel was supplied per day. Honestly, how hard is it to bring your own toiletries??? He tracked us down when we were in Florence to advise us of booking we had requested. The rooms have fantastic fast wifi and funky very modern clean bathrooms. Flat screen tv, safe and plenty of room. The hotel is one block from ‘Republic’ metro or 2 blocks from Termini. Coffee shops are on just about every corner and a fantastic pizza and grill next door. We walked to Roman Forum and Colosseum, but buses, trains and main road are just one block away. We left our suitcases at the hotel for a few hours after check out, and it did not cost anything. I had read otherwise in a blog but realise it was a false report. The breakfasts at suitedreams are typical of Rome, just look around and you will find the same everywhere. Breakfast in Rome is not 'coronary on a plate’ like some hotels.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic option”
Reviews.Author: jonnyAiken
Reviews.Content: I'd been to Rome on a previous occasion. Loved the city, it's amazing. The drawback however was our choice of accommodation, very poor. So on this, our 2nd trip to Rome I was a little wary when it came to choosing a hotel. Searching online, I stumbled across Suite Dreams. The pics of the interior looked like exactly what I was looking for - mod, chic and minimal. I was a little concerned that no matter how much I searched, I could not find a pic of the outside of the hotel. However, being impressed by the reviews, and satisfied by the pricing, I went ahead and booked. The Hotel is not much to look at from outside, which is prob why I couldn't find a pic, but once inside, it's a fantastic find. With less than a dozen rooms, it's a small, family run setup, which means the reception and staff are friendly and really helpful. The hotel is very clean, quite, relaxed and modern. It's in a good location, just 5 or 10mins walk from Termini station, and within walking distance of many of the main attractions. Id recommend this place in an instant.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, location, and price”
Reviews.Author: TurtleCat
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough about this hotel. The location was great, the staff was amazing, the room was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: MumandEleanor
Reviews.Content: A five minute walk from the Central Station in Rome and you arrive at Via Moderna to find Suite Dreams is the first floor of a large building. Good 24 hr access. Quiet road even on New Years Eve! English/American speaking young lady gave us a brief welcome on the 29th, however she seldom raised her head whenever we returned. The rest of the desk staff we saw were very welcoming and helpful. Double Exec room was clean, modern, newly renovated, minimalistic. Bathroom small but good quality sanitaryware. No hairdryer but you can borrow. Extra pillows no problem. Only 2 individual sachets of shower gel per day! Needed to ask for more every day. Shower temperature variable especially in morning but manageable. Can be slippery, no handles. Bed was very hard but sheer exhaustion from sightseeing meant we slept well. Corridor had reception desk, computer for guests use, books and seats. The breakfast room had an amazing chandelier. Very clean room, nicely laid out. Good coffee machine & choice of teabags. Minimal breakfast, sufficient if poor choice e.g. cereal, cornflakes only; bread, only stale square white bread beside toaster. Over 3 mornings only, needed to ask for food and cutlery trays to be refilled and even for milk to be put out. However, although this may seem to be complaining, we felt that the only problem with Suite Dreams is that the staff are not trained properly.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good, but NOT #1”
Reviews.Author: poopdeckFL
Reviews.Content: A good solid choice (near the Termini Station) but NOT deserving of #1 spot. Clean, modern/contemporary, but basic. No charm, limited views etc. The breakfast is adequate, but we found it often poorly stocked and limited in selection (4days). Plenty of storage, and a sizeable safe, contrasted by a small, somewhat cramped bathroom w/ shower only (did not stay in the suite--occupied) and limited counter space. The towel warmer did not work. The staff was fluent in many languages; accomodating and friendly but we did not feel overly pleasant or helpful. There are able to assist with most activities, but we received only modest assistance with city/sight directions and transportation issues. They do offer a list of recommended restaurants, they are mostly above average and worth visiting. Our room was not ready upon arrival (before check-in), they offered to store our luggage, but it is left in the hallway along side the check-in desk, not locked in a storage area. Upon return, our room was not ready at the promised time. (The staffing is minimal and maid service and breakfast room staff are slow--based on the workload.) We were switched to an alternate room. I asked if the room was quiet and was assured it was---it was not. All the floors are wooden and they transmit any movement in the hallways, or adjoining rooms. There is little, if any outside noise. We were in the hallway near the entry door and heard it shut/slam everytime someone was not careful closing it. The hotel is reasonably priced (they have an upcharge on the weekends) but certainly not a 'value'. You can do much better--price wise-- during low season. The desk clerk did not offer the discount for cash--until reminded about it. We were offered 5% and it is hardly worth the risk of amassing the cash for the savings. We found this hotel to be a good solid choice, but I am in disagreement with many of the reviews posted suggesting it it more then it is. You will have a good stay, a fair breakfast, for an OK price, but you will come away wondering why this hotel is remotely close to the #1 spot!

Reviews.Title: “a very good hotell”
Reviews.Author: pyttanSweden
Reviews.Content: This was really a nice hotel with great service. We were lucky to spend four nights here. Would recommend it to anyone! The swedish couple

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: Saisawan
Reviews.Content: We just got back from Italy and already have a plan to go back next year. We stayed 3 nights at Suite Dreams in Rome and couldn't ask for any better place and service. Our luggage was delayed for a couple of days. One of the staff, the lovely Roma called the airline to follow up on it everyday. Everyone at Suite Dreams is very friendly and helpful. The hotel also owns a small restaurant outside the city center called Osteria Chiana. If you have a chance, please try it. It was one of the best meals we had in Rome. Thanks again for the wonderful stay Federico, Pierfrancesco, Frankie, Roma and everyone else who we forgot the names. See you next year!!!

Reviews.Title: “Cleanest Hotel I've ever stayed in!!!!”
Reviews.Author: travelling_man_11
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here on a split stay of 2 nights on the front end and 2 nights on the back end of our vacation to Italy. The owner, Francesco (Piero) is such an incredible individual who has taken the concept of lodging to a whole new level. His entire staff is customer friendly oriented and the customer is really treated like their own family. The rooms are extremely clean with a beautifual modern design. There are soundproof windows, flat screen tv, wood floors, modern tiled shower and bathroom. These are very good size rooms for Rome (actually quite big by Rome standards). The attention to detail in cleanliness and decoration is quite apparent. Also, the entire staff speaks English as well as many other languages. We were provided with a long list of restaurants and went to 2 of them which proved to be incredible. The hotel is within walking distance to Roma Termini ( the main train/subway terminal) of Rome. We actually brought our 3 pieces of luggage and walked from the Termini to Suite Dreams. However, you can also jump on the A line of the metro and go from Termini Metro to the Repubblica ( a one minute ride) and then only walk two blocks to the hotel. The hotel is in a very central and active location in Rome. I think it is safer than near the Vatican. The Vatican area at night is very quite and not much is going on. I would stay here at Suite Dreams again. Breakfast is very delicious with ham and cheesed, fresh fruits, juice, American coffee, Italian espresso, croissants, cookies etc...If you order through the website, they include it in the price. Also, You would be a fool not to stay here if going to Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice in Rome”
Reviews.Author: garyLS
Reviews.Content: If you’re looking for old world charm, this isn’t the place. But if you’re looking for a super modern and super efficient hotel close to the rail station, look no further than Suite Dreams. The room was great. Internet access was fast and free internet, both wifi for your own laptop or the communal computer in the lobby, The English speaking staff ready to help without being intrusive. Check in took about 90 seconds and check out even less. Note that this is a small hotel occupying the third floor of a large building.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem in bustling Rome”
Reviews.Author: Scottyr1977
Reviews.Content: Suite Dreams is one of those hotels only travelling farytales are made of. A perfectly suited hotel for the sophisticated, yet budget conscious customer with the location to match. I can honestly say that the hotel is at least half the price of its competitors but twice the quality in terms of room size, modernity, service and above all, that extra touch that makes the stay memorable. The owner and his staff are exceptionally friendly, always looking to help and give useful suggestions as to where to eat and public transport tips. What I really loved about it which speaks volumes for the style of hotel was the simple laptop with free internet use sitting outside reception. As the owner said, internet usage costs nothing, so why charge people for it. With this type of attitude, repeat business will surely be coming its way. As for the details of the place, the rooms were of a good size with a smallish, but perfectly suitable flat screen tv. The bathrooms were brand new and of a good size too. The only tip I would have is to close the windows at night as Via Moderna can get a little noisy in the mornings but with the windows shut, this is fine. Overall, Suite Dreams goes that extra mile to make your stay in Rome a memorable one. Happily recommend.

Reviews.Title: “We loved Suite Dreams”
Reviews.Author: sparkiestfiend
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, 2 minutes walk from La Republica metro station, no more than about 10 minutes walk from Rome's main train station. The hotel had a lovely, modern interior, with the nicest staff we have ever dealt with in a hotel. Fab little boutique hotel with probably only about 12 rooms. Breakfast only provided (included in price if you book on Suite Dreams website). We were there for 3 nights with our 11 month old baby and they couldn't do enough for either us or the baby. The hotel room was large, with a huge king size bed and a gorgeous bathroom, complete with modern power shower. The hotel bought in a brand new travel cot complete with bedding and blankets for us. The evening we arrived (around 10pm) the hotels owner greeted us personally to make sure we had everything we needed for the baby, he told us to let him know if we needed anything from tickets, restaurant reservations to if we'd bought something that wasn't suitable to let him know and he would sort it out as obviously he could speak the language! Anytime we're back in Rome, we will definately be staying here! Can highly recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “What a lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: biztravellerBC
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Suite Dreams for three nights (Nov 6-8) and enjoyed every moment of it. We agree with all the positive comments / reviews posted on the hotel. Many thanks to Pierfrancesco and Roma .... they have been most helpful and the hotel has totally exceeded our expectations .. it's home away from home. We plan to come back with the family.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Suite Dreams - Perfect”
Reviews.Author: roham
Reviews.Content: Wow! This is one of the best stays we've ever had in Italy. Mgmt makes you feel like family. Nice size rooms, free internet, great location - out of the tourist area, yet close enough to walk everywhere. Perfect!

Reviews.Title: “A Hidden Gem in Central Rome”
Reviews.Author: Robert30
Reviews.Content: There probably is not much more that I can add to what has already been said about this wonderful Hotel/B&B. I discovered it using TripAdvisor's "best of the best" in Rome. My wife and I thoroughly enjoyed our 7 day stay (28 Oct - 3 Nov 08) with absolutely no complaints or problems with the hotel. The owner, Pierfrancesco (Piero) was a very gracious host, making sure that all our needs were taken care of. The rooms and bathrooms were spotless! They were very large by European standards. The bath was very modern with a huge shower. His staff was extremely courteous and helpful and never failed to recognize us with a smile and the greeting of the day. The included breakfast was a great way to start each day. It included, but was not limited to, meat, cheese, cereal, yogurt, assorted breads, juice, coffee, and that Oh So Wonderful espresso/cappucino. We each would have at least 2 cups each morning. (I would sometimes have 3 cups) When we told Peiro that we planned to walk the city to see things we missed last year, he offered several places and churches to visit, along with directions and written information. Now that's service! Peiro has invested sizeable time, effort ,and money to modernize his property to make it a comfortable and convenient place to stay. My wife and I whole-heartedly recommend this property to anyone who is looking to visit Rome and desires to stay in a comfy, clean,and modern hotel. We were impresed, you will be, as well.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel with fab staff”
Reviews.Author: Rackathon
Reviews.Content: Myself and 7 others stayed here for a long weekend to celebrate a hen party. Although the hotel was a good 30 minute from the centre, it was well worth it. The hotel is very modern and contemporary. The rooms were spotless with high spec finishes everywhere...not at all what we expected. The reception is manned 24 hours and they were always happy to help....we even negotiated a late check when we rolled in at 5am (quietly of course!!!). The beds were massive and so was the shower. I really cant grumble about anything..... I am returning next year with my fiance to prove to him just how perfect this hotel was! If you're looking for a quiet, modern, spacious and friendly hotel, then suite dreams is a must.

Reviews.Title: “home suite home”
Reviews.Author: dunk1980
Reviews.Content: We capped our 12-day Italy tour with 3 nights in Rome and chose to stay in suite dreams because of the reviews here in tripadvisor. I have to say, I got more than I expected. I, travelling along with my brother, mother, AND 82-year old GRANDMOTHER, booked for their suite so we could be all together in one room. The suite was fantastic. there was a whirlpool/jacuzzi, a separate shower, a separate toilet, and two sinks. The breakfast was great as well. For a hotel with less than 15 rooms, the quality of the breakfast was at par with those of big chain hotels. Also, this is the only hotel in italy where there were small strips of pizza for breakfast. But the room and breakfast is just the beginning. The location is fantastic. there is a police station nearby so it is a definitely safe place to be. Also, it is just a 1 minute walk to Via Nazionale and a 2 minute walk to Piazza della Republica. And to top everything, the service was fantastic. All the receptionists we encountered (Maria and Roma) were very, very accomodating and caring... ready to answer all our questions. And the manager was very, very gracious. he even offered to get my grandmother's medicine from the pharmacy. And did i mention the free internet? The room, location, staff and their service made Suite Dreams feel like home suite home. :-) I would definitely stay here again and recommend this hotel to my friends who would visit rome.

Reviews.Title: “Fun”
Reviews.Author: fmDafna
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the "Suite Dreams" hotel for five nights for our honeymoon. The owner seems to love what he does and is completely committed to his work. We absolutely loved the design: The typography on the doors, the books and DVD library, the retro toys and pictures which added a personal touch to the modern design, the shower heads and the stone wall, the Simpsons poster (which made us feel right at home as we have a copy of the same poster). The beds were very comfortable. We felt safer than any other hotel we stayed at. The receptionists can see anyone coming to each room. The safe in the room was bigger than any hotel we stayed at in italy - We could fit our Laptop in the safe for the first time. Free WiFi connection was also a nice touch. The location is 5-10 minutes away from the train station. Also 20 minutes away from the Colosseum and even closer to the Pantheon. We walked - never used the bus or the train. Breakfast was very good. There were breads, croissants, cakes, cereal, coffee, hot chocolate etc... We did have small problems which the owner was eager to solve once he was told about. Each night cost us 130 euros, which we found was a great bargain. When we booked this hotel it was rated as the #31 hotel in Rome, and we're not surprised at all to see it is now rated as number one.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: kjlee
Reviews.Content: This little boutique hotel is fantastic. The location is 2 blocks from Termini Station in the city center. The staff were very helpful and spoke excellent English which helped immensely. The rooms were surprisingly bigger than what I had imagined from such a small hotel (15 rooms). The breakfasts had a great selection of fresh pastries, fruit, coffee, etc. I highly recommend this property for the smart traveler who enjoys a great place to sleep for a great price.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in Rome - book it now!”
Reviews.Author: nzcam
Reviews.Content: We have just finished a 6 night stay at Suite Dreams in Rome and loved it - we would definitely stay here again if we returned to Rome. * Fantastic staff! Very friendly and helpful, with great recommendations (for restaurants, sightseeing information etc.) * Great location: We walked everywhere in Rome from here, it is just a 5 minute walk from Termini station, 10 minutes to the Colosseum, Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, Piazza Navona, and other sights, and just around the corner from a subway stop, great cafes, supermarket, bookshop, tourist information etc. * Excellent room: we are travelling on our honeymoon so booked the suite - very large and peaceful so it was always nice to come home to. And it had a real Queen size bed - not just two singles pushed together, and a Jacuzzi... * Free wifi * Continental breakfast & coffee * Books, magazines, and DVDs (not that you will have time while in Rome...) * Some nice touches, like free bottled water every day too. If we ever come back to Rome we are definitely staying here!

Reviews.Title: “Very sweet stay at Suite Dreams !!”
Reviews.Author: TJLandof10000lakes
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very spacious by European standards, and compare in size very favorably to any American hotel. Rooms were stylish and attractively furnished. The shower stall had a nice touch of using stone walls to give it a unique look. The help at the front desk was very friendly, and extremely helpful with directions, restaurant recommendations, tips on subway usage & calling a cab !! It was also a nice touch to have a laptop w/ internet connection available (at no charge) by the front desk. Breakfast is included in the room rate, and was very comparable to what is served elsewhere in Italy. The room price was very competitive. Overall, a great experience !!

Reviews.Title: “Super”
Reviews.Author: CPH-NYC
Reviews.Content: New. Stylish. Roomy, modern, discrete interior. Very friendly, attentive, helpful staff. Good location on a side street. Quiet. Air conditioned. Affordable. Nice breakfast. Strongly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “nice little spot”
Reviews.Author: bmalher
Reviews.Content: Suitedreams is in a nice spot, close to the Metra and walking distance from most of the main Rome attractions. The people were super helpful, from suggesting decent dinner spots to letting them use their printer; you really could not have asked for more from the staff. My only real complaint was the bed; it was waaay too hard. The pillows were nice and sheets were comfortable but the twin bed mattress just did not do it for me. I would definitely recommend this hotel to any of my friends visiting Rome

Reviews.Title: “Sweet Dreams....”
Reviews.Author: Galnn
Reviews.Content: I have spent the last weekend in Rome and stayed at the 'suitedreams' hotel. The hotel is more of a family boutique hotel. small, clean and cozy. The rooms are very sweet and clean, the brkf like at home... It is located in a nice area to walk around, not too touristic but close and easy to get to the center. Go check Pedro and Federico, they will treat you like friends.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Suite Dreams”
Reviews.Author: Smiler99
Reviews.Content: A truly fantastic find: really helpful owners and staff, boutique-feel, spotlessly clean, modern, good value, excellent location, quiet, free WiFi, an independent venture, amazing bathrooms... I could go on. - Stupidly I managed to leave my laptop in the taxi and only noticed when checking in - thankfully the taxi driver came back (phew!) but in the meantime the staff were incredibly helpful and supportive in trying to track it down by phoning every number they had. For guests only staying a few nights they went beyond the call of duty and I was genuinely impressed. I went with my girlfriend and we both loved it - it really is boutique in style and put together really well which meant she thought I must have paid more than I did which didn't hurt! We could easily walk everywhere we wanted. Breakfast was pretty much self-service but had a good and healthy spread. Check their website & if you can get an available room, stay here as it's a very good 3*+ option. [--]

Reviews.Title: “brand new - clean ,spacious and reasonable and well located”
Reviews.Author: steve1888
Reviews.Content: Very good location, the hotel just opened April 2008. Immaculately clean, quiet, modern, well planned, spacious rooms [finally experienced a spacious shower], it occupies the walk up [or lift]1st floor only of a six story building, along with 5 other 1 floor hotels.Firm queen sized bed, had great sleeps. Air conditioning helpful as Rome was warm during our 3 day stay. Very reasonable, particulary for Rome. Good self serve breakfasts [cereal, fruit salad, formaggio and proscuitto, freshly baked croissants, juice, coffee [interesting coffee/expresso/cappucino machine]. Owner/managers are Federico and Pier- Francesco, excellent helpful hosts. They gladly provided much helpful information for transit, tried to help with checking in for our flights returning home , etc. We had booked another hotel but were told of this hotel by the hostess at another spot we stayed and cancelled our 1st booking about 2 weeks in advance.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: cubiod
Reviews.Content: We heard about SuiteDreams from another guest house that happened to be fully booked. We are lucky we stumbled upon this wonderful spot. There are only a handful of rooms at this place making it feel like home. Our room was clean, modern, and most of all comfortable. The two owners were more than helpful during our stay and were always ready to give us advice on where to go and how to get there... SuiteDreams is in a perfect location for seeing all of Rome. We walked everywhere from there and even enjoyed peace and quite at night... Honestly, this is a great place to stay and we highly recommend it.

HotelInfo.Name: SuiteDreams Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: via Modena 5, 00184 Rome, Italy
